Join a World Class Team of the most innovative minds in technology; engineers who thrive in an evolving, fast-paced, matrix-structured environment that is marked by high energy, flexibility, quick learning, and collaboration


How You Will Spend Your Day:

Design and develop high-performance, resilient, automated data pipelines, and data transformation applications that feed our cloud-based Enterprise Data Platform. Partner with business users, senior architects, and infrastructure engineers to form complete end-to end-solutions.

Design and build extensible data acquisition and integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business
Design and implement best-in-class data ingestion strategies and scalable pipelines, data warehouse and data mart structures in the Snowflake data platform
Build and maintain serverless data ingestion & refresh pipelines using Azure cloud services – Azure Data Factory, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Streaming Analytics, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Databricks
Incorporate new data sources from external vendors using streams, flat files, APIs, and databases
Plan & execute using agile methodologies, developing & delivering within predefined sprints
Develop real-time / near real-time data ingestion solutions from web API, Kafka, and Event Based technologies
Develop metadata-driven integration pipelines and data structures and continuing to enhance our data lineage framework

The Skills and Experience You Bring:

Deep implementation experience with building data solutions in the Snowflake platform and the DevOps process associated with code management and migration
Advanced experience with data modeling, table design and mapping business needs to modern data structures and data management best practices
Designing, building, and optimizing data integration architectures across batch, near real-time, and streaming integration requirements
Implementation experience with data pipelines that leverage Azure Data Integration Products (Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Streaming Analytics, Event Hub) and the Snowflake's Snowpipe technology
Broad experience with data management technologies that will enable matching the right technologies to the required schemas and workloads.
Eager to explore how machine learning and artificial intelligence can support business objectives
Ability to succeed in a fast paced, matrix structured environment
Implementation Experience with Data Warehousing (data lakes, operational data stores, integration hubs, etc.) and OLTP database management systems
Working knowledge of:
Azure Gen2 Data Lake
Microsoft SQL Server
Python, R and/or similar analytical languages
Power BI reporting applications
Developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, Python, etc.)
Understanding of Restful Web services / Microservices architectures

What We Offer:

Choose from multiple health plans, best dental available, first day 401k match, 3 weeks PTO, casual dress code, work from home, employer paid professional development, robust wellness offerings, and volunteer hours.


Merchants Fleet is the nation's fastest growing fleet management company, providing flexible funding and service options for organizations that leverage vehicles to run their operations. Merchants Fleet offers comprehensive & customizable fleet solutions, serving as a single source for all vehicle needs. Our programs range from long-term leases to monthly rentals, including unique options such as rent-to-lease and own-to-lease. With over 150,000 managed vehicles nationwide, our expert teams have experience working with nearly every industry, from corporate fleets to last mile delivery to franchise systems. We offer the most high-touch service and innovative experience across the industry, with specialized teams and a FleetTech model that merges fleet with technology to ensure our clients get the best performance out of their fleets. Merchants Fleet is headquartered in Hooksett, New Hampshire, and its Innovation Center is located in the Chicago, Illinois area. For more information, please visit merchantsfleet.com.
Merchants is an award-winning place to work with accolades including; Best & Brightest, Best Company to Work For 2015-2021, Great Place to Work and Coolest Company for Young Professionals.

Overview:

Pariveda is not your average consulting firm. We're growing in New York and looking to add a Solution Architect (Principal cohort) to our dynamic and creative consulting team. Pariveda's people-centric model and mission to grow you towards your highest potential will pave the way to grow you from Principal to Vice President.
Are you tired of feeling like a cog in a machine? Are you ready to make an impact and create change? Are you curious and energized by challenging problems? If you're answering yes to these questions, let's talk. Join our team and be a part of something great.
To learn more about our culture and what you can expect at Pariveda, review our Findamentals – the behaviors that show who we are.
You Can Expect To:
As a member of the New York Management Team you will play an integral role in building our office. The successful candidate will drive sales and delivery while developing a strong team of technologists.
Advance your career to become a Pariveda Vice President through clearly defined expectations, mentorship from executives, and regular opportunities for advancement
Lead Enterprise Solution Design and Implementation – intersection of business and technology, with focus in: Cloud across platforms (AWS, Azure, Google), Mobility, Data Analytics & Insights (Machine Learning), and User-Centered Design
Manage multiple project teams and oversee all aspects of the SDLC including estimation, sprint planning, requirements gathering, architecting, developing, testing, issue/risk management, change control and delivery
Diagnose complex technical and business problems and implement creative solutions that leverage Pariveda’s capabilities to meet our clients’ needs
Manage the account planning process at existing and prospective clients by identifying new or follow-on opportunities
Actively manage project profitability for both our firm and our clients by taking a leadership role in executing the sales process while understanding client and/or partner legal agreements affecting their teams' work
Support company growth by building and maintaining a strong professional network as well as contributing to the recruitment of new employees
Mentor junior colleagues by providing career development goals, meeting regularly, writing and deliver semi-annual reviews, and advocating for their career advancement
Actively represent our culture by leading and participating in efforts around continuous learning, personal and professional development, community service and team building
We Look For:
You will report to the New York Office Managing Vice President. The successful candidate possesses the following critical qualifications:
8+ years of technical and/or management consulting experience architecting enterprise and application solutions
Working knowledge of Agile practices
Extensive client account and project management experience with demonstrated ability to plan and manage the execution of custom development projects and complex client engagements
Current or recent leadership of multiple internal and external teams
Strong local network of IT and business executives and business acumen across a variety of industries and business functions
Recognized as a valued trusted advisor in relationships with clients, colleagues, vendors, and other industry professionals
Ability to build consensus and achieve goals through influence
Passionate and successful in mentoring others and developing their careers
Legally authorized to work for any company in the United States without sponsorship
Pariveda Benefits
Transparent and Equitable Salary
Exceptional 401k – 4% company match
Plenty of paid time off - 4 weeks of vacation time plus 10 holidays
Paid sabbatical after 5 years of service for Principal levels and above
Paid parental leave
Company Ownership through Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) from your very first day at Pariveda
Excellent Healthcare and Wellness
100% company paid premiums for you and your family (medical, dental, vision)
Life Insurance
Short Term and Long Term Disability
Pariveda Solutions aspires that our employee diversity is representative of the markets in which we serve. Employment decisions are based solely on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status (if authorized to work in the U.S.), uniform service member, military or veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability including HIV or AIDS, medical condition, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

POSITION SUMMARYLove solving complex data problem, developing reusable XSL code with XSLT and XSL-FO, and contributing to enterprise solutions and SaaS platforms? Enjoy transforming data into simple to understand and useful information? Benefit from a collaborative, team-oriented environment of likeminded professionals?Then we have the job for you!At O’Neil & Associates we are building innovative, new product support experiences for our public and private sector clients. We leverage cutting edge Desktop and Web user interface technology to deliver products that are both engaging and intuitive for our users. We use the best of the Agile and Scrum methodology to deliver feature rich, high-quality software quickly and act on customer feedback to make it even better. Our products are managed and delivered leveraging an automated CI/CD release pipeline in Azure DevOps to ensure accurate, efficient, secure and consistent deployments. In short, we make great software to efficiently create and deliver exceptionally useful product support content to the desktop, mobile and web platforms.QUALIFICATIONS· Develop and maintain modular reusable XSL code (XSLT and XSL-FO) to support published output and/or transformation of XML data based on requirements· Analyze and document structural/publishing requirements based on industry/customer specifications and source data· Analyze, create, or modify Document Type Definitions (DTDs) and/or schemas to support structural data requirements· Create data mappings to assist development team in automated conversion of data from one format/schema to another output· Professional experience with CSS and HTML when processing XML for content display· Hands-on experience with XML parsing and data conversion· Professional software development experience including at least 3 years building applications on the .NET platform a plus.· Three to five (3-5) years of experience working with at least one markup language (XML, HTML, or SGML) is required· Experience with full software development life cycle practices is required· Prefer experience with C# .NET and\or Perl utilizing XML processing libraries· Working knowledge of SQL Server, TSQL, and SQL· Experience with Git (or other version control systems) and Azure DevOps is a plus· Experience working with XML-structured editing/publishing tools like Arbortext, Framemaker Structured, or other content management system is required· Experience and/or familiarity with implementation/development/utilization of military/aviation/commercial specifications or business rules (S1000D, ATA iSpec, MIL-STD 40051, 3008A, or similar standard) is preferred· A firm grasp of software design patterns and development methodologies like Agile and Scrum· Driven to produce software of the highest quality through self-discipline, engaged communication, and attention to detail· Aptitude for solving real-world business problems with technology as an enabler· BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, is great to have. However, if you are smart, passionate about providing an exceptional user experience and committed to delivering quality solutions, that is ultimately most important to us.RESPONSIBILITIES· Responsible for application design, construction, unit testing and deployment of enterprise products and associated features and services· Architect and design to support minor code refactoring as well as assist with major overhauls of product architecture· Work in conjunction with Product Stakeholders, Systems Analysts and Testing Teams to effectively translate business requirements into product features that serve the end users· Translate and elicit business requirements to create a logical data model that is suitable for physical data modeling· Architect and design data solutions with an emphasis in system and feature configuration· Architect and content data solutions for integration with other enterprise applications· Help define strategy and technical approach for meeting product performance, reliability, usability, scalability and security goals· Act as a mentor for junior Engineers throughout development life cycle· Actively participate in our technical and process steering committees to drive continual improvement across all areas of the development lifecycle· Work effectively with business, systems analysis, software quality and technical staff· Work at the direction of Team lead· As required, support and troubleshoot application issues to complete resolution· Perform any other job-related instructions, as requested with reasonable accommodation· Travel by air or vehicle as requiredWORKING AT ONEILO’Neil and Associates a full-service technology and content development firm with a long history of innovation and growth. We are passionate about finding new ways to help our customers achieve product support experiences worthy of their customers. To do this we employ the best people we can find and provide them with an environment where their creativity, passion, and talent can shine through. We are committed to ensuring that the benefits of our success are shared by everyone. So much so, that as of this year we are now a 100% employee owned company. Don’t worry we saved some shares for you!Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offRelocation assistanceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayWork Location:One locationWork Remotely:NoWork Location: One location

Data Warehouse Architect for Detroit, MI to design, develop, test, maintain & document computer programs and systems, including customer data management processes and strategies; contribute to the establishment & implementation of a Data Governance Procedure; assist with the development of a formal enterprise data strategy & roadmap for technology and architecture; troubleshot program & system malfunctions; interpret the data needs of the business & translate them into physical data models and data designs; expand & modify computer systems; oversee data warehouse structures & platforms; perform root cause analysis & make recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues; develop, document & revise system design processes, test procedures & quality standards; monitor cloud & on-premise data usage; design & implement cloud-based software to extract, transform and load data; lead technical aspects of systems evaluation & vendor selection processes. Requires Master’s in C.S. or a closely-related field & 3 years’ experience utilizing MSSQL database engines, MSSQL clustering and HA/DR configurations; developing & performing ad-hoc queries against MSSQL databases; implementing replication in MSSQL across data centers; designing redundant database systems; developing & maintaining scripts to automate daily tasks; designing monitoring solutions to proactively capture, analyze & resolve database related issues using AS400 Enterprise Manager (OEM); implementing Database Load Balancing using HAProxy for traffic Control between MSSQL Nodes; troubleshooting Database connectivity & other Database related errors on client applications; upgrading & optimizing on-premises database to support Cloud RDS; migrating database environments to Cloud RDS; and defining & creating Parameter groups for engine configuration. Will also accept Bachelor’s degree in said fields and 5 years’ progressive post-Bachelor’s stated experience.

Position may telecommute from Detroit Metropolitan area 2-3 days per week. Mail resume to Kaitlyn Silvestri, Little Caesar Enterprises, Inc., 2211 Woodward Ave., Detroit, MI 48201.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Overview

Veradigm is an integrated data systems and services business that combines data-driven clinical insights with actionable tools for clinical workflow, research, analytics and media. Our solutions are designed to help key healthcare stakeholders to improve the quality, efficiency, and value of healthcare delivery – from biopharma to health plans, healthcare providers, health technology partners, and most importantly, the patients they serve. We are dedicated to simplifying the complicated healthcare system with next-generation healthcare solutions.

The Software Architect will provide input into the use of technology and definition of architectural approaches applied within Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences software solutions to meet the company and customer's long-term requirements.

Responsibilities

Assist development teams in the appropriate selection and use of technical frameworks, platforms and design patterns.

Development and technology planning – provide guidance in best practice and tool use in the design and build of technical frameworks and the applications built on them.
Architecture and design –implement technical solutions or components of complex solutions and ensure their integrity.
Technical design authority – internally recognized as highly competent in technical areas, will review and participate in benchmarking, installation, upgrade, configuration, deployment and testing activity.
Improve quality – investigate and prototype innovative approaches to improve software quality.
Industry knowledge – familiar with industry changes in technology standards, information management, development standards, methods and emerging 3rd party software in order to advise on technology and leverage industry best practice in the design and construction of Allscripts' software products.

Support day to day technical control of development projects by:

Assisting Project Management in planning technical aspects of projects.
Providing regular updates on project status.
Supporting and mentoring of individual junior developers.
Performing detailed technical reviews to ensure design components are being correctly implemented.

Provide input into the best application of technology to create the next generation of Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences solutions.

In concert with other architects within Veradigm Life Sciences create a center of expertise and forum for common component design, reuse and exploitation.
Participate in the definition and documentation of development standards and best practices.
Provide input in the drive for constantly improving the scalability, extensibility, interoperability, reliability, availability and performance of Veradigm Life Sciences software products.

Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS or equivalent experience
7+ yrs relevant work experience, with 2-3 yrs at senior level or equivalent

Required Experience:

Demonstrable understanding of architecture principles and methods, technology and standards
Data modeling and design
Cloud architectures
Data security and governance
Developing efficient cost-effective data transformations and data flows
SQL development
Performance analysis and improvement

Desired Experience:

Cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake and Databricks
Data lakes and data warehouses
Processing big data
Process orchestration and event-based functions
Python and PySpark
Database deployment in CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge and experience building secure platforms in accordance with secure development lifecycle standards, in healthcare setting and EHR data

In compliance with Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act we are disclosing the compensation range for roles that will be or could be performed in Colorado. If the position applied to is not located in Colorado, the following information may not apply. Salary Range: Minimum: $106,752 Salary Maximum:$144,116. Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive (if applicable) will be finalized at offer.

#LI-ALL
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for employment with Allscripts.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Allscripts is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

 Data Lake

Research latest data technologies and develops proof of concept

Plan effective data storage, sharing, and publishing
Develop and update technical documentation

Guide on new architecture, review and approve security standards, development architecture, code, test cases
Coordinate with Offshore team

Strong Experience with Data engineering utilizing Python/PySpark and Spark SQL on AWS EMR

In-depth knowledge and experience of the software development lifecycle
Having experience to work/lead onsite/offshore model team.
Strong communication skills. Able to easily collaborate with peers and customers.
Technical Leadership: driving the team, work through complicated situations, problems. Get things done in very short time duration.
Experience delivering software in an Agile or Lean delivery method
Strong SQL query knowledge
Experience in production support design decisions with our business partners and the rest of the development team members

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Overview

Veradigm is an integrated data systems and services business that combines data-driven clinical insights with actionable tools for clinical workflow, research, analytics and media. Our solutions are designed to help key healthcare stakeholders to improve the quality, efficiency, and value of healthcare delivery – from biopharma to health plans, healthcare providers, health technology partners, and most importantly, the patients they serve. We are dedicated to simplifying the complicated healthcare system with next-generation healthcare solutions.

The Software Architect will provide input into the use of technology and definition of architectural approaches applied within Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences software solutions to meet the company and customer's long-term requirements.

Responsibilities

Assist development teams in the appropriate selection and use of technical frameworks, platforms and design patterns.

Development and technology planning – provide guidance in best practice and tool use in the design and build of technical frameworks and the applications built on them.
Architecture and design –implement technical solutions or components of complex solutions and ensure their integrity.
Technical design authority – internally recognized as highly competent in technical areas, will review and participate in benchmarking, installation, upgrade, configuration, deployment and testing activity.
Improve quality – investigate and prototype innovative approaches to improve software quality.
Industry knowledge – familiar with industry changes in technology standards, information management, development standards, methods and emerging 3rd party software in order to advise on technology and leverage industry best practice in the design and construction of Allscripts' software products.

Support day to day technical control of development projects by:

Assisting Project Management in planning technical aspects of projects.
Providing regular updates on project status.
Supporting and mentoring of individual junior developers.
Performing detailed technical reviews to ensure design components are being correctly implemented.

Provide input into the best application of technology to create the next generation of Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences solutions.

In concert with other architects within Veradigm Life Sciences create a center of expertise and forum for common component design, reuse and exploitation.
Participate in the definition and documentation of development standards and best practices.
Provide input in the drive for constantly improving the scalability, extensibility, interoperability, reliability, availability and performance of Veradigm Life Sciences software products.

Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS or equivalent experience
7+ yrs relevant work experience, with 2-3 yrs at senior level or equivalent

Required Experience:

Demonstrable understanding of architecture principles and methods, technology and standards
Data modeling and design
Cloud architectures
Data security and governance
Developing efficient cost-effective data transformations and data flows
SQL development
Performance analysis and improvement

Desired Experience:

Cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake and Databricks
Data lakes and data warehouses
Processing big data
Process orchestration and event-based functions
Python and PySpark
Database deployment in CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge and experience building secure platforms in accordance with secure development lifecycle standards, in healthcare setting and EHR data

How You Will Spend Your Day:

Design and develop high-performance, resilient, automated data pipelines, and data transformation applications that feed our cloud-based Enterprise Data Platform. Partner with business users, senior architects, and infrastructure engineers to form complete end-to end-solutions.

Design and build extensible data acquisition and integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business
Design and implement best-in-class data ingestion strategies and scalable pipelines, data warehouse and data mart structures in the Snowflake data platform
Build and maintain serverless data ingestion & refresh pipelines using Azure cloud services – Azure Data Factory, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Streaming Analytics, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Databricks
Incorporate new data sources from external vendors using streams, flat files, APIs, and databases
Plan & execute using agile methodologies, developing & delivering within predefined sprints
Develop real-time / near real-time data ingestion solutions from web API, Kafka, and Event Based technologies
Develop metadata-driven integration pipelines and data structures and continuing to enhance our data lineage framework

The Skills and Experience You Bring:

Deep implementation experience with building data solutions in the Snowflake platform and the DevOps process associated with code management and migration
Advanced experience with data modeling, table design and mapping business needs to modern data structures and data management best practices
Designing, building, and optimizing data integration architectures across batch, near real-time, and streaming integration requirements
Implementation experience with data pipelines that leverage Azure Data Integration Products (Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Streaming Analytics, Event Hub) and the Snowflake's Snowpipe technology
Broad experience with data management technologies that will enable matching the right technologies to the required schemas and workloads.
Eager to explore how machine learning and artificial intelligence can support business objectives

Implementation Experience with Data Warehousing (data lakes, operational data stores, integration hubs, etc.) and OLTP database management systems

Azure Gen2 Data Lake
Microsoft SQL Server
Python, R and/or similar analytical languages
Power BI reporting applications

Understanding of Restful Web services / Microservices architectures

MicroHealth is seeking a full-time Health Data Architect to be part of our team at our HQ in Vienna, VA.
The Data Architect will define a plan that supports both the strategic and tactical solution for maturing the enterprise reporting and analytics environment. The plan will also include the tactical solution, to include technology that enables a governed, nimble, optimized environment that includes, but is not limited to; a standard enterprise data model, re-design, or creation of various data models that align with industry best practices. Conceptual, logical, and physical data models will be developed to support data persistence. Solutions will be postured to support cloud enablement.
**Some Travel may be required.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Work as a health data scientist, identifying and integrating new datasets that can be leveraged through our product capabilities and work closely with the engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products
Devise and utilize algorithms and models to mine big data stores, perform data and error analysis to improve models, and clean and validate data for uniformity and accuracy
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns

Qualifications and Skills:
Master’s in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field preferred
Experience with the following software/tools: R, SQL, and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java, or C++ is an asset
Health data experience is a must
5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models
Experience using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Knowledge and experience working with and creating data architectures, and statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining social network analysis, etc.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques i.e. (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
Comfort working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several ongoing concurrent projects
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development
Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean preferred
Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee frequently is required to walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand. The employee may lift or move objects up to 5 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

BairesDev is proud to be one of the fastest-growing companies in Latin America and a welcoming, highly rated employer (Glassdoor Employee Score: 4.3). With more than 3500 employees in 27 countries and world-class clients from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies, we’re only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. BairesDev runs on talent. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of IT Talent and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects for companies like Google, Pinterest, and Udemy.
We are looking for Data Scientist Engineers for Home-based modality to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!

These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
Main Activities:
Work together with developers, tech leads and solution architects to build applications.Improve existing structures by adding new functionalities or proposing technological updates so that as a result, the impact of your contribution is significant in the core of each business.The result of your work will also allow you to improve the user experience on scalable and high availability platforms, contributing to the key differential of each business.
What are we looking for:
6+ years of experience working as a developer.5+ years of experience in Data Scientist.Proficient with analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving.Hands-on experience with managing data loads and data quality a plus.Advanced English level.
BairesDev Offers:
100% remote work.
- Flexible hours - make your own schedule!
Diverse and multicultural work environment.Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.Hardware setup for you to work from home.
Excellent compensation — well above the market average.Extensive opportunities for growth and professional development thanks to our mentoring system.

At BairesDev, remote work is at our core. Enjoy the opportunity to have a dynamic lifestyle, better health, and wellness. Find renewed passion in your job, improve your productivity, and benefit from attractive growth opportunities for your career.

If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

Join a World Class Team of the most innovative minds in technology; engineers who thrive in an evolving, fast-paced, matrix-structured environment that is marked by high energy, flexibility, quick learning, and collaboration


How You Will Spend Your Day:

Design and develop high-performance, resilient, automated data pipelines, and data transformation applications that feed our cloud-based Enterprise Data Platform. Partner with business users, senior architects, and infrastructure engineers to form complete end-to end-solutions.

Design and build extensible data acquisition and integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business
Design and implement best-in-class data ingestion strategies and scalable pipelines, data warehouse and data mart structures in the Snowflake data platform
Build and maintain serverless data ingestion & refresh pipelines using Azure cloud services – Azure Data Factory, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Streaming Analytics, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Databricks
Incorporate new data sources from external vendors using streams, flat files, APIs, and databases
Plan & execute using agile methodologies, developing & delivering within predefined sprints
Develop real-time / near real-time data ingestion solutions from web API, Kafka, and Event Based technologies
Develop metadata-driven integration pipelines and data structures and continuing to enhance our data lineage framework

The Skills and Experience You Bring:

Deep implementation experience with building data solutions in the Snowflake platform and the DevOps process associated with code management and migration
Advanced experience with data modeling, table design and mapping business needs to modern data structures and data management best practices
Designing, building, and optimizing data integration architectures across batch, near real-time, and streaming integration requirements
Implementation experience with data pipelines that leverage Azure Data Integration Products (Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Streaming Analytics, Event Hub) and the Snowflake's Snowpipe technology
Broad experience with data management technologies that will enable matching the right technologies to the required schemas and workloads.
Eager to explore how machine learning and artificial intelligence can support business objectives
Ability to succeed in a fast paced, matrix structured environment
Implementation Experience with Data Warehousing (data lakes, operational data stores, integration hubs, etc.) and OLTP database management systems
Working knowledge of:
Azure Gen2 Data Lake
Microsoft SQL Server
Python, R and/or similar analytical languages
Power BI reporting applications
Developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, Python, etc.)
Understanding of Restful Web services / Microservices architectures

What We Offer:

Choose from multiple health plans, best dental available, first day 401k match, 3 weeks PTO, casual dress code, work from home, employer paid professional development, robust wellness offerings, and volunteer hours.


Merchants Fleet is the nation's fastest growing fleet management company, providing flexible funding and service options for organizations that leverage vehicles to run their operations. Merchants Fleet offers comprehensive & customizable fleet solutions, serving as a single source for all vehicle needs. Our programs range from long-term leases to monthly rentals, including unique options such as rent-to-lease and own-to-lease. With over 150,000 managed vehicles nationwide, our expert teams have experience working with nearly every industry, from corporate fleets to last mile delivery to franchise systems. We offer the most high-touch service and innovative experience across the industry, with specialized teams and a FleetTech model that merges fleet with technology to ensure our clients get the best performance out of their fleets. Merchants Fleet is headquartered in Hooksett, New Hampshire, and its Innovation Center is located in the Chicago, Illinois area. For more information, please visit merchantsfleet.com.
Merchants is an award-winning place to work with accolades including; Best & Brightest, Best Company to Work For 2015-2021, Great Place to Work and Coolest Company for Young Professionals.

For more than 160 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE.

Our Commercial Lines team is currently seeking a Data Architect in our Worcester, MA location or remote work location consideration.

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
P&C insurance knowledge a plus
Knowledge of the ACORD message model for P&C a plus
Conceptualization: To visualize the solution, process or infrastructure that is required to satisfy the business requirement
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the exploration and introduction of new opportunities that add to the business value proposition or reduce costs. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Results-driven Attitude: To be firmly in control of delivering an appropriate solution based on Enterprise Architecture principles and compliance rules within required timeframes. Motivation that is focused on long-term results.
Enterprise Perspective: To understand the broader implications of strategy across all business units, while visualizing the project-level implications. Makes decisions and recommendations clearly linked to the organization’s strategy and financial goals.
Foresight: To manage the short-term, medium-term and long-term planning horizons concurrently which includes breaking long-term projects into deliverable and meaningful business solutions.
Consensus Building: To enable a group of people with diverse backgrounds to accept a majority or common conclusion without damaging relationships.
Facilitation: To guide a debate without forcing a conclusion while both ensuring all participants have an opportunity to voice ideas and opinions and keeping the discussion on target.
Leadership: The ability to influence a broad audience to adopt a particular path and be respected as a leader regardless of position/role in the organization.
Logic: To select the best solution from a range of options to resolve an issue or seize an opportunity.
Communication: To effectively convey the results of the architecture, the process to develop it and the value it provides by demonstrating the applicability of technology to the business. This includes both written and oral communication and the ability to scale these communications from technical to business focused in nature.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At the Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

Benefits include:

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO
9 company holidays
Flexible work arrangements
On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)

The company provides equal opportunity for employment and promotion to all qualified employees and applicants on the basis of experience, training, education, and ability to do the available work without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex/gender, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, ancestry or any other status protected by law.

Furthermore, The Hanover Insurance Group is committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace that is free of discrimination and harassment based on national origin, race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.”

As an equal opportunity employer, Hanover does not discriminate against qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation, as a candidate for employment, please inform The Hanover Talent Acquisition office.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Overview

Veradigm is an integrated data systems and services business that combines data-driven clinical insights with actionable tools for clinical workflow, research, analytics and media. Our solutions are designed to help key healthcare stakeholders to improve the quality, efficiency, and value of healthcare delivery – from biopharma to health plans, healthcare providers, health technology partners, and most importantly, the patients they serve. We are dedicated to simplifying the complicated healthcare system with next-generation healthcare solutions.

The Software Architect will provide input into the use of technology and definition of architectural approaches applied within Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences software solutions to meet the company and customer's long-term requirements.

Responsibilities

Assist development teams in the appropriate selection and use of technical frameworks, platforms and design patterns.

Development and technology planning – provide guidance in best practice and tool use in the design and build of technical frameworks and the applications built on them.
Architecture and design –implement technical solutions or components of complex solutions and ensure their integrity.
Technical design authority – internally recognized as highly competent in technical areas, will review and participate in benchmarking, installation, upgrade, configuration, deployment and testing activity.
Improve quality – investigate and prototype innovative approaches to improve software quality.
Industry knowledge – familiar with industry changes in technology standards, information management, development standards, methods and emerging 3rd party software in order to advise on technology and leverage industry best practice in the design and construction of Allscripts' software products.

Support day to day technical control of development projects by:

Assisting Project Management in planning technical aspects of projects.
Providing regular updates on project status.
Supporting and mentoring of individual junior developers.
Performing detailed technical reviews to ensure design components are being correctly implemented.

Provide input into the best application of technology to create the next generation of Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences solutions.

In concert with other architects within Veradigm Life Sciences create a center of expertise and forum for common component design, reuse and exploitation.
Participate in the definition and documentation of development standards and best practices.
Provide input in the drive for constantly improving the scalability, extensibility, interoperability, reliability, availability and performance of Veradigm Life Sciences software products.

Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS or equivalent experience
7+ yrs relevant work experience, with 2-3 yrs at senior level or equivalent

Required Experience:

Demonstrable understanding of architecture principles and methods, technology and standards
Data modeling and design
Cloud architectures
Data security and governance
Developing efficient cost-effective data transformations and data flows
SQL development
Performance analysis and improvement

Desired Experience:

Cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake and Databricks
Data lakes and data warehouses
Processing big data
Process orchestration and event-based functions
Python and PySpark
Database deployment in CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge and experience building secure platforms in accordance with secure development lifecycle standards, in healthcare setting and EHR data

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Allscripts is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Preferred Qualifications:

Design and implement effective Analytics solutions and models with Snowflake.
Experience of using one/more scalable (MPP) relational databases such as Teradata, Netezza, Redshift, Snowflake and SQL data warehouse for advanced analytics

2+ years of experience in examine and identify Datawarehouse structural necessities by evaluating business requirements.
Experience in participating in data modeling and in developing conceptual and logical data models
Recommend solutions to improve new and existing Datawarehouse solutions.
Excellent communication, presentation and speaking skills

Proven analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to lead large complex projects with limited direction.

About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.
With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
Please visit www.Infosys.com for more information regarding our company, benefits and life as an Infoscion.

Why Work at Lenovo
Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive.
And we go big. No, not big—huge.
We’re not just a Fortune 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re in 180 countries, working with 63,000 brilliant colleagues and counting. And we’re known for the world’s most complete portfolio of smart technology, from devices to software to infrastructure.
With our ingenuity, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.
The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...
Description and Requirements
We are looking for a Data Architect, someone who challenges the ordinary and seeks to innovate in learning, while also balancing execution. As a Data Architect, you'll be a part of the Data & Architecture team that supports Lenovo’s Chief Information Office, and your mission will be to build a clean and governed data architecture for Lenovo.
Responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:
Work with cross-functional stakeholders to understand the business process and build and review conceptual and logical models.
Convert logical models to the solution and physical models and generate DDLs for implementation.
Review the models in-depth to ensure compliance with data modeling standards
Facilitate and resolve conflicts while merging cross-domain models
Work with the program manager to understand the project requirements and work towards accomplishing sprint goals.
Work with the data ingestion team for proper implementation of physical models in the database.
Review the physical tables to ensure all business rules and relationships have been addressed.
Design the Enterprise Data Warehouse physical implementation star schema
Design analytical models that support complex data analytical reporting.
Position Requirements:
5 years of professional experience in developing Entity Relationship Diagrams and Dimensional Models.
5 years of professional experience in Data Modeling tools such as ER/Studio Data Architect or ERwin.
5 years of experience in writing SQL scripts
Bachelor’s Degree with equivalent work experience of 5 years
Professional Skill Requirements:
Ability to work with diverse teams across the globe with flexibility in time zone challenges
Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral), and interpersonal skills
Skilled in explaining complex findings and approaches to nontechnical or junior-level audience
Knowledge of Agile Methodology
Strong customer focus experience
Experience in making data meaningful to the customer
Logical data model development using a top down business narrative approach applying naming standards of modifier/primer/class words

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Overview

Veradigm is an integrated data systems and services business that combines data-driven clinical insights with actionable tools for clinical workflow, research, analytics and media. Our solutions are designed to help key healthcare stakeholders to improve the quality, efficiency, and value of healthcare delivery – from biopharma to health plans, healthcare providers, health technology partners, and most importantly, the patients they serve. We are dedicated to simplifying the complicated healthcare system with next-generation healthcare solutions.

The Software Architect will provide input into the use of technology and definition of architectural approaches applied within Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences software solutions to meet the company and customer's long-term requirements.

Responsibilities

Assist development teams in the appropriate selection and use of technical frameworks, platforms and design patterns.

Development and technology planning – provide guidance in best practice and tool use in the design and build of technical frameworks and the applications built on them.
Architecture and design –implement technical solutions or components of complex solutions and ensure their integrity.
Technical design authority – internally recognized as highly competent in technical areas, will review and participate in benchmarking, installation, upgrade, configuration, deployment and testing activity.
Improve quality – investigate and prototype innovative approaches to improve software quality.
Industry knowledge – familiar with industry changes in technology standards, information management, development standards, methods and emerging 3rd party software in order to advise on technology and leverage industry best practice in the design and construction of Allscripts' software products.

Support day to day technical control of development projects by:

Assisting Project Management in planning technical aspects of projects.
Providing regular updates on project status.
Supporting and mentoring of individual junior developers.
Performing detailed technical reviews to ensure design components are being correctly implemented.

Provide input into the best application of technology to create the next generation of Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences solutions.

In concert with other architects within Veradigm Life Sciences create a center of expertise and forum for common component design, reuse and exploitation.
Participate in the definition and documentation of development standards and best practices.
Provide input in the drive for constantly improving the scalability, extensibility, interoperability, reliability, availability and performance of Veradigm Life Sciences software products.

Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS or equivalent experience
7+ yrs relevant work experience, with 2-3 yrs at senior level or equivalent

Required Experience:

Demonstrable understanding of architecture principles and methods, technology and standards
Data modeling and design
Cloud architectures
Data security and governance
Developing efficient cost-effective data transformations and data flows
SQL development
Performance analysis and improvement

Desired Experience:

Cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake and Databricks
Data lakes and data warehouses
Processing big data
Process orchestration and event-based functions
Python and PySpark
Database deployment in CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge and experience building secure platforms in accordance with secure development lifecycle standards, in healthcare setting and EHR data

For more than 160 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE.

Our Commercial Lines team is currently seeking a Data Architect in our Worcester, MA location or remote work location consideration.

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
P&C insurance knowledge a plus
Knowledge of the ACORD message model for P&C a plus
Conceptualization: To visualize the solution, process or infrastructure that is required to satisfy the business requirement
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the exploration and introduction of new opportunities that add to the business value proposition or reduce costs. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Results-driven Attitude: To be firmly in control of delivering an appropriate solution based on Enterprise Architecture principles and compliance rules within required timeframes. Motivation that is focused on long-term results.
Enterprise Perspective: To understand the broader implications of strategy across all business units, while visualizing the project-level implications. Makes decisions and recommendations clearly linked to the organization’s strategy and financial goals.
Foresight: To manage the short-term, medium-term and long-term planning horizons concurrently which includes breaking long-term projects into deliverable and meaningful business solutions.
Consensus Building: To enable a group of people with diverse backgrounds to accept a majority or common conclusion without damaging relationships.
Facilitation: To guide a debate without forcing a conclusion while both ensuring all participants have an opportunity to voice ideas and opinions and keeping the discussion on target.
Leadership: The ability to influence a broad audience to adopt a particular path and be respected as a leader regardless of position/role in the organization.
Logic: To select the best solution from a range of options to resolve an issue or seize an opportunity.
Communication: To effectively convey the results of the architecture, the process to develop it and the value it provides by demonstrating the applicability of technology to the business. This includes both written and oral communication and the ability to scale these communications from technical to business focused in nature.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At the Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

Benefits include:

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO
9 company holidays
Flexible work arrangements
On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)

Furthermore, The Hanover Insurance Group is committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace that is free of discrimination and harassment based on national origin, race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.”

.Support for development and maintenance of Oracle Data Warehouse to support OBIEE and BIP reporting tools.

The applicant is responsible for the successful delivery of business intelligence information to the entire organization and is experienced in Data Warehouse and BI development and implementations. The applicant will be involved in gathering of business requirements and creating technical designs.
It involves designing, developing, and supporting new and current ETL processes employing industry standards and best practices to enhance loading of data from and into different source/ target systems. The data warehouse developer’s role in an organization includes providing support to the organization’s business requirements in the application and consumption of information from the Data Warehouse.
The applicant will be part of the team to review, analyze, modify, and create ETLs, testing, debugging, integration and implementation processes. Task will also include documenting technical needs for ETL processes and databases, and ensuring optimal technical infrastructure is utilized.
This position involves the delivering of huge data integration projects and would therefore require leveraging best practices expertise and experience at implementation; as well as effective technology know-how.

 Experienced SQL and PL/SQL developer on Oracle database platform.
 Deep understanding of data warehouse and star schema
 Develop ETL scripts and write PL/SQL code from data model, dataflow diagram and technical design specifications
 Ability to work on wide variety of development needs from simple queries to complex queries and multidimensional analysis
 Ability to follow best coding standards practices
 Expert in performance tuning of ETL/SQL code
 Analyze and provide resolutions for production data issues
 Familiar with Unix shell scripting and job automation
 Build and implement BI dashboards, analysis using OBIEE
 Build reports using BI publisher

Our Commercial Lines team is currently seeking a Data Architect in our Worcester, MA location or remote work location consideration.

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
P&C insurance knowledge a plus
Knowledge of the ACORD message model for P&C a plus
Conceptualization: To visualize the solution, process or infrastructure that is required to satisfy the business requirement
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the exploration and introduction of new opportunities that add to the business value proposition or reduce costs. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Results-driven Attitude: To be firmly in control of delivering an appropriate solution based on Enterprise Architecture principles and compliance rules within required timeframes. Motivation that is focused on long-term results.
Enterprise Perspective: To understand the broader implications of strategy across all business units, while visualizing the project-level implications. Makes decisions and recommendations clearly linked to the organization’s strategy and financial goals.
Foresight: To manage the short-term, medium-term and long-term planning horizons concurrently which includes breaking long-term projects into deliverable and meaningful business solutions.
Consensus Building: To enable a group of people with diverse backgrounds to accept a majority or common conclusion without damaging relationships.
Facilitation: To guide a debate without forcing a conclusion while both ensuring all participants have an opportunity to voice ideas and opinions and keeping the discussion on target.
Leadership: The ability to influence a broad audience to adopt a particular path and be respected as a leader regardless of position/role in the organization.
Logic: To select the best solution from a range of options to resolve an issue or seize an opportunity.
Communication: To effectively convey the results of the architecture, the process to develop it and the value it provides by demonstrating the applicability of technology to the business. This includes both written and oral communication and the ability to scale these communications from technical to business focused in nature.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At the Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

Benefits include:

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO
9 company holidays
Flexible work arrangements
On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)

The company provides equal opportunity for employment and promotion to all qualified employees and applicants on the basis of experience, training, education, and ability to do the available work without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex/gender, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, ancestry or any other status protected by law.

Furthermore, The Hanover Insurance Group is committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace that is free of discrimination and harassment based on national origin, race, color, religion, gender, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.”
