Position: Data warehouse ArchitectLocation: Denver, CO (Onsite from day 1)long term contract Job description:Minimum 5 years exp on Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and DataMarts Data ArchitectureCollects evaluate, and prepares data analysis and/or other complex statistics on databases for a specific business unitPrepares data quality analysis (DQA) artifacts, including recommendations and data profiles used in the analysis and interpretation of data as appropriate.Ensures quality control of databases through the development and maintenance of test plans and quality control procedures and may assist in the development and implementation of measurement systems.The candidate will be required to discover, analyze, profile and document findings on source data systems.The candidate will assist the development team during the dev phase to resolve data issues and understand data constraints. Once development activities are completed the candidate will drive the initial system testing of the final application data output to ensure it is consistent with the source data system.The ideal candidate will be a self-starting individual who is able to drive into details and quickly provide summary-level readouts of the source data. The position requires very strong communication skills as the candidate will be required to interact on a daily basis with all levels within the organization, including developers, architects, business users, and management.The candidate will be expected to proactively drive to improve processes and methods around Data Analysis. This could include helping define standards and procedures; refining methods and techniques for information modeling, recommending tools to improve delivery timeframes.Requirements:Experience with SQL, Erwin data modeling tools is desiredExperience Snowflake/Redshift and/or another relational database requiredExperience with very large databases and knowledge of communication domain preferred.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Remotely:No

For more than 160 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE.

Our Commercial Lines team is currently seeking a Data Architect in our Worcester, MA location or remote work location consideration.

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
P&C insurance knowledge a plus
Knowledge of the ACORD message model for P&C a plus
Conceptualization: To visualize the solution, process or infrastructure that is required to satisfy the business requirement
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the exploration and introduction of new opportunities that add to the business value proposition or reduce costs. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Results-driven Attitude: To be firmly in control of delivering an appropriate solution based on Enterprise Architecture principles and compliance rules within required timeframes. Motivation that is focused on long-term results.
Enterprise Perspective: To understand the broader implications of strategy across all business units, while visualizing the project-level implications. Makes decisions and recommendations clearly linked to the organization’s strategy and financial goals.
Foresight: To manage the short-term, medium-term and long-term planning horizons concurrently which includes breaking long-term projects into deliverable and meaningful business solutions.
Consensus Building: To enable a group of people with diverse backgrounds to accept a majority or common conclusion without damaging relationships.
Facilitation: To guide a debate without forcing a conclusion while both ensuring all participants have an opportunity to voice ideas and opinions and keeping the discussion on target.
Leadership: The ability to influence a broad audience to adopt a particular path and be respected as a leader regardless of position/role in the organization.
Logic: To select the best solution from a range of options to resolve an issue or seize an opportunity.
Communication: To effectively convey the results of the architecture, the process to develop it and the value it provides by demonstrating the applicability of technology to the business. This includes both written and oral communication and the ability to scale these communications from technical to business focused in nature.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At the Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

Benefits include:

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO
9 company holidays
Flexible work arrangements
On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
Overview

Veradigm is an integrated data systems and services business that combines data-driven clinical insights with actionable tools for clinical workflow, research, analytics and media. Our solutions are designed to help key healthcare stakeholders to improve the quality, efficiency, and value of healthcare delivery – from biopharma to health plans, healthcare providers, health technology partners, and most importantly, the patients they serve. We are dedicated to simplifying the complicated healthcare system with next-generation healthcare solutions.

The Software Architect will provide input into the use of technology and definition of architectural approaches applied within Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences software solutions to meet the company and customer's long-term requirements.

Responsibilities

Assist development teams in the appropriate selection and use of technical frameworks, platforms and design patterns.

Development and technology planning – provide guidance in best practice and tool use in the design and build of technical frameworks and the applications built on them.
Architecture and design –implement technical solutions or components of complex solutions and ensure their integrity.
Technical design authority – internally recognized as highly competent in technical areas, will review and participate in benchmarking, installation, upgrade, configuration, deployment and testing activity.
Improve quality – investigate and prototype innovative approaches to improve software quality.
Industry knowledge – familiar with industry changes in technology standards, information management, development standards, methods and emerging 3rd party software in order to advise on technology and leverage industry best practice in the design and construction of Allscripts' software products.

Support day to day technical control of development projects by:

Assisting Project Management in planning technical aspects of projects.
Providing regular updates on project status.
Supporting and mentoring of individual junior developers.
Performing detailed technical reviews to ensure design components are being correctly implemented.

Provide input into the best application of technology to create the next generation of Allscripts' Veradigm Life Sciences solutions.

In concert with other architects within Veradigm Life Sciences create a center of expertise and forum for common component design, reuse and exploitation.
Participate in the definition and documentation of development standards and best practices.
Provide input in the drive for constantly improving the scalability, extensibility, interoperability, reliability, availability and performance of Veradigm Life Sciences software products.

Qualifications

Academic and Professional Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree with a major in Computer Science, Mathematics, MIS or equivalent experience
7+ yrs relevant work experience, with 2-3 yrs at senior level or equivalent

Required Experience:

Demonstrable understanding of architecture principles and methods, technology and standards
Data modeling and design
Cloud architectures
Data security and governance
Developing efficient cost-effective data transformations and data flows
SQL development
Performance analysis and improvement

Desired Experience:

Cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake and Databricks
Data lakes and data warehouses
Processing big data
Process orchestration and event-based functions
Python and PySpark
Database deployment in CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge and experience building secure platforms in accordance with secure development lifecycle standards, in healthcare setting and EHR data

#LI-ALL
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for employment with Allscripts.

Visa Sponsorship is not offered for this position.

At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

Allscripts' policy is to provide equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in all of its employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for North American based positions with Allscripts must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Allscripts is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursing and hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Thank you for reviewing this Allscripts opportunity! Does this look like a great match for your skill set? If so, scroll on down and tell us more about yourself!

local candidates strongly preferred

.Support for development and maintenance of Oracle Data Warehouse to support OBIEE and BIP reporting tools.

The applicant is responsible for the successful delivery of business intelligence information to the entire organization and is experienced in Data Warehouse and BI development and implementations. The applicant will be involved in gathering of business requirements and creating technical designs.
It involves designing, developing, and supporting new and current ETL processes employing industry standards and best practices to enhance loading of data from and into different source/ target systems. The data warehouse developer’s role in an organization includes providing support to the organization’s business requirements in the application and consumption of information from the Data Warehouse.
The applicant will be part of the team to review, analyze, modify, and create ETLs, testing, debugging, integration and implementation processes. Task will also include documenting technical needs for ETL processes and databases, and ensuring optimal technical infrastructure is utilized.
This position involves the delivering of huge data integration projects and would therefore require leveraging best practices expertise and experience at implementation; as well as effective technology know-how.

 Experienced SQL and PL/SQL developer on Oracle database platform.
 Deep understanding of data warehouse and star schema
 Develop ETL scripts and write PL/SQL code from data model, dataflow diagram and technical design specifications
 Ability to work on wide variety of development needs from simple queries to complex queries and multidimensional analysis
 Ability to follow best coding standards practices
 Expert in performance tuning of ETL/SQL code
 Analyze and provide resolutions for production data issues
 Familiar with Unix shell scripting and job automation
 Build and implement BI dashboards, analysis using OBIEE
 Build reports using BI publisher

For more than 160 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE.

Our Commercial Lines team is currently seeking a Data Architect in our Worcester, MA location or remote work location consideration.

This is a full time, exempt role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Data Architect provides overall technology leadership, direction, guidance and definition of an information architecture that effectively supports the commercial lines Business Strategy. This Architecture position requires data design, modeling, and governance experience.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Gather and analyze data and data requirements and develop the more complex logical and physical database designs and data models in support of enterprise information management.
Gather and analyze data integration requirements and develop XML schemas in support of system integration.
Work with other architects, applications and systems teams to ensure database designs and data models support the integration of data/information flow across systems and platforms.
Work with Database administrators, architects, and application development leads on physical database attributes, including DDL and DML scripts.
Develop application integration architectures with ability to deploy data integration using a wide variety of data delivery styles, and deployment patterns.
Contribute to technical approach, high level and detailed design of the project in accordance with architectural standards
Provide guidance and oversight of source to target mapping and business rules.
Assist with the development and enforcement of methodologies and standards for data modeling and XML Schema design.
Coach and mentor less experienced members of the data architecture team.
Develop process for capturing and maintaining metadata from all operational, ODS and data warehousing components
Contribute to and create documentation related to architecture, design, planning, and overall management of Enterprise Data Integration.
Develop architecture as per data architecture standards and best practices, including ACORD, data naming standards, etc.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

Degree in business management, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, system analysis or a related field of study
5-8 years of overall Information systems, services / consulting experience of which the recent 3+ years in data architecture and data related fields
Ability to elicit data requirements with both a current and future lens for Commercial Lines as well as across the enterprise
Ability to conduct translation of business questions and requirements into data objects
Ability to work in all phases of database and XML schema design and data modeling activities
Ability to work on data architecture projects independently with minimal or no oversight required
Thorough knowledge of Data architectures, functions, and features
Strong SQL skills across multiple platforms (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server) and data design patterns
Ability to diagram data flow through applications, integration processes, and ODS/EDW components
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills
P&C insurance knowledge a plus
Knowledge of the ACORD message model for P&C a plus
Conceptualization: To visualize the solution, process or infrastructure that is required to satisfy the business requirement
Innovation: Motivated to improve organizational performance through the exploration and introduction of new opportunities that add to the business value proposition or reduce costs. Develops new ways of looking at a situation.
Results-driven Attitude: To be firmly in control of delivering an appropriate solution based on Enterprise Architecture principles and compliance rules within required timeframes. Motivation that is focused on long-term results.
Enterprise Perspective: To understand the broader implications of strategy across all business units, while visualizing the project-level implications. Makes decisions and recommendations clearly linked to the organization’s strategy and financial goals.
Foresight: To manage the short-term, medium-term and long-term planning horizons concurrently which includes breaking long-term projects into deliverable and meaningful business solutions.
Consensus Building: To enable a group of people with diverse backgrounds to accept a majority or common conclusion without damaging relationships.
Facilitation: To guide a debate without forcing a conclusion while both ensuring all participants have an opportunity to voice ideas and opinions and keeping the discussion on target.
Leadership: The ability to influence a broad audience to adopt a particular path and be respected as a leader regardless of position/role in the organization.
Logic: To select the best solution from a range of options to resolve an issue or seize an opportunity.
Communication: To effectively convey the results of the architecture, the process to develop it and the value it provides by demonstrating the applicability of technology to the business. This includes both written and oral communication and the ability to scale these communications from technical to business focused in nature.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At the Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

Benefits include:

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO
9 company holidays
Flexible work arrangements
On-site medical/wellness center (Worcester only)

Advanced understanding of reactive and functional programming
Advanced knowledge of RxJs and NgRx (or similar state management library)
Skilled at modeling and orchestrating state through a server & database

More information about this job:
Overview:
FM Global is a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses, providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.
We are currently hiring Solution Architects/Senior Solution Architects to support several exciting new initiatives launching in 2021. Many of these positions will have the opportunity to work with the newest technologies such as Azure or AWS messaging and eventing, APIs, Data Lake, SPAs and more.

Responsibilities:
The Solution Architect/Senior Solution Architect is the driving force behind the delivery of product level technical solutions. By guiding the selection and implementation of appropriate technologies, the Solution Architect ensures that solutions are secure, accurate, performant, maintainable and aligned with Enterprise Architecture standards and patterns.
The Solution Architect/Senior Solution Architect is the technical partner to one or more Product Owners and is responsible for deeply understanding the prioritized backlog and envisioning how to effectively design and deliver high-value features while reducing technology-related risk and minimizing technical debt.
The Solution Architect/Senior Solution Architect is an experienced system designer who amplifies the capability of teams to effectively deliver solutions. This is done by leading teams to execute on technical delivery commitments including design, implementation, end to end testing, and release to production.
Solution Architects/Senior Solution Architects remain intimately engaged with technical solutions by actively reviewing technical designs and implementations. They are offered the opportunity to continuously develop their skillsets by contributing to the implementation of POCs and product features, as well as through participation in guilds, training, and conferences.
Qualifications:
Education
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
Experience
10+ years of application development experience with large scale business applications in agile or fast-paced development environment
5+ years designing, developing, and implementing business applications from business concept through to production
3+ years experience leading business application development teams of 5+ team members
Skills/Knowledge
Solid knowledge of .Net development, including experience working on initiatives that included full stack development of multi-tiered distributed systems implemented based on clean architecture patterns, involving complex business domains, either relational or non-relational persistent storage, and web or desktop user interfaces (e.g. Angular or WPF).
Experience building systems with high security standards. Familiarity with common vulnerabilities and attack vectors and how to prevent them.
Experience building cloud native applications or migrating applications to the cloud a plus.
Demonstrable ability to break large architectural and implementation problems into logical smaller solutions.
Ability to define, maintain, and manage architecture models and artifacts (e.g. current and future state application architecture diagrams, data models, etc.).
Ability to influence and persuade Product Owners and team members to support proposed architectural changes.
Ability to mentor team members to improve their understanding of good software design practice and implementation strategy (CICD, test automation etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to tailor message to audience.
Ability to communicate sophisticated technology concepts to non-technical audiences.
Able to build consensus and align teams on strategic architectural direction and technical decisions.
Solid understanding of and ability to communicate objectives and benefits of modern architectural standards, patterns, and practices.
We offer our employees a wide range of benefits including career long learning opportunities, tuition reimbursement, 401 (k), pension, flexible schedules, rich health and well-being programs, generous time off allowances, volunteer days and so much more!
FM Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing and retaining a diverse workforce.
Please note that all FM Global visitors, including external candidates interviewing for open positions will be required to be vaccinated and should be prepared to provide proof of vaccination.

Requisition ID: 47167
Whirlpool Corporation (NYSE: WHR) is committed to being the best global kitchen and laundry company, in constant pursuit of improving life at home. In an increasingly digital world, the company is driving purposeful innovation to meet the evolving needs of consumers through its iconic brand portfolio, including Whirlpool, KitchenAid, Maytag, Consul, Brastemp, Amana, Bauknecht, JennAir, Indesit and Yummly. In 2020, the company reported approximately $19 billion in annual sales, 78,000 employees and 57 manufacturing and technology research centers.
Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by FORTUNE as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Integrity, Respect, Inclusion & Diversity, One Whirlpool, and Spirit of Winning propel our teams to excellence. Get to know us and see what it's like to be part of a company that is in constant pursuit of improving life at home.
This role in summary
As the Development Operations (DevOps) Architect / Tech Lead for the North America Digital Platform your role is to act under minimal direction, leading the strategy, design & review of Development Operations (DevOps) and managing the Application Management Support teams as it relates to both day to day operations as well as moderately complex projects & enhancements in the e-commerce and Digital space at Whirlpool Corporation.
This role is in the Global Information Systems Ecommerce & Marketing team and will mainly support Whirlpool North America (US, Canada, Mexico), but you will also be expected to collaborate and coordinate with groups across the globe.
Your responsibilities will include
Set overall vision, feature, development/content strategy, and implementation roadmap for CI / CD, Delivery and automation tools and frameworks that support the DevOps teams processes such as, but not limited to: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Sonarqube, Nexus, TestNG, Selenium, XRay Testing, and JMeter
Drive execution of this roadmap and strategy, collaborating closely with internal and external team members
Accountable for evaluating and implementing tools, strategies, and processes associated with managing, delivering, and deploying configuration as code
Implement monitoring solutions that identify system bottlenecks, failure points, and production issues
Accountable for evaluating, revising, expanding and improving Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and established end-user processes, procedures, and policies as it relates to the key stakeholders/end users
Accountable for authoring and maintaining applicable system/solution documentation for the CI / CD and Delivery infrastructure, app dev, app design, and related processes
Actively participate in the evaluation of end-user utilization of systems, adherence to processes, and outputs of key metrics
Accountable for establishing key reporting and analytical strategies and desired outputs to enable key process stakeholders key metrics & system-generated outputs to support the following, but not limited to: evaluation of code / functional quality, requirements traceability, CI / CD process outputs, performance outputs
Proactively identify and manage, as well as actively serve as a point of escalation, for system and process-related issues as they arise and ensure that appropriate resolution
Stay abreast of industry-leading best practices and brings them to the attention of the leadership team
Develops and mentors the team through on-boarding, open communication, training, and development opportunities.
Lead DevOps Engineers on how to build processes where dependencies are represented clearly in code. This role plays an operational role by troubleshooting issues in development systems and is also responsible for the architecture and technical leadership of the entire DevOps infrastructure.
Lead automation and continuous improvement of the CI/CD and delivery tools, processes, and systems
Actively interfaces with Application Architects, Solution Architects, and Principal Architects to drive the collaboration and issue remediation
Accountable to compile and report out metrics on Stability, Quality & velocity, working with various internal and external teams.
Establish DevOps metrics and reporting cadence
Develop new automated reporting mechanisms for DevOps and SCM management.
Measure Build & Deployments- success, failure, and execution time
Oversee and contribute to environment strategy and best practices about what will be done in what environment, working closely with the environment manager. Provide thought leadership on branching and merging strategies and version control, working closely with the Release Manager and the delivery teams
Collaborate with the Delivery Leads and Release Manager to ensure that the teams adhere to the established standards, practices, and guidelines associated with executing git-flow, code reviews, and merging/deployment activities
Contribute to the development of and monitor the release management process, procedures, best practices
Basic requirements
Bachelors' degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering
8+ years of experience in data architecture
Experience working with Cloud storage solutions in AWS and/or Azure/GCP
Experience with data modeling tools, e.g., Lucidchart, Visio, etc.
Operational and Team Lead Experience with Continuous Integration (CI) /Continuous Development (CD) tools (e.g. Jenkins, Bitbucket, GitHub, Ansible)
Experience with configuring, and utilizing analytics and alerts from Monitoring Solutions such as Dynatrace, New Relic
Delivery Lead experience with providing oversight for Sprint / Release planning including capacity evaluation, test plan oversight, resource management, and project management
Experience with Environment Management and Environment strategies such as promotion paths, lockdown Hot-Fix management, Environment Build, and Refresh
Preferred skills and experiences
5 or more years of experience in app dev and /or CI-CD system admin/engineer
The ideal candidate will have at minimum working knowledge of containerized environments (Dockers, DC/OS, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm)
Operational Experience with delivery execution tools such as Jira, Confluence, Microsoft Project

About us
National Grid is hiring a Data Engineering Architect for our Solutions Engineering department in Waltham, MA.
Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry.
To be successful we must anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business.
Job Purpose
A collaborative role on the Data Engineering Team responsible for designing sound, scalable, and performant solutions that meet the requirements in a large data volume enterprise. Solutions and design trade-offs are communicated to business and technical stakeholders for effective decision making.
This candidate will influence an integral part of a major IT initiative to enable National Grid Business Partners by improving how our employees serve our customers today and by creating the platform for tomorrow’s growth. This is an integral role for this enablement program to deliver changes across people, process, systems and technology.
Key Accountabilities
Design and implement the migration of data from legacy systems to new solution.
Coordinate with clients, data users and key stakeholders and develop and achieve various long-term objectives for data engineering.
Design and implement monitoring frameworks to manage data in the DWH solution for both data integrity and accessibility.
Map data sources and targets for data movement and analyze it to ensure appropriate integrity and quality of all data.
Suitably address all data related issues such as system configuration and integration across platforms.
Manage data mappings from source to target solutions for data synch and conversion process flows
Manage the Enterprise Data Catalog and perform analysis to improve understanding of upcoming changes to target systems
Ensure data models are current and compliant with data controls
Assist in determining the cross-application data standards, data distribution standards and promote data-driven design
Evaluate database deliverables throughout development to ensure quality and traceability to requirements and adherence to all quality management plans and standards.
Work with other architects to ensure that all components work together to meet objectives and performance goals as defined in the requirements. Identify and communicate any cross-area or cross-release issues that may affect other areas of the project.
Participate in go-live preparation activities such as QA, dress rehearsals, issue remediation, cutover and go-live aftercare
Participate in data management maturity assessments to identify gaps and pain points for capabilities including data quality, governance, analytics, metadata management, master data management
Seek opportunities for continuous improvement in processes, procedures and systems with regards to data.
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Big Data Administration, Systems Administration or in the related field
Proven experience working in architecture role
5+ years’ experience in data mapping, modeling and working with teams to define data models
5+ years’ experience in transactional data conversions
3+ years’ experience in application and/or database development
3+ years’ experience in SQLServer, SSIS and SSMS or other database platforms
Experience in a dynamic work environment
Proven ability to work well in a team environment, and be capable of building and maintaining positive relationships with other staff, departments, and customers.
Strong communicator
Experience with cloud database architecture is a plus
Experience with Snowflake is a plus
Experience with Agile/Lean software development process and practices is a plus
Experience in with SaaS solutions such as Salesforce, ESRI and Workforce is a plus
Leadership requirements: Demonstrated ability to partner with cross-functional teams, subject matter experts, and architects, and demonstrated ability to drive sustainable process changes that realize significant business value
More Information
This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Internal candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.
National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise. We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve. National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.

When you join Verizon
Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
At Verizon, we are on a multi-year journey to industrialize our data practices and AI capabilities. Very simply, this means that AI and Data will fuel all decisions and business processes across the company. At $130B+ in annual revenue, this is a pioneering opportunity to build the data products and talent at a top global telco organization.
The Artificial Intelligence and Data ( AI&D) organization focuses on delivering the power of data and AI to drive our marketplace leadership through innovative solutions that create value for our customers, shareholders, V Teamers and society, responsibly.
This position will play a critical leadership technical role and will be responsible for designing and developing the creation of a new data solutions capable of integrating analytics across the wireless, core and enterprise networks for the purpose of improving operational flow and gaining insights which can be passed on to customers.
Responsibilities:
Developing and driving the execution of complex strategies to evolve the customer experience.
Designing and leading the development of cross-domain semantic layers and certified data products to feed AI/ML solutions that provide key insights to the front-end applications and customer service agents for real time decision making.
Leading the movement of pipeline curation from a Hadoop ecosystem to the cloud.
Partnering with peers to ensure governance, data quality, and security controls are bulletproof.
Establishing long lasting business partnerships, with the goal of improving our customer’s digital interactions and thereby reducing calls to the call centers or in-person visits to our retail stores.
In this hybrid role, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Software engineering and technical architect experience.
Even better if you have:
Bachelors / Masters in Computer Science, Information Science, Engineering or other related field.
Experience working on agile development methodologies and able to contribute in all phases of a project’s life cycle - Including Project Management, Architecture, Analysis, Design, Construction, Quality Assurance, CI/CD deployments and post production issue resolution.
Programming experience in mid-range environments such as UNIX, Hadoop and Cloud.
Experience collaborating with data engineers, architects, data scientists and enterprise platform team in designing and deploying data products.
Experience in designing and building data pipelines.
Ability to understand how data maps to business problems, educate less technical peers / business partners, and raise the collective bar in leveraging data for driving business results.
Ability to integrate cross-business strategies and manage enterprise-wide resources.
Strong communication, presentation and influencing skills.
Knowledge of data governance practices, emerging trends and issues, business and technology.
Understanding of best practices for building Data Lake and analytical architectures on Hadoop, Teradata and GCP.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Verizon requires new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Verizon provides reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical or religious reasons).

Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

GDIT has an exciting JOB OPPORTUNITY and is seeking a Senior Database Architect to support a federal agency to develop Enterprise Data Strategy and supporting Enterprise Data Governance framework.
Minimum/General Experience:
Requires at least ten years of general experience in information systems, including eight years of specialized experience providing state-of-the-art solutions in information systems technology with a proven track record in the area of Enterprise Data Architecture. Must have experience with the Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF), EA Reference Models.
Functional Responsibility:
Provides expert, independent services and leadership in specialized technical areas. Provides expertise on an as-needed basis to all task assignments. Provides expert advice and assistance in state-of-the-art software/hardware. Coordinates with contractor management and Government personnel to ensure that the problem has been properly defined and that the solution will satisfy the Government’s requirement. Specific responsibilities include the following:
Establish a data management framework and tools to support an enterprise data governance model that ensures the security, reliability, availability and integrity of agency data
Develop the project management operations (PMO) and governance structure to support the agency Data Council; this includes assisting the agency to evaluate current data collection and management efforts and implement changes as appropriate
Develop the Enterprise Data Strategy to integrate data governance policies and practices; improve data collection, quality, timeliness, and interoperability; and increase internal data analysis capacity
Establish and direct the maintenance of a Data Reference Model (DRM) to enable information sharing and reuse via the standard description and discovery of common data and the promotion of uniform data management practices
Standardize the use of metadata along with a common data lexicon for the agency
Work with stakeholders to develop data use cases by identifying current data collection, analysis, and sharing capabilities and shortcomings and identify recommendations as appropriate
Develop a draft implementation plan for the strategy
Additional Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills – verbal and written – a must
Experience in collaborating with senior level management
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
MA/MS (or equivalent experience), 20+ years of experience
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.

The likely salary range for this position is $151,184 - $257,012, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.
View information about benefits and our total rewards program.

Data Architect, 100% remote role within Oregon:
JOB SUMMARY/PURPOSE
Provides work leadership to professional staff and technical direction for the design, creation, deployment and management of data and data support systems. Aligns data architecture to business needs and promotes standards and governance processes to ensure data quality.
DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTION
Information Services is committed to providing leadership, support and coordination of technology and project management services at Samaritan Health Services. The IS Managed Care team maintains responsibility for production support and integration services for the health insurance business line.

Exempt positions may be eligible for alternate work schedule/remote work after introductory period.
EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in a related area or equivalent related experience required. Master's degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or a related field preferred.
Seven (7) years Business Systems or Information Systems experience required.
Five (5) years data integration and development experience required.
Experience in the following required:
ETL/ELT concepts and tools.
Database technologies (Relational, NoSQL).
Data modeling.
Advanced experience with query languages.
Object-oriented programming and programming languages.
Query optimization tools.
Agile development methodologies.
Business intelligence reporting tools (Cognos, Power BI, Tableau etc.).
Collaboration tools.
Experience in the following preferred:
Languages C#, VB, Python.
ETL/ELT tools Microsoft SSIS.
Database technologies (Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, Snowflake).
Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS).
Spark analytics engine.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES
Effective written and verbal communication skills to perform group presentations, tactfully discuss issues, and listen to and understand concepts, rules and procedures. Ability to work with all levels within the organization, facilitate communication, and effectively document related activities.
Ability to identify complex problems, review related information, employ creativity and alternative thinking to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

About Aspirant:
Aspirant is a global management consulting firm; we specialize in helping our clients create efficiencies across people, process, and technology to enable peak performance and deliver results, and that’s where you come in. This role provides you with the opportunity to show case your leadership skills, work across all practice areas and business units, and the ability to exercise your entrepreneurial spirit to contribute to the firm’s associate development efforts in a variety of ways.
About the role:
As a Data Platform Architect in the Microsoft Cloud Solutions Practice, you will leverage a client-centric approach to translate our client’s business strategy into solutions and services that lead to successful business outcomes. You have experience helping clients amplify their existing data and analytic platforms by designing and implementing state-of-the-art, best-in-breed data and advanced analytics platforms on the cloud. A strong technical skill set combined with strong customer management skills will be a key to success in this opportunity.
What you will do:
In the Data Platform Architect role, you will:
Define the solution architecture for new opportunities within Data & AI space, which will help our clients modernize and scale their Data Platforms.
Help clients identify their optimal Data Journey to Cloud in terms of architectures, organization, data management, business case and roadmap.
Architect the Modern Data Platforms while leveraging cloud offerings such as Azure SQL, Azure Synapse (or comparative AWS and GCP experience)
Engage with leadership and clients in strategic discussions to assess business requirements, cost-effective services and use cases.
Lead RFP and RFI answers in terms of architectures, resources, costs, project plan and roadmap to drive outcomes and ensure maximum client satisfaction.
Perform assessments to determine the technical feasibility of building a Data & AI solution. Help build PoC and define MVPs as needed.
Contribute to and define the high-level solution and act as functional expert on the project.
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other relevant degree; or equivalent experience
3+ years of relevant experience
Consulting experience preferred
Demonstrable professional experience with data mining, analysis, modeling, of large scale, complex data sets; Advanced proficiency with SQL for the generation and extraction of data for use in analytics and reporting.
Experience with various Azure PaaS services within Data and AI space (e.g., Azure Data Lake, Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure IoT, Purview etc.)
Experience in data platform/pipeline management, performance optimization and ensuring companies can scale with the needs of their business and industry. Data strategy and data management experience is welcome.
Demonstrated ability to work in roles with growing responsibility within professional services/management consulting or technology firms positioning solutions against competitors and supporting account teams in a proactive way.
Passionate about the design and development of Data & AI solutions always aligned to market drivers.
Ability to develop capabilities, and to continue to support client teams in growing their data landscape.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Participate in the pursuit of engagements, maintaining the relationship through the delivery phase resulting in repeat client business.
Experience partnering on analytics-related sales pursuits
Client consulting and project-leadership experience working with third-party clients preferred but not essential.
Some experience of one or more industries is welcome and an eagerness to learn more is preferred.
Aspirant is an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends heavily on the effective utilization of qualified people, regardless of their race, ancestry, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran’s status, or any characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Sr. Data Architect, Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opport...
Description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical role
8+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum)
Experience with prioritization of projects that mitigate trade-offs
Experience in analyzing Data Warehouses such as Teradata, Netezza, Oracle, etc. or Greenplum etc.
Experience designing database environments, analyzing production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Data Engineer duties and responsibilities of the jobWe are looking for someone with at least 5 years experience working within Data and Business Intelligence. Experience with Azure, SQL, SSIS, Tableau, Power BI (or other Business Intelligence / Reporting tools) is wanted as this job will be working with companies to gather business requirements and translate those requirements into consumable reports for end users. Must have experience with ETL and the ability to ensure quality along the full ETL process. Attention to detail on deliverables will be extremely important as the reports that are being created will be used daily by high level decision makers.This will be a client facing position – giving you the experience to work directly with CEOs, CTOs, CIOs, etc… You will also be working with data professionals who have over 40 years of experience in the field of data and analytics.Some of the common tasks for this role will include the following: Working within the Azure Environment – In particular within Azure Data Factory and Azure Dev OpsPulling data out of a client's source system and pushing it into a SQL Server database using scripts or automation toolsUsing SQL to manipulate and transform dataPulling data into Power BI / Tableau / other BI tools depending on the client’s needs.Building dashboards and reportsWorking with Project Lead and Client resources to understand requirement and present work completedThe following qualities / experience is desired: Experience in data models and reporting packagesWorking or project experience with SQL, Python, R or other programming languagesWorking knowledge of BI / Reporting tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, etc…)Ability to write comprehensive reportsExperience building and optimizing large data sets to answer specific business questions.Strong verbal and written communication skillsAn analytical mind and inclination for problem-solvingStrong attention to detail with project management experience and good organizational skillsAbout Xantie AnalyticsAt Xantie, we are passionate about data and giving power to decision makers by getting them the correct information at the right time. We do this by changing business processes to enhance data collection, data transformation and reporting. We use a large variety of tools in order to help our customers reach greater understanding of their business. Those tools range from API tools, to a variety of SQL languages and multiple Business Intelligence tools including Domo, Power BI, Tableau and QlikView.We work in a variety of industries from retail, home development, fast food, health care, long term treatment facilities and many more. With that, we need to be constantly learning and adjusting our skill set to ensure that we deliver to best possible outcomes to our customers.We work in a flexible and fast paced environment and make sure we have fun along the way.Job Type: Full-timePay: $75,000.00 - $105,000.00 per yearJob Type: Full-timePay: $75,000.00 - $105,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Business intelligence: 4 years (Preferred)Data Architect: 4 years (Preferred)Azure: 3 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:YesWork Location: One location

Job Title: Senior Analytics Architect/Data and Analytics Architect-Tabl...
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
What you'll be doing:
A key aspect of Consulting at Tableau is nurturing customers to develop a culture of self-service analytics applying visualization standard methodologies. The Sr. Solution Architect- SWE is is a new and exciting role within the Tableau Global Professional Services Organization. This individual and team are assigned to specific accounts, for a defined period of time (typically measured in days and weeks), where the sales team sees significant upside potential for the customer/prospect to expand their value and footprint of Tableau. These customers need to see Tableau working for them, with their data, before making their buying decision. This role is different from a traditional Sales Engineer in that this function goes well beyond demos and sales support, and actually works on small projects for the customer to develop trust, show value, and educate them on the value of Tableau. This resource will work closely with the Sales team for the account, develop strong relationships with the customer, and be dedicated to driving quick wins using their deep product expertise and creativity to address business problems for the customer. It is expected that the candidate for this position will be highly experienced as a Consultant/Architect and proficient at end-to-end Solution Architecture and Customer Engagement. In this role, the candidate will be expected to spend more than 70% of their time either on-site or virtual with customers or working on customer-assigned work.
The Sr. Solution Architect - SWE helps kick off the overall Analytics transformation journey for strategic customers. They bring industry experience, strong Tableau skills, Visualization/UI/UX standard methodologies, and understands how to work with customers to identify unique personas, and drive answering the specific questions for those personas. The Sr. SA also is responsible for the frontend design and implementation for the assigned accounts, and handles the engagement to provide technical & analytical expertise, consulting on Visual Analytics and guiding on Business Intelligence standard methodologies.
Some of the things you'll be doing include…
Develop expertise in the features, benefits and application of Tableau’s products – Deep understanding of our Desktop/frontend product(s) and it’s integration into client solutions, connecting to client data and a solid understanding of our Server product(s) and Tableau On-Line
Providing time supervised Professional Services to Tableau Customers
Travel to customer locations to provide delivery of Services
Lead Discovery exercises at customer sites and contributing detailed analytics and visualization input to implementation plans
Lead and deliver professional services engagements for Tableau customers focused on Tableau’s Blueprint methodology.
Help customers define business needs, guide prioritized data creation efforts and data strategy to address critical business questions
Lead our customers in programs focused on improved data literacy and expanded use of sophisticated analytics capabilities to share key insights through concrete dashboards and make faster, more impactful business decisions
Conducting data reviews, product demonstrations and ad-hoc onsite customer workshops
Develop leading analytics solutions for customers to meet their most ambitious business needs
Communicating via phone, email, face-to-face and web meetings with customers assisting and guiding them through the proposal and implementation process
Creating Post-Engagement Summaries and documenting final solutions for customers
Assisting Professional Services Management and Sales with specific scoping or technical / mentorship in pre-sales discussions
Provide mentorship to other consultants
Who you are…
Data Influencer . Knowledgeable in databases, warehouses and BI/Visualization Solutions – i.e. Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos, Business Objects. Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server Experience recommended.
Consultant Minded. You strive to understand business value and business outcomes, and identify how to demonstrate data and technology to help meet those customers' needs.
Experienced. You have worked in the analytics and consulting industry for at least 10+ years.
Visualization Specialist. You have a love of creative visualizations that help customers see and understand their data.
Customer-Centric. Experience owning customer engagements and providing standard methodology advice. Good interpersonal skills with the ability to manage expectations and customer demands
Problem Solver. You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution. You partner with customers to drive business change and implement end to end solutions as a trusted technical advisor.
Conviction and Commitment. You have an unshakable belief that Tableau's products will improve the world - one person at a time. Once you get it, you go all the way.
Go-Getter . Willing to go above and beyond with a good work ethic; self-directed and resourceful.
Good Communicator . Ability to translate knowledge across diverse industries and situations and present proposals and solutions to business users of all levels. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Upbeat and Creative . Energy and passion are your hallmarks. You think out-of-the-box and wow people with your exciting angles and quality work.
Highly Technical . You have deep technical skills across various technologies. Understanding of data querying and ability to read SQL statements; programming languages desired – Python & R preferred but not required.
Mathematically-Minded . Strong mathematical/analytical skills. Experience in statistical Solutions desired.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $ 126,100. You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
LI-RW1
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Job Title: Sr. Data Architect, Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opport...
Description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical role
8+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum)
Experience with prioritization of projects that mitigate trade-offs
Experience in analyzing Data Warehouses such as Teradata, Netezza, Oracle, etc. or Greenplum etc.
Experience designing database environments, analyzing production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

This position starts at $122,300 per year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
