Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.

Job Title: Senior Analytics Architect/Data and Analytics Architect-Tabl...
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
What you'll be doing:
A key aspect of Consulting at Tableau is nurturing customers to develop a culture of self-service analytics applying visualization standard methodologies. The Sr. Solution Architect- SWE is is a new and exciting role within the Tableau Global Professional Services Organization. This individual and team are assigned to specific accounts, for a defined period of time (typically measured in days and weeks), where the sales team sees significant upside potential for the customer/prospect to expand their value and footprint of Tableau. These customers need to see Tableau working for them, with their data, before making their buying decision. This role is different from a traditional Sales Engineer in that this function goes well beyond demos and sales support, and actually works on small projects for the customer to develop trust, show value, and educate them on the value of Tableau. This resource will work closely with the Sales team for the account, develop strong relationships with the customer, and be dedicated to driving quick wins using their deep product expertise and creativity to address business problems for the customer. It is expected that the candidate for this position will be highly experienced as a Consultant/Architect and proficient at end-to-end Solution Architecture and Customer Engagement. In this role, the candidate will be expected to spend more than 70% of their time either on-site or virtual with customers or working on customer-assigned work.
The Sr. Solution Architect - SWE helps kick off the overall Analytics transformation journey for strategic customers. They bring industry experience, strong Tableau skills, Visualization/UI/UX standard methodologies, and understands how to work with customers to identify unique personas, and drive answering the specific questions for those personas. The Sr. SA also is responsible for the frontend design and implementation for the assigned accounts, and handles the engagement to provide technical & analytical expertise, consulting on Visual Analytics and guiding on Business Intelligence standard methodologies.
Some of the things you'll be doing include…
Develop expertise in the features, benefits and application of Tableau’s products – Deep understanding of our Desktop/frontend product(s) and it’s integration into client solutions, connecting to client data and a solid understanding of our Server product(s) and Tableau On-Line
Providing time supervised Professional Services to Tableau Customers
Travel to customer locations to provide delivery of Services
Lead Discovery exercises at customer sites and contributing detailed analytics and visualization input to implementation plans
Lead and deliver professional services engagements for Tableau customers focused on Tableau’s Blueprint methodology.
Help customers define business needs, guide prioritized data creation efforts and data strategy to address critical business questions
Lead our customers in programs focused on improved data literacy and expanded use of sophisticated analytics capabilities to share key insights through concrete dashboards and make faster, more impactful business decisions
Conducting data reviews, product demonstrations and ad-hoc onsite customer workshops
Develop leading analytics solutions for customers to meet their most ambitious business needs
Communicating via phone, email, face-to-face and web meetings with customers assisting and guiding them through the proposal and implementation process
Creating Post-Engagement Summaries and documenting final solutions for customers
Assisting Professional Services Management and Sales with specific scoping or technical / mentorship in pre-sales discussions
Provide mentorship to other consultants
Who you are…
Data Influencer . Knowledgeable in databases, warehouses and BI/Visualization Solutions – i.e. Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos, Business Objects. Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server Experience recommended.
Consultant Minded. You strive to understand business value and business outcomes, and identify how to demonstrate data and technology to help meet those customers' needs.
Experienced. You have worked in the analytics and consulting industry for at least 10+ years.
Visualization Specialist. You have a love of creative visualizations that help customers see and understand their data.
Customer-Centric. Experience owning customer engagements and providing standard methodology advice. Good interpersonal skills with the ability to manage expectations and customer demands
Problem Solver. You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution. You partner with customers to drive business change and implement end to end solutions as a trusted technical advisor.
Conviction and Commitment. You have an unshakable belief that Tableau's products will improve the world - one person at a time. Once you get it, you go all the way.
Go-Getter . Willing to go above and beyond with a good work ethic; self-directed and resourceful.
Good Communicator . Ability to translate knowledge across diverse industries and situations and present proposals and solutions to business users of all levels. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Upbeat and Creative . Energy and passion are your hallmarks. You think out-of-the-box and wow people with your exciting angles and quality work.
Highly Technical . You have deep technical skills across various technologies. Understanding of data querying and ability to read SQL statements; programming languages desired – Python & R preferred but not required.
Mathematically-Minded . Strong mathematical/analytical skills. Experience in statistical Solutions desired.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $ 126,100. You may also be offered incentive compensation, bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
LI-RW1
Accommodations

About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
The AbbVie Endocrinology Inc. (AEI) Strategy & Insights team is working to transform AEI into an agile data driven organization. This is a great opportunity to be a part of this team in leading the delivery of mid to large-scale, functional, and cross-functional initiatives designed to uncover business insights helping improve efficiency & decision making. The AEI Insights Lead will be leaned upon as the deep domain expert from both a functional and technical standpoint in overall solution delivery. This individual will use a broad understanding of the access and reimbursement ecosystem paired with patient services information needs to own business relationships and lead a team in the execution of data-driven initiatives across disciplines and subject areas. Additionally, this individual will be responsible for demonstrating practical and innovative approaches while helping drive the data strategy and insights objectives for AEI. The ideal candidate will be a proponent for innovation, best practices, sound design with data & information optimization in mind, strong development habits, and efficient team/project structures.
The Data Platform Architect will be responsible for driving data platform architecture and governance to ensure secure, scalable, and reliable standard/advanced data insights capabilities are delivered across AEI and its partner stakeholders. AEI is seeking an established Technical Lead to define strategy and manage execution of our next generation data platform to position us for future fit delivery. This includes ensuring our platform health (stability and reliability), identifying and incorporating innovative data operations technologies and methodologies into our environment, overseeing data ingestion, storage, and integration and establishing a data platform governance model that creates efficiencies in our delivery and DQM processes. This person will also be responsible for defining and evolving the reference architecture for AEI’s data ecosystem.
Our business is growing and evolving with our Commercial product launches as well as the care models associated with each product, and we are trusted partners in delivering unparalleled patient support. This is an opportunity to join the team building an integrated AEI data and analytics platform, powering data-driven insights that ultimately lead to better, faster decisions and patient support. You will help enable and grow our culture of data driven insights and decision making, improving AEI productivity by improving turnaround times, exceeding service level targets and ultimately streamlining the process of prescription to therapy for our patients. Most importantly, by helping to unlock information like deeper understanding of in market payer behavior, near real time insurance plan coverage details, patient personas, and more, you will help find opportunities and influence decisions that make a remarkable impact in the lives of our people and patients.

Job Roles & Responsibilities
Direct point of contact for data architecture strategy and execution at AEI helping support and shape the strategic roadmap and prioritization aligned with business objectives.
Lead definition of design specifications and execution of data architecture and integration for medium to high complexity business insights initiatives leveraging a deep understanding of the following technologies and concepts: data lakes, relational and non-relational databases, data engineering/ETL, machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, business-driven data exploration, web solution architecture.
Partner with business technology organization leadership, and through the rationalization of the data architecture, the AEI Data Platform Architect will provide strategic recommendations to maximize the value of data assets via their creation, access, and use.
Advance technical expertise within function. Proactively demonstrate leadership by advising and sharing knowledge and expert opinions with subordinates, peers, and senior management. Mentor and train functional colleagues and assess current and emerging business challenges enabling functional goal achievement.
Ensure quality and effectiveness of major project plans within function through sound design, early risk assessments, and implementation of fallback strategies.
Source and identify emerging technological trends from multiple internal and external sources and assess relevance. Integrates trends into functional short-term objectives that increase the value and effectiveness of the data platforms, applications, and processes.
Deliver data platform reference architecture and governance standards to ensure secure, scalable, and reliable standard/advanced data insights capabilities are delivered across AEI and its partner stakeholders.
Define data structures for different layers of data ecosystem aligning with consumption patterns and usage. Deliver business rules and STTM (Source to Target Mapping) documents for individual layers
Coordinate and collaborate with BTS and business stakeholders in architecting and implementing solutions.
Coordinate resources (where applicable) to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon need and their abilities.
Develop data platform health measures and monitor/improve health consistently.
Develop and sustain relationships with BTS and business stakeholders while gaining a broader understanding of strategic objectives from an insight generation perspective.
Responsible for adherence to corporate standards regarding applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies, including code of conduct, safety, GxP compliance, and data security.

Qualifications
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. applied math, operation research, computer science, engineering, etc.) with 10+ years’ experience
Or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. applied math, operation research, computer science, engineering, etc.) with 8+ years’ experience
Requires extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data architecture, commercial data platforms, data modeling, and big data and cloud technology.
7+ combined years in BI/DW and Analytics; experience will include one or more of the following: Data Analyst, Systems Analyst, Data Architect, Analytics/Reporting Architect
Required experience with a wide range of technology that may include but not limited to SAP BW 4/HANA, Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, Hadoop, Snowflake, Oracle, Teradata, or Microsoft Azure Synapse.
Solid understanding on impacting, emerging and vendor trends in the BI/DW/Analytics space.
Requires in-depth knowledge of system development lifecycle and modern engineering practices
Preferred a working knowledge of domain driven design and domain driven data architecture
Lifesciences, healthcare analytics background required.
Familiarity with navigating in both a relational (Teradata-based) and non-relational (Hadoop) environment. Strong SQL skillset required. Knowledge of Java/Scala/Apache Spark is a bonus.
Knowledge of applicable regulations and standards affecting Pharmaceutical Products (e.g. CFR 210/211, cGMP) as well as knowledge of the applicable regulations affecting the practice of pharmacy (federal, state, and local as well as HIPAA)
Interacts well with diverse groups within function and maintains strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators and stakeholders.
Excellent written and oral communication skills

Significant Work Activities
Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day)
Travel
No
Job Type
Experienced
Schedule
Full-time

M

Job Title: Sr. Data Architect, Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opport...
Description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical role
8+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum)
Experience with prioritization of projects that mitigate trade-offs
Experience in analyzing Data Warehouses such as Teradata, Netezza, Oracle, etc. or Greenplum etc.
Experience designing database environments, analyzing production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

This position starts at $122,300 per year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.

6 MONTH CONTRACT-TO-HIRE OPPORTUNITY
Overview:
Apply a wide range of Big Data and Cloud technologies to lead the development of data integration pipelines to deliver data faster and more accurately for decision making
Analyze the needs and the environment to ensure developing considers the current architecture and operating environment as well as future functionality and enhancements.

Requirements:
Comprehensive experience in Azure Cloud, Synapse, data bricks, PowerBI stack

Sierra7, Inc. seeking a Data Architect to support a diverse, adaptable team providing technical, programmatic and change management support to VA mission-related functions. This program will drive updates and enhancements to support governance, product line management, business restructuring, account management, and technical business management. The candidate will have experience with a data management discipline concerned with designing, creating, deploying and managing an enterprise-level data architecture. Support the development of a blueprint for systems through laying tasking. Design and integration of information systems and commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) and development software, as well as security issues, must be considered when architecting and developing an IT architecture. The candidate will support the team as they develop and create strategies and plans for integration of multiple IT systems / subsystems into an operational unit, ensuring full functional and performance capabilities are retained. All activities will be coordinated within the user teams to assess risks, goals and needs and ensure that all are adequately addressed.

Sierra7 is a US Small Business Administration (SBA) and Center for Veterans Enterprise (CVE)-verified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Business (SDVOSB) who provides Federal clients system and technology integration, program management, business process optimization, and enterprise solutions.

Position Responsibilities:
 Proactive collaboration, communication, and interfacing with project stakeholders, including end users, business, VA organizations, vendors, and service partners
 Engage stakeholders across disciplines towards a goal of end-to-end line of sight across design, budgeting, and implementation.
 Support the development of strategies and plans to enhance the current tool ecosystem
 Define how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated and managed by different data entities and IT systems
 Create system diagrams and related documentation
 Able to actively lead and manage all phases of solutions planning, development and implementation.
 Engage with the team to build a world-class community of practice to support customers and for continuous improvement by enhancing the EA knowledge base of standards, innovation, evolving risks, and best practices
 Develop a logical data model as a standard for the golden source and for consuming applications to inherit.
 Develop a logical data model with elements and business rules needed for the creation of data quality (DQ) rules.
 Support developing and determining requirements for utilizing data (structured, unstructured, semi-structured, authoritative data source)
 Support the creation of architectures and review with segment and strategies to identify inconsistencies, gaps, and priorities
 Support the implementation of ‘Fit-for-Purpose’ mature architectures at multiple levels
 Establish standards and practice for the project
 Deliver project requirements on time, within budget, with quality results that meet or exceed customer expectations
 Develop detailed schedules, estimates, and resource plans to implement solutions.
 Produce and deliver detailed status reports and briefings, along with periodic demonstrations of developed capability, to document and demonstrate project progress
 Proactively manage scope, actions, issues and risks to ensure project success.
 Follow change control procedures effectively.
 Coordinate and monitor timely and effective completion of actions
 Coordinate development and reviews of high-quality project deliverables using appropriate templates

Required Skills and Experience:
 Experience in creating logical data models
 Extensive software development experience and thorough knowledge of a variety of programming languages and logic
 Strong leadership skills and management experience
 Enterprise architecture experience
 DoDaf or other system and operational vision and concept diagrams
 Experience in creating diagrams and documentation with all components that comprise systems
 Experience in implementing, integrating, and monitoring COTS applications.
 DevSecOps experience working within a COTs environment
 Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) experience a plus
 Familiarity with cloud technologies
 Familiarity with NIST and FedRAMP
 Experience working within a Human Centered design a plus
 Familiarity with supporting an authority to operate review and documentation development
 Experience identifying, mitigating and managing project risks and issues
 Strong interpersonal and client-facing skills
 Strong oral and written communication skills

Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or equivalent (8 years of additional experience may be substituted for education)
 15 years of relevant experience
 ITIL certification a plus
 Agile / SAFe certification a plus
 Experience working in VA or other Government agency [desired]
 The ability to obtain a Government security clearance [required]

Job Summary:
At Disney, we’re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. The Walt Disney Company is a world-class entertainment and technological leader. Walt’s passion was to continuously envision new ways to move audiences around the world—a passion that remains our touchstone in an enterprise that stretches from theme parks, resorts and a cruise line to sports, news, movies and a variety of other businesses. Uniting each endeavor is a commitment to creating and delivering unforgettable experiences — and we’re constantly looking for new ways to enhance these exciting experiences.

The Data Solutions team is part of the Core Systems & Platforms group in the Enterprise Technology organization. We are responsible for architecting, developing and managing critical enterprise data and analytics solutions and platforms for businesses groups across The Walt Disney Company.

You will be working in a complex, challenging, fast-paced and innovative environment, with other like-minded architects, engineers and business professionals who are building the next-gen enterprise data solutions for The Walt Disney Company and enabling major digital transformation initiatives in Finance and HR. Our architects and developers are diverse, smart, curious, innovative, solutions-oriented, respectful, highly collaborative and continuous learners.

This Principal Data Solutions Architect position is a key architect roles on the Data Solutions team . This is a strong technology and leadership role, responsible for the architecture of major enterprise data and analytics solutions for businesses across TWDC.

Note: This role will be an on-site position and open to the following Disney hub cities: Seattle, Washington; Burbank, California; or Orlando, Florida

Responsibilities:
Architecting and delivering high-performance, highly-scalable and flexible, cost-effective, cloud-based enterprise business data and analytics solutions
Translating business requirements into conceptual and detailed technology solutions
Collaborates closely with peers, leaders and business partners across the organization
Designing and documenting data architecture at multiple levels (high-level to detailed) and across multiple views (conceptual, logical, physical, data flow and sequence diagrams)
Performing third-party vendor assessments and developing and leading proof-of-concept projects
Keeping fluent in the industry and marketplace evolution-staying current with vendor product offerings and common and emerging data solutions in use across the industry; continuously learning new data technologies and introducing these into the organization
Basic Qualifications:
10+ years experience architecting enterprise data solutions
Expertise architecting and delivering end-to-end data solutions
Expertise in architecting and developing data warehouse solutions, especially for enterprise reporting and analytics applications
Expertise architecting and developing solutions in Snowflake
Experience architecting and developing cloud data solutions in multiple technologies (Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google, HANA) preferred
Experience architecting and delivering data integration and ETL solutions
Experience designing and developing performance-optimized data models
Experience with BI & data analytics tools preferred
Experience with Data Science and predictive analytics preferred
Experience with HR and Finance applications preferred
Proficiency in data security
Strong collaboration skills and ability to establish and manage effective working relationships in a matrixed organizational structure
Strong leadership skills
Strong communication and executive presentation skills; ability to communicate well to both technical and business audiences
Required Education
BS Computer Science or related technology field
Preferred Education
MS Computer Science or related technology field
Additional Information:
DISNEYTECH

About Aspirant:
Aspirant is a global management consulting firm; we specialize in helping our clients create efficiencies across people, process, and technology to enable peak performance and deliver results, and that’s where you come in. This role provides you with the opportunity to show case your leadership skills, work across all practice areas and business units, and the ability to exercise your entrepreneurial spirit to contribute to the firm’s associate development efforts in a variety of ways.
About the role:
As a Data Platform Architect in the Microsoft Cloud Solutions Practice, you will leverage a client-centric approach to translate our client’s business strategy into solutions and services that lead to successful business outcomes. You have experience helping clients amplify their existing data and analytic platforms by designing and implementing state-of-the-art, best-in-breed data and advanced analytics platforms on the cloud. A strong technical skill set combined with strong customer management skills will be a key to success in this opportunity.
What you will do:
In the Data Platform Architect role, you will:
Define the solution architecture for new opportunities within Data & AI space, which will help our clients modernize and scale their Data Platforms.
Help clients identify their optimal Data Journey to Cloud in terms of architectures, organization, data management, business case and roadmap.
Architect the Modern Data Platforms while leveraging cloud offerings such as Azure SQL, Azure Synapse (or comparative AWS and GCP experience)
Engage with leadership and clients in strategic discussions to assess business requirements, cost-effective services and use cases.
Lead RFP and RFI answers in terms of architectures, resources, costs, project plan and roadmap to drive outcomes and ensure maximum client satisfaction.
Perform assessments to determine the technical feasibility of building a Data & AI solution. Help build PoC and define MVPs as needed.
Contribute to and define the high-level solution and act as functional expert on the project.
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other relevant degree; or equivalent experience
3+ years of relevant experience
Consulting experience preferred
Demonstrable professional experience with data mining, analysis, modeling, of large scale, complex data sets; Advanced proficiency with SQL for the generation and extraction of data for use in analytics and reporting.
Experience with various Azure PaaS services within Data and AI space (e.g., Azure Data Lake, Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure IoT, Purview etc.)
Experience in data platform/pipeline management, performance optimization and ensuring companies can scale with the needs of their business and industry. Data strategy and data management experience is welcome.
Demonstrated ability to work in roles with growing responsibility within professional services/management consulting or technology firms positioning solutions against competitors and supporting account teams in a proactive way.
Passionate about the design and development of Data & AI solutions always aligned to market drivers.
Ability to develop capabilities, and to continue to support client teams in growing their data landscape.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Participate in the pursuit of engagements, maintaining the relationship through the delivery phase resulting in repeat client business.
Experience partnering on analytics-related sales pursuits
Client consulting and project-leadership experience working with third-party clients preferred but not essential.
Some experience of one or more industries is welcome and an eagerness to learn more is preferred.
Aspirant is an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends heavily on the effective utilization of qualified people, regardless of their race, ancestry, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran’s status, or any characteristic protected by law.

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).
The team

Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.


The ~3,000 professionals in ITS deliver services including:

Security, risk & compliance
Technology support
Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship management
Strategy
Deployment
PMO
Financials
Communications


Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)


Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

GDIT has an exciting JOB OPPORTUNITY and is seeking a Senior Database Architect to support a federal agency to develop Enterprise Data Strategy and supporting Enterprise Data Governance framework.
Minimum/General Experience:
Requires at least ten years of general experience in information systems, including eight years of specialized experience providing state-of-the-art solutions in information systems technology with a proven track record in the area of Enterprise Data Architecture. Must have experience with the Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF), EA Reference Models.
Functional Responsibility:
Provides expert, independent services and leadership in specialized technical areas. Provides expertise on an as-needed basis to all task assignments. Provides expert advice and assistance in state-of-the-art software/hardware. Coordinates with contractor management and Government personnel to ensure that the problem has been properly defined and that the solution will satisfy the Government’s requirement. Specific responsibilities include the following:
Establish a data management framework and tools to support an enterprise data governance model that ensures the security, reliability, availability and integrity of agency data
Develop the project management operations (PMO) and governance structure to support the agency Data Council; this includes assisting the agency to evaluate current data collection and management efforts and implement changes as appropriate
Develop the Enterprise Data Strategy to integrate data governance policies and practices; improve data collection, quality, timeliness, and interoperability; and increase internal data analysis capacity
Establish and direct the maintenance of a Data Reference Model (DRM) to enable information sharing and reuse via the standard description and discovery of common data and the promotion of uniform data management practices
Standardize the use of metadata along with a common data lexicon for the agency
Work with stakeholders to develop data use cases by identifying current data collection, analysis, and sharing capabilities and shortcomings and identify recommendations as appropriate
Develop a draft implementation plan for the strategy
Additional Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills – verbal and written – a must
Experience in collaborating with senior level management
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
MA/MS (or equivalent experience), 20+ years of experience
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.

The likely salary range for this position is $151,184 - $257,012, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

Spark analytics engine.

Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

This position starts at $122,300 per year. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical role
8+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum)
Experience with prioritization of projects that mitigate trade-offs
Experience in analyzing Data Warehouses such as Teradata, Netezza, Oracle, etc. or Greenplum etc.
Experience designing database environments, analyzing production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance

Diversified: Connecting Organizations with Effective Collaboration

Take your place on our team - one that shares a DNA of excellence, professionalism, dedication and service! With projects in over 50 countries and spanning six continents, we offer opportunities in a wide array of specialties and locations, empowering you to mold your career path to fit evolving needs and interests.

Our dedication in delivering exceptional service, keen drive to encourage the internal pursuit of maturing career interests and our pliability towards the day to day lives of all who make us whole, thus making us more than a team – Here at Diversified, we are a family!

The sun never sets on our global team, with more than 50 locations around the world. Just imagine what’s on the horizon for you as a member of the Diversified family!

Culture

We are passionate about what we do, connecting people, technology and experiences, where and when it matters most. We strive to attract employees who are committed to excellence, ambitious and want to work with an organization that rewards performance, values loyalty and is dedicated to achieving mutually beneficial outcomes. We are committed to supporting employee growth and providing opportunities to continually learn and develop their skills.

Connect to your future at Diversified, where if you can dream it, you can do it.

About The Role

Data Visualization Specialist - ANYWHERE USA

The Data Visualization Specialist works with stakeholders and end users to define reporting requirement, design front end visualizations and architect data solutions. This Role is responsible for creating sustainable data models that enable both point in time reporting and live dashboards. This role should empower end users with diverse skill sets to understand and analyze their data.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Provide technical feasibility review based on requested reporting.
Provide CUSTOMER facing support
Work with identified stakeholders and sponsors to define, design, plan and budget and execute data visualization projects.
Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and support the project’s decision-making process.
Design and Develop self-sustaining data models, minimizing manual data sources. Automate flat-files utilizing Azure Dataflows and SSIS
Troubleshoot and perform root cause analysis on reported issues or concerns with the dashboards or reports created.
Provide Data-Model and report documentation to end and power users, provide data-model training for self-report generation.
Work with teammates on defining reporting/data model best practice for specific application/modules/reporting types.
Keep projects on budget
Provide project management for select projects, participate in project updates and provide visibility to project status
Contribute to enterprise cross-platform data strategy
Contribute to the Data Delivery strategy
Create transparency in our reporting through key-stakeholder interactions
5-7 + years of related work experience.
Proven experience in producing quality senior management level reports.
Strong understanding of aggregated reporting, analytics, and visualization.
Financial reporting background highly preferred.
Strong oral and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate professionally, effectively explain complex information and document according to standards.
Ability to translate non-technical business requirements into relevant data models and visualizations
Technical background, with an ability to think outside the box and propose original solutions.
Experience in data visualization tools, for example Power BI.
Understanding of the following technologies is required:

1. Power BI
2. SQL Management Studio
3. MySQL Workbench

Possess a willingness to learn innovative approaches and tools in a fast-paced environment.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Ability to work independently as well as lead cross-functional teams when necessary.

But wait, there’s more! At Diversified, we offer our teams…

Collaborative work environments with dynamic growth opportunities
Our commitment to your ongoing career development and education
Comprehensive competitive benefits package
Opportunities to work on some of the world's most iconic and innovative projects
The ability to shine as an industry leader

Diversified: Imagination Engineered
As an industry leading technology provider, Diversified proudly connects our dynamic global clientele with the technology solutions that keep them competitive in an evolving market. From boardrooms to classrooms, command centers to surgical suites, and stadiums to studios, we turn technology dreams into strategic realities every day. Our passionate team delivers the most innovative solutions, lives on the cutting edge of technology and is constantly growing to better serve our expanding customer-base around the world. Connect to your future at Diversified, where if you can dream it, you can do it!

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Work From Home, US
Description:
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role

There is currently a Senior Data Scientist role available as a Work From Home opportunity!
The Main Responsibilities
Works with the AI Strategist to understand the techniques, methods, tools that should be used to develop solutions for problems and works with the Architect (Solutions, Data) to understand data, solutions, and platforms that can be used to develop solutions.
Creates strategies for generating solutions and runs quick analyses to ensure feasibility of approaches for solutions to use cases. Synthesizes the approach, data, process recommendations and provides the specs to the Pilot and Prove Team to develop proof-of-concept solutions.
Supports citizen-led AI/ML projects and upskilling training for AI/ML projects.
Follows agile methodology to develop the pilot solution to prove out the benefit of the solution for the business. Records the specs for the data-driven insights generation process components built during the pilot so that the Executions team can operationalize.
What We Look For in a Candidate

Required skills
Strong statistical background and understanding of advanced analytic techniques; advanced understanding/coursework in database management and math (Linear, Algebra, Calculus)Experience with A.I. and Machine Learning model development e.g. Neural nets, deep neural nets etc.Consistently informed of leading AI/ML methods and techniques along with experience in a variety of tools and platforms (R, Python, etc.)Proficiency in statistical data analysis and data mining packages (e. g R, Python)Solid programming skills in SQL, TSql, PL/SQL or similar database programming languageIntellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions
Nice-to-have skills
Experience with ETL tools (e.g. SQL Server Integration Services)Understanding and experience of integrating with APIs. Knowledge of standards such as REST, JSON, XML, SOAP and OAuthStrong object oriented programming skills (e.g. Java, JavaScript, Scala)Understanding of the Cloudera Big Data Stack. Hands on experience with Hive, Impala and Spark.Azure AI Certified
Tool and platform know-how
Data mining languages and packages (e.g.R, Python)Big data frameworks (TensorFlow, Caffe, Spark, Hadoop, Azure AI Stack)
What to Expect Next

7900 Westpark Drive (12131), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Sr. Director of Data Engineering
Capital One is seeking a Sr. Director of Data Engineering to work in our Enterprise Data and Machine Learning organization. This individual will specifically be leading teams delivering and expanding highly performant and scalable data products and platforms to drive consumption of data from our enterprise data ecosystem, while driving data engineering best practices. The candidate will also be responsible for designing new solutions to ensure that Capital One is able to increasingly innovate with its data assets. This leader must have the ability to attract and recruit the industry’s best talent, and simultaneously have the technical chops to ensure that we build compelling, customer oriented solutions in an iterative methodology. Success in the role requires an innovative mind, a proven track record of delivering next generation software and data products, rigorous analytical skills, and a passion for creating market-leading software that integrates automation, machine learning, and predictive analytics.
Our Sr. Directors Are:
Technologists: Strong engineering and technology background with the ability to learn quickly and go deep into our product and engineering solutions - will have a DevOps mindset
Effective Communicators: Excellent listener; proven collaborator with senior leaders, peers and staff
Partnership Attitude: Have the competencies to build very strong partnerships with other technology leaders that enable your team's ability to stay on the leading edge of industry solutions
Curious: Hands-on, "roll up your sleeves" collaborative style of working
Passionate: Bring energy and enthusiasm to the job and organization
Bold: History of taking smart, calculated risks and aggressively leading through change
Achievers: Consistently attain/exceed individual and team goals
You will:
Lead, manage, and grow multiple teams of product focused software & data engineers
Embrace and incubate emerging technology and open source products across all platforms
Work to modernize our existing tech stacks and data platforms
Collaborate with internal teams to find areas of opportunities for automation and machine learning
Partner with architects, product owners, data professionals, and software & data engineers to drive the implementation of new applications
Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across full-stack development tools and technologies.
Lead efforts to deploy new and existing applications into AWS environments and provide operational support for the applications.
Conduct design and code review to ensure compliance with standards
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 10 years experience in data engineering
At least 8 years of experience managing software or data engineering teams
At least 4 years of experience with Big Data and data streaming
At least 4 years of experience with cloud based data platforms
At least 4 years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, and Data Analytics tools
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree
15+ years of experience in data engineering
10+ years of experience managing software and data engineering teams
4+ years of experience with AWS
3+ Years of experience building and shipping enterprise grade global products in a SaaS organization.

Job Title: Principal Partner Solutions Architect - Data and Analytics
Description:
Bachelor's degree
10 + years of highly technical, hands-on job experience
6+ years working with software and hardware solutions used in large enterprises
5+ years in customer / partner facing role or extensive experience working with internal business leads to develop solutions.
Experience with Data and Analytic Technologies

AWS is looking for Solutions Architect to work with our most strategic data and analytics software partners. This is a hands-on, highly technical position is for someone who can dive deep, build complex, AWS-optimized architectures, and develop a long-term strategy with AWS business development and service teams.

Candidates must have great communication skills and be very technical, with the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required. As the right candidate, you should have hands-on experience designing and troubleshooting large-scale systems architecture, in addition to working experience with virtualized environments in the enterprise. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at both top software vendors and AWS service teams, influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

Work/Life Balance
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive and Diverse Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

The preferred location is San Francisco Bay Area, CA but the position can be based anywhere in the US where AWS has a significant presence - Seattle, New York City, San Francisco, Dallas , Phoenix and Irvine. Up to 30% travel required.


An advanced degree in computer science, engineering or mathematics
6+ years experience building and designing solutions that run in virtualized environments.
Excellent presentation and written communication skills
Organized and goal focused, ability to manage multiple projects in a fast paced environment
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
