Job Description:
Why wake up every day and want more when YOU CAN HAVE IT? Do you love KNOWING at the end of each day that your work made a difference? We embrace and solve some of the world's toughest challenges. We’re focused on ensuring our intelligence customers have the right tools, technologies, and tactics to keep pace with an ever evolving threat landscape and succeed in their mission to protect people and critical assets around the world. Who wouldn’t be fulfilled being part of that every day? We know once you join Team Leidos, you are sure to go home at the end of every day knowing YOU MADE A DIFFERENCE, resulting in one of the most REWARDING careers you could have imagined. EACH DAY MATTERS!
We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning
Primary Responsibilities
Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL
Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations.
Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions
Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments.
Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc…
Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly
Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers
Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security
Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications
Support on-call activities as needed
Basic Qualifications
Clearance Required to be considered for this role is a Top Secret
5+ years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database
Preferred 3+ year administering Microsoft SQL Server
4+ years of AWS RDS management experience
Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages
Must have excellent communications and documentation skills
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems
Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus
BS degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Oracle Database Administrator Certifications a plus
Relevant AWS certification preferred
Pay Range:

We’re searching for a Network Architect II who is responsible for a variety of very complex tasks including the architecture, design, installation, and administration of Children’s computer networks as well as the establishment of comprehensive, high-quality procedures for managing those networks in an enterprise environment, including the enterprise wireless network. Explicit focus on architecture and engineering using analytic methods. Develop network requirements, standards, and researches new products. Analyze engineers and executes software functions for telecom voice and data networks. Work independently on a variety of complex tasks. Administer network operating systems and database of users.
Essential Functions
Creates complete network architectures that provide end-to-end application solutions; provides advanced network designs; recommends how network systems could evolve to maintain compatibility with industry standards; uses input from statistical sampling techniques to forecast network changes.
Provides the analysis, design, and oversight of network and/or systems architecture and configuration. Identifies new requirements for the network and/or systems architecture, sub-systems, and services based on business, operational, marketing, or other requirements.
Leads technical projects according to Children’s Project Management methodology. Documents projects and activities in accordance with applicable standards and prescribed procedures and processes for the development, operation, and maintenance of the data network and related systems.
Obtains candidate solutions based upon identified requirements for the data network and/or related systems and for evaluating those solutions against measurable parameters derived from those requirements. Recommends and implements preferred solution based on that evaluation and the review of other engineering team members.
Deploys new data network components and configurations and related data network systems and services. Includes design and configuration of network and related systems and components, creation of test plans and procedures, documentation of the operation, maintenance and administration of any new systems or services, coordination with Operations for assistance in deployment activities, testing, training requirements, etc.
Develop, implement, promote and enforce the fullest scope of architectural responsibility for all network and telecommunications systems, using existing life cycle methodologies and project management standards.
Provides technical expertise in various deployed systems/services for troubleshooting assistance, operational guidelines, system capacity and performance analysis, configuration optimization, etc. Develops and provides mentoring and training to less senior staff.
Maintains department unique applications and databases and ensures the latest versions are in use and that maintenance support has been secured for them. Maintains oversight of Active Directory database and provides guidance to Helpdesk as needed. Removes departed users and ensures appropriate disposition of their files.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Knowledge, skill and ability to plan, design and engineer local and wide area networks
Knowledge, skill and ability to manage technical projects from design to implementation
Knowledge of the principles of network administration, local and wide area communications, personal computers and peripherals.
Knowledge of file servers, network data switches and other devices that comprise local and wide area network
Skill in the operation and maintenance of file servers, personal computers, routers, switches, network operating systems, and the installation and where required, the maintenance of the applications that run on these devices.
Skill in the application of the Microsoft products and their use in our environment.
Skill in generating and interpreting test results.
Ability to generate and execute procedures and plans that facilitate operational changes as they occur.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Strong interpersonal and team building skills
Effective planning, organizational, time management and prioritizing skills
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Networking, Computer Science or related field required, equivalent work experience network administer or design experience may be substituted for education.
Minimum of five years experience maintaining and operating personal computers, network operating systems, communications devices (routers, switches, hubs), associated hardware and software required.
Minimum of five years experience engineering and designing communications and network solutions preferred.
Based on departmental need the following may be required.
Database maintenance skills
CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS
Microsoft/Cisco Certifications preferred.

About Children's Hospital

When you work at Children’s, you’re part of a treasured place of healing in the Omaha community—and beyond. Join our team of highly engaged, caring professionals who believe deeply in the organization’s mission—to improve the life of every child. We support equity, diversity and inclusion, and as you apply your skills and expertise to helping children, you too will have opportunities to grow your career. In 2021, we’ll open the new Hubbard Center for Children, tripling our capacity to serve children.

When children are your everything, anything can be…

Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).
The team

Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)


Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Ford Motor Company
Product Development
Job Description & Qualifications
At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

Do you have what it takes to make smart vehicles for a smart world? Join the Ford Product Development team. Utilizing Design Thinking & User Experience methods, you’ll work to deliver breakthrough products and services that delight our customers. We’re seeking forward-thinking, laser-focused professionals with a passion for bringing innovative, exciting, and sustainable ideas to life. We have opportunities around the world for you to contribute to such advancements as autonomy, electrification, smart mobility technologies, and more!

What we do:
Join a growing team of engineers delivering a suite of features that give drivers a safer and more confident driving experience, including BlueCruise.

What you'll be able to do:
Create the plan and model for DAT ADA feature (LKS, AHBC, DAS, ASLD, TSR, iACC, LCA, ACC, BlueCruise) data management: understand core technology influences, assess potential data sources (internal and external), then architect the plan to collect, analyze, report, adapt and maintain the right data.
Inform Core DAT Engineering, by allowing the core team access to critical information conveniently, to design DAT ADA products which exceed customer expectations; inform technology requirements using connected data.
Collaborate with Enterprise Connectivity to apply EC tools (eg. Connected Vehicle Data) to DAT ADA data management efforts.
Support efforts to create the vision of connected data flow through the DAT Team.
Use an agile and adaptable approach for data management.
Inform product design for cost management.Support continuous quality improvement and cost optimization for DAT Feature.
The minimum requirements we seek:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
1+ years of work experience in automotive in developing features and functions in Electrical, Chassis, Powertrain or Vehicle Engineering.
Our preferred requirements:
Master of Science in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field.
CDMP (Certified Data Management Professional).
Knowledge of database administration including cloud computing.
Experience in information management, data mining (ie. MWATS) & visualization (ie. Visio), and processing large relational databases.
Familiarity with programming language, ie. C, Python
Strong analytical problem solving
Good communication skills
What you'll receive in return:
As part of the Ford family, you'll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You'll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.

If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we’d love to have you join us.
Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is available for this position.

By choice, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

For information on Ford's salary and benefits, please visit: https://corporate.ford.com/content/dam/corporate/us/en-us/documents/careers/2021-benefits-and-comp-GSR-sal-plan-2.pdf

JOB SUMMARY: Design, develop and evaluate advanced predictive and machine learning models with a focus on the personalization and optimization of audience first, marketing tactics. Analyze and extract relevant information about guest behaviors and preferences from both structured and unstructured data to better understand marketing opportunities. Conduct advanced analysis on various marketing efforts to gauge performance, impact and effectiveness against the desired results. Responsible for building efficient and scalable automated data processes that prep and standardize various data sources in support of personalization. Delivers accurate, clear, concise insights and visualizations leveraging predictive results that inform and inspire internal stakeholders to make better business decisions.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Mine data to detect patterns, opportunities and insights via advanced analytical techniques to drive Personalization and Audience Strategy. Conduct analyses utilizing 1st Party and appended information about audiences to facilitate the right content, at the right time, across a guest’s planning, shopping, and on-property experience.
Develop predictive models using machine learning methodologies to target and personalize the experience of individuals across digital touchpoints.
Collaborate with technology engineers, architects and team to define requirements and help design automated data pipelines and prep processes in support of personalization.
Define and produce deliverables that identify opportunities to shape consumer experiences that inform and inspire internal stakeholders and decision makers.
Engage with internal team members to translate business driven hypothesis and scenarios into a modeling framework.
Understands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training and team member involvement activities.
Performs other duties as assigned.

SCOPE: This role is responsible for the design and management of advanced analytics solutions that incorporate financial, demographic, customer research/insights and behavioral data from internal and external systems to enhance the understanding and increase guest value through the application of actionable segmentation and machine learning models.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Experienced developing analytical models using statistical, machine learning and data mining methodologies to drive business impact.
Ability to apply cleansing, imputation, selection and generalization techniques to create high quality features for modeling.
Intermediate knowledge coding in statistical and programming languages such as R, Python, or similar.
Skilled in interacting with big data, relational and non-relational data sources at the appropriate level of granularity to support personalization.
Collaborate with engineering teams to build real-time and automated data processes for personalization.
Ability to develop dashboards to visualize insights driven by predictive modeling and measure model performance.
Delivers accurate, clear, concise insights and visualizations leveraging predictive results.
Knowledge in marketing, media targeting and personalization strategy.
Demonstrated a willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.
Innate curiosity about the travel and entertainment industry.
Self-discipline in following project timelines and setting realistic deliverables.
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment required.

EDUCATION: Advanced degree (M.S., or M.A., or Ph.D.) in relevant quantitative field (e.g., computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics, data science, business analytics) required.

EXPERIENCE:

5+ years of prior hands-on experience in data science is preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Competency in programming with statistical modeling tools to fuel and deliver marketing personalization and business insights.
Strong familiarity with manipulating and mining data to transform business decisions that impact the bottom line.
Knowledgeable in leveraging visual analytics to create a seamless and inspirational story that inspire and inform business leaders with the necessary knowledge to drive revenue and customer loyalty.
Experience/Knowledge in the following areas preferred: Travel & Resort Industry, Entertainment &/or Theme Park experience, Marketing Personalization and Recommendation Systems, Digital Marketing & Analytics, Business Intelligence Reporting, CRM Execution, Consumer Research and Journey, Consumer Data, Competitive Analysis.

Your talent, skills and experience will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package.

Job Details
The mission of Salesforce Services is to accelerate our customer’s success through business transformation. Our most strategic customers call us “think partners” because we help them become more agile and differentiated in the marketplace. We leverage CRM, collaboration, mobile and platform technologies to connect employees, customers and business partners together. We push the boundaries of technology and “make the market” by creating proof points for new products and capabilities. Within Salesforce Services, the Business Architect (BA) helps transform our most strategic customers by helping Business & IT understand what is possible and desirable, and how to get there, using all the power of our solutions to enhance and realize their strategy. BAs are customer-directed specialists solely focused on driving customer success through large scale programs, change management, innovation, roadmap, usage, adoption and value. BAs are dedicated to one customer at a time. This is a great opportunity to join the leader in cloud computing in one of Salesforce’s fastest growing businesses.


Responsibilities
Matrix-lead one of Salesforce’s most strategic customers as part of a blended team with other Salesforce resources (Account Executives, Customer Success, Services, Industry) and 3rd party system integrators.
Co-create a personalized plan that aligns corporate goals, what is possible, key business measures / KPIs, and a practical implementation path.
Improve the certainty of delivering large scale change by aligning sponsor goals, key customer and Salesforce stakeholders, and delivery resources into a program with consistent and transparent processes.
Improve the certainty of absorbing large scale transformational change by building communications, education, and continuous feedback loops that engage everyone from end users to senior leaders.
Enable delivery with speed, agility and stability by implementing a decision making framework that balances regional and global attributes, frequency of change, quality of data and risk mitigation.
Accelerate productivity and buy-in through a series of activities that help end-users uncover and articulate barriers, and co-design potential solutions to their needs.
Identify “moments of truth” by visualizing the information stored within Salesforce and other systems via our full suite of analytics capabilities.
Maximize speed to market by clearly understanding Salesforce’s product roadmap, industry reference architectures, AppExchange offerings and agile development.
Personalize best practices to customers including, but not limited to, roadmap, agile development, change management, enterprise collaboration, operational support, and alignment to business strategy. Increase user productivity, reduce TCO and accelerate Salesforce investment payback, by formulating a plan to reduce the number of disparate applications end users access to do their jobs.
Accelerate delivery and reduce project costs by executing a strategy to identify, recruit, on-board, train and retain top talent skilled in Salesforce.
Improve adoption and value by working with senior executives to understand the vital information they need to do their jobs, and the tasks that can be easily simplified via Salesforce’s declarative solutions.
Provide timely account or issue executive summary status reporting both to customers and management.
Advocate customers' product feature priorities internally within Salesforce.
Contribute internally to the Salesforce team, share knowledge and best practices with team members, contribute to internal projects and initiatives, and serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for specific domain or process area.
Required Skills:
Most successful candidates have extensive experience in consulting and services industry as a Sr Manager or director level with engagement experience in a leadership capacity
Travel may be required and varies depending on the client requirements
Innovation
Inquisitive mind, endless curiosity and passion for learning about customers, industries and new approaches to doing things
How end users perform their jobs
Industry challenges and solutions
The full suite of Salesforce’s continuously evolving clouds
AppExchange / 3rd party niche solutions to meet customer needs
Innovations and best practices for delivering cloud solutions
Ability to translate vision and business issues into actionable roadmap and solutions
Leadership
Strong self-starter with the ability to build a network within Salesforce and your assigned customer
Effectively build, develop, and manage relationships with internal and customer senior executives, setting expectations on their role as stakeholders vested in success.
Proven effectiveness at leading and facilitating meetings and workshops
Technology Delivery
Matrix leadership: Motivate, inspire, and coordinate a blended team of Salesforce, Customer, ISV and System Integrators to solve customer challenges.
Ability to manage customer escalations (internally and externally) and negotiate resolution
Thrive in the unknown: creatively solve problems with limited input and resources in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
Flawlessly execute consulting management activities, with high attention to detail, organization and process.
Genuine passion, interest, willingness and ability to adjust to continuously changing priorities and needs
Capability as credible and effective C-level advisor/coach, especially with regards to change management (cultural, business and technical)

Collaborate with customers and system integrators to map out current state user workflows and functional architectures, evangelize the benefits of cloud-based technologies, and personalize the future state end user workflow.

Offer suggestions and improvements to process and work effectively with all personalities.

Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

Salesforce has over 7,500 developers with offices throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Salesforce's development teams need to work smarter, faster and standards compliant. As part of Developer Productivity Experience, we provide secure, reliable, easy to use, and intelligent engineering tooling and services that are the foundation for all developers at Salesforce.
We leverage best-in-industry offerings to offer outstanding tools and services. We go above and beyond to delight our customers. We balance well across Trust and Run the Business, incremental and pioneering innovations in our tooling and services to power our Salesforce Chapter 3 journey.
You will be a principal technical leader driving the long term vision for Git and Perforce version control systems. You will be part of a team that is responsible for ensuring that systems are reliable, highly available and operating at its peak efficiency 24 x 7 x 365. In addition this team enables code searchability, discoverability & intelligence to improve internal developer efficiency.
This role will encompass systems design, programming, project & program management and reporting to ensure we deliver on compliance initiatives. A detailed understanding of centralized versus decentralized version control is vital.
Responsibilities
Lead various technical and compliance related initiatives with a highly collaborative background
Architect, design and implement tools and processes to continuously improve our use of SCM services
Configure, deploy, manage and maintain large cloud-hosted distributed version control systems; including auto-scaling, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting and disaster recovery in multiple geographical areas
Design and implement the access models to ensure compliance with operational and security requirements
Collaborate with Software Engineering and IT Global Infrastructure to maintain continuous availability of critically important systems
Strong scripting skills in any Python and/or UNIX with the ability to provide requirements for task automation, resource monitoring and performance monitoring
Experience with server hardware, networking, storage, and large scale infrastructure designs and troubleshooting
Ongoing administration of infrastructure and regular patches/maintenance as per compliance requirements
Demonstrate knowledge of design and architectural frameworks to improve scale and performance in constrained environments
Back-up and restore management; use back-up and recovery standard methodologies to ensure systems are protected from data loss in compliance with established business continuity and DR practices
Engage with users to become a trusted enthusiast to drive the evolution of SCM tools and processes
Support release, patch release process & on call rotation
Effective working with different teams and providing technical guidance
Experience/Skills Required
Expert knowledge of SCM tools both as an administrator and developer with tools like GitHub & Perforce
Solid understanding of configuring, deploying, managing and maintaining large cloud-hosted version control systems in cloud infrastructures such as AWS and/or Google Cloud
Solid understanding for Infrastructure as Code(IaC) like Terraform.
Proven experience utilizing features in DVCS for integrations with different systems
Experience in modern CI/CD technologies such as Jenkins and building seamless integrations
Domain expertise supporting services for engineering organizations
In-depth, hands-on experience with Linux, networking, server, and cloud architectures for high-availability environments
Experience with automation/configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Salt, etc.)
Experience with enterprise monitoring systems is highly desired (e.g. Nagios, Zabbix, Splunk)
Fluency in one or more scripting languages such as Python, UNIX shell
Fluency in object-oriented programming languages like Java
Knowledge of tools like static/dynamic code analysis (e.g. Sonar, Coverity), code review, etc. and integrations with code repositories desired
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Experience with Agile methodologies is desired but not required

Are you looking to join a team where you help customers use the latest technology, where you receive cutting edge training and where you’re empowered to make a difference?
We need enthusiastic people like you to provide technical direction to our customers to help them realize their full potential.
WHO WE ARE
We are Microsoft Industry Solutions, and are passionate about delivering Microsoft’s mission:
“to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more”.
Microsoft Industry Solutions’ mission is to lead and serve Microsoft’s customers and partners as they realize their full potential through Microsoft software and services. Microsoft Consulting Services and its partners bring the deepest expertise of Microsoft solutions—from enterprise planning to deployment and support—that helps our customers innovate to strategic advantage in their respective industries.
Within Microsoft Industry Solutions Azure Cloud and AI Domain, the Solution Architecture Office (SAO) is a team of seasoned architects & data scientists responsible for supporting our 3000+ strong consulting teams deliver against aligned technical strategies using high quality and predictable methods. The SAO team’s role is to support and enable the consulting teams in the field to sell and deliver with predictability, repeatability, consistency and quality across the Time Zones sales & delivery teams while driving IP reuse and leverage of best practices. The SAO team will also deploy its highly skilled resources to support significant pre-sales engagements and major deliver projects, typically in a governance or leadership role.
The D&AI SAO team delivers the above focus areas with a focus on modern data platforms, analytics, machine learning & AI, as well as integrating with the wider focus areas of infrastructure, security and application design & delivery.
We are looking for an experienced Solutions Architect for the Azure Cloud and AI Domain Solution Architecture Office, to continue our growth and extend our capabilities in this area.
Responsibilities
his role will be based out of the US with a strong focus on infusing Data & AI workloads into Digital Transformation opportunities and ensuring the full MCS value proposition is positioned with these customers. The roll will also support the enablement of high quality delivery outcomes with colleagues in the timezones. Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

AWS Certifed Solutions Architecture


Description:

We are looking for an AWS Certified Solutions Architect for a federal services company in San Antonio, Texas. The customer is looking to implement Cyber Vault. With your expertise, you will work with a high-performing team to architect and design solutions for a major client. Can be either Security or CIA resource. Can work remotely.


Responsibilities:

IAM/S3/policy creation - strong S3 & strong IAM previous policy implementation of AWS Backup
Understand the customers business & application requirements and translate them into system / technical requirements
Develop a strategy/roadmap to meet the business objective of the client
Provide exceptional AWS technical design and thought leadership
Lead technical workshops and advise customers on architectural and strategic IT decisions
Ensure success in designing, building, and migrating applications, software, and services on the AWS platform
Educate customers on best practices to ensure their solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
Work with other teams to ensure quality and customer success
Capture and share knowledge with our broader technical experts community
Provide both pre-sales architecture support to drive sales along
Ensures that software meets or exceeds specified standards and end-user requirements

Required Skills:

Minimum of 12 years enterprise IT application experience that includes at least 7 years of hands-on software development, DevOps engineering, systems administration, and/or systems architecture
Hands-on AWS Architecture, Design, and Development experience is a must-have!
Well-rounded knowledge of systems, network, security, storage, cloud products, and technologies in differing environments
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Demonstrated ability to architect and implement solutions on AWS
Significant experience in infrastructure architecture, database architecture, networking, and security
History of successful technical consulting and architecture engagements with large-scale customers or enterprises
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers.
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Experience working within the software development or Internet industries is highly desired.
AWS Certified Solution Architect - Associate or Professional is required
Strong written and communication skills
Demonstrated experience leading or developing high quality, enterprise-scale distributed applications using modern software development practices and technologies is highly desired
Expertise in AWS services that contain data at rest (e.g. S3, RDS, EBS, EFS, DynamoDB, CloudWatch Log Groups, etc)
Experience with regulatory compliance for data backup, restore, and recovery 4. Experience designing, prototyping, and implementing Cyber Resiliency architectures and solutions to include concepts of Air Gap Immutable Storage / WORM data snapshots, asynchronous replication, synchronous replication, meeting Recovery Time Objective (RTO) / Recovery Point Objectives (RPO), Cross-Region and cross-account backup (CRAB), and Disaster Recovery

Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
The mission of Salesforce Services is to accelerate our customer’s success through business transformation. Our most strategic customers call us “think partners” because we help them become more agile and differentiated in the marketplace. We leverage CRM, collaboration, mobile and platform technologies to connect employees, customers and business partners together. We push the boundaries of technology and “make the market” by creating proof points for new products and capabilities. Within Salesforce Services, the Business Architect (BA) helps transform our most strategic customers by helping Business & IT understand what is possible and desirable, and how to get there, using all the power of our solutions to enhance and realize their strategy. BAs are customer-directed specialists solely focused on driving customer success through large scale programs, change management, innovation, roadmap, usage, adoption and value. BAs are dedicated to one customer at a time. This is a great opportunity to join the leader in cloud computing in one of Salesforce’s fastest growing businesses.


Responsibilities
Matrix-lead one of Salesforce’s most strategic customers as part of a blended team with other Salesforce resources (Account Executives, Customer Success, Services, Industry) and 3rd party system integrators.
Co-create a personalized plan that aligns corporate goals, what is possible, key business measures / KPIs, and a practical implementation path.
Improve the certainty of delivering large scale change by aligning sponsor goals, key customer and Salesforce stakeholders, and delivery resources into a program with consistent and transparent processes.
Improve the certainty of absorbing large scale transformational change by building communications, education, and continuous feedback loops that engage everyone from end users to senior leaders.
Enable delivery with speed, agility and stability by implementing a decision making framework that balances regional and global attributes, frequency of change, quality of data and risk mitigation.
Accelerate productivity and buy-in through a series of activities that help end-users uncover and articulate barriers, and co-design potential solutions to their needs.
Identify “moments of truth” by visualizing the information stored within Salesforce and other systems via our full suite of analytics capabilities.
Maximize speed to market by clearly understanding Salesforce’s product roadmap, industry reference architectures, AppExchange offerings and agile development.
Personalize best practices to customers including, but not limited to, roadmap, agile development, change management, enterprise collaboration, operational support, and alignment to business strategy. Increase user productivity, reduce TCO and accelerate Salesforce investment payback, by formulating a plan to reduce the number of disparate applications end users access to do their jobs.
Accelerate delivery and reduce project costs by executing a strategy to identify, recruit, on-board, train and retain top talent skilled in Salesforce.
Improve adoption and value by working with senior executives to understand the vital information they need to do their jobs, and the tasks that can be easily simplified via Salesforce’s declarative solutions.
Provide timely account or issue executive summary status reporting both to customers and management.
Advocate customers' product feature priorities internally within Salesforce.
Contribute internally to the Salesforce team, share knowledge and best practices with team members, contribute to internal projects and initiatives, and serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for specific domain or process area.
Required Skills:
Most successful candidates have extensive experience in consulting and services industry as a Sr Manager or director level with engagement experience in a leadership capacity
Travel may be required and varies depending on the client requirements
Innovation
Inquisitive mind, endless curiosity and passion for learning about customers, industries and new approaches to doing things
How end users perform their jobs
Industry challenges and solutions
The full suite of Salesforce’s continuously evolving clouds
AppExchange / 3rd party niche solutions to meet customer needs
Innovations and best practices for delivering cloud solutions
Ability to translate vision and business issues into actionable roadmap and solutions
Leadership
Strong self-starter with the ability to build a network within Salesforce and your assigned customer
Effectively build, develop, and manage relationships with internal and customer senior executives, setting expectations on their role as stakeholders vested in success.
Proven effectiveness at leading and facilitating meetings and workshops
Technology Delivery
Matrix leadership: Motivate, inspire, and coordinate a blended team of Salesforce, Customer, ISV and System Integrators to solve customer challenges.
Ability to manage customer escalations (internally and externally) and negotiate resolution
Thrive in the unknown: creatively solve problems with limited input and resources in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
Flawlessly execute consulting management activities, with high attention to detail, organization and process.
Genuine passion, interest, willingness and ability to adjust to continuously changing priorities and needs
Capability as credible and effective C-level advisor/coach, especially with regards to change management (cultural, business and technical)
Executive-level communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively navigate and mediate conflict and foster honest dialog
Proven experience establishing and running large-scale program management offices
Familiarity with implementing and supporting enterprise solutions (CRM, ERP, etc.)
Excellent understanding of software delivery processes and methodologies (i.e. waterfall, agile, hybrid)
Collaborate with customers and system integrators to map out current state user workflows and functional architectures, evangelize the benefits of cloud-based technologies, and personalize the future state end user workflow.
Deep Salesforce product knowledge and/or demonstrates the ability to quickly learn
Knowledge of process automation, user experience and workflow is a plus.
Consultative approach, including the ability to translate customer needs into user stories and prototypes.
Influence
Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of a customer’s technology organization: COO/CIO to business manager to administrator
Excellent situational awareness - must be comfortable in dynamic customer environments and enthusiastically present our company.
Highly developed soft skills, such as listening, empathy, and the ability to adjust communication style based on the audience.
Strong teamwork and facilitation skills with the ability to:
Balance conversations within groups
Offer suggestions and improvements to process and work effectively with all personalities.
* For Colorado- based roles: Minimum annual salary of $83,700. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/

Requisition Type: Regular
GDIT is looking for a Solutions Architect to support our Indian Health Service (IHS) customer. This is a leadership role on an Electronic Health Record (EHR) modernization program, this will include requirements determination, integration/interoperability (Healthcare Information Technology Standards Panel [HITSP]), health information management compliance, experience with roll out of training and adoption programs and providing mission critical support to our customer.As an Architect overseeing the architectural integrity of our solution for IHS, you will be trusted to provide technical leadership for the current and future state of the solution. In this role, your responsibilities will include:
Must have experience in architecting solutions for commercial EHR products.
Must have experience in Health Information Exchanges (HIE).
Must have experience in healthcare data and analytics (Data governance and management).
Must have experience working on large Federal healthcare projects.
Must have experience working with large complex integrated delivery network deployment of an EHR.
Must have the ability to work at the Enterprise level, working and coordinating efforts across numerous resources, sub-contractors and stakeholders.
Create solutions and conduct performance tests to improve availability, performance, reliability, capacity and scalability in the application, system or database layers.
Analyzes performance requirements, translate into detailed performance test plans and create test scripts.
Assess and develop testing, and integration use case scenarios.
Assists in establishing standard SLAs and ensures the system meets the defined SLAs.
Analyzes test results with engineers, product managers, other stakeholders and coordinates with the respective teams for performance tuning.
Understands systems technical architecture, and able to identify the performance implications for different layers of system based on design discussions or architecture documents.
Architect solutions on the cloud designing infrastructure and selecting viable technology stack(s).
Excellent communication, organization, and analytical skills.
Ability to multi-task and handle changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and simply.
Lead multiple teams driving solution architecture, security and performance.
Provide mentorship to juniors and build the full stack capability within the company.
Provide support to business development team through injection of technical solutions and architectural improvement.
Provide leadership to design, develop, integrate and sustain (break/fix) support for systems and associated interfaces in pre- and post-deployment phases. Leadership support to technical activities to stabilize system operation and ensure suitable system performance may also be required.Analyze and study complex system requirements. Manage system implementation and support using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, and other accepted design techniques. Estimate implementation costs and schedule. Review existing programs and assist in making refinements, reducing operating time, and improving current techniques. Supervise software configuration management. Review current status of system applications and prepare recommendations for systems improvements.Also, develop plans and requirements in the subject matter area for moderately complex to complex systems related to information systems architecture, networking; telecommunications, automation, communications protocols, risk management/electronic analysis, software, lifecycle management, software development methodologies, and modeling and simulation. Perform functional allocation to identify required tasks and their interrelationships. Identify resources required for each task. Demonstrate exceptional oral and written communication skills. Commensurate experience in IT and in new and related older technology that directly relates to the required area of expertise.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
20+ years of experience as an Architect for large-scale enterprise applications.
HITSP experience with an understanding of LOINC, HL7, HL7 FHIR, SNOMED, RxNorm as well as DICOM standards – Open standards in Healthcare Information Technology (HIT)
Experience with Ancillary systems, include: Pharmacy, Radiology & Laboratory Information Systems
Familiarity with acute and ambulatory settings
Understanding of Telehealth technology
This position is a remote role, but must be willing and able to travel up to 25% at times to customer and senior leadership meetings.
Strong experience with MS Office suite of products.
Experience in Application performance monitoring tools
Candidate MUST be able to obtain a Public Trust.
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.

The likely salary range for this position is $151,184 - $257,012, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

Microsoft envisions a world of more possibility, more innovation, more openness, and sky's-the-limit thinking - a cloud-enabled world. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. This mission is bold and at the core of what our customers and employees care deeply about. We have unique capability in harmonizing the needs of both individuals and organizations. We deeply care about taking our ideals and vision global and making a difference in lives and organizations in all corners of the planet. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas, because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.
To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture Check out all our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us
Microsoft is experiencing a renaissance due to our growth mindset and the modernization of how we engage our customers. Digital transformation is fueled by an intense focus on how we understand and engage our customers. That said, our customers still have over 30 years of Mainframe and Midrange (AS400) systems that make it difficult to have a full understanding of our customers. This critical role is responsible for driving the modernization from core product group engineering and help our customers migrate these Mainframe/Midrange workloads to newer, agile and distributed Microsoft platforms and Azure cloud. You will help customers not just save Capex and Opex but also help introduce new business functionalities to their core business systems through these migrations.
Being part of core product engineering, we will collaborate with different products and services group to solve some of the hardest and most interesting technology challenges in the industry, for one of the best technology companies in the world. Making Mainframe/Midrange migrations successful on our platform is critical for the non-linear growth strategy of Microsoft. Through these migrations we expect to drive revenues as well as product truth for different products and services. To solve these challenges, you will work with some of Microsoft’s best engineers, data scientists, customer success teams and partner teams. This is a significant and rare opportunity for an ambitious self-starter who is passionate about technology and driving impact.
This will be a hands-on Engineering Architect (Mainframe Modernization) role requiring a strong cross group collaboration experience. Role will be based in the United States (Remote).
Responsibilities
Work with customers to understand the current migration/modernization requirements and design cloud native solution for Mainframe and Midrange workloads.
Work with Engineering team, Product Groups and Partner teams to design and develop Mainframe/Midrange data modernization tools and best practices.
Help customer chose right migration tools and patterns for the specific workload using Azure services.
Working hands-on with your team and our customers through design and implementation, setting examples for good engineering practices.
Exhibiting technical ownership across the mainframe modernization engineering teams and be the SME for field teams.
Help create a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full and authentic self, where all voices are heard, and where we do our best work as a result.
Qualifications
Qualification:
8+ years of technical experience with Mainframe or Midrange (AS400) systems with architecture background.
2+ years of experience migrating workloads from Mainframe systems to Distributed (x86) systems.
Experience with either of the migration patterns (i.e., rehost/reengineering/ replatform) and proficiency with modernization practices, approaches, and tools.
Preferred Qualifications:
Good to have intermediate knowledge of public cloud (i.e., Azure, AWS, GCP).
Hands-on technical experience with IBM Mainframe, Midrange systems and with technologies such as COBOL, JCL, CICS, DB2 (z/OS, LUW, iSeries), VSAM etc.
Expert knowledge of online, batch applications along with performance aspects of the application runtime end to end.
2+ years of experience migrating workloads from Mainframe systems to the Cloud.
Emulator experience such as Microfocus Enterprise Server or compilers like Raincode.
Intermediate experience with any one of these languages C#, C++, Java, Python.
Exposure to Cloud Solution Architecture and Design Practices is preferred.
Relational and Non-Relational DB experience such as (SQL Server, Cosmos and PostgreSQL etc.).
Presentation experience, public speaking skills and strong communication abilities.

Salesforce has over 7,500 developers with offices throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Salesforce's development teams need to work smarter, faster and standards compliant. You will be a principal technical leader driving the long term vision for Git and Perforce version control systems. You will be part of a team that is responsible for ensuring that systems are reliable, highly available and operating at its peak efficiency 24 x 7 x 365. In addition this team enables code searchability, discoverability & intelligence to improve internal developer efficiency.
This role will encompass systems design, programming, project & program management and reporting to ensure we deliver on compliance initiatives. A detailed understanding of centralized versus decentralized version control is vital.

Lead various technical and compliance related initiatives with a highly collaborative background
Architect, design and implement tools and processes to continuously improve our use of SCM services
Configure, deploy, manage and maintain large cloud-hosted distributed version control systems; including auto-scaling, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting and disaster recovery in multiple geographical areas
Design and implement the access models to ensure compliance with operational and security requirements
Collaborate with Software Engineering and IT Global Infrastructure to maintain continuous availability of critically important systems
Strong scripting skills in any Python and/or UNIX with the ability to provide requirements for task automation, resource monitoring and performance monitoring

Demonstrate knowledge of design and architectural frameworks to improve scale and performance in constrained environments

Engage with users to become a trusted enthusiast to drive the evolution of SCM tools and processes

Effective working with different teams and providing technical guidance
Experience/Skills Required
Expert knowledge of SCM tools both as an administrator and developer with tools like GitHub & Perforce

Solid understanding for Infrastructure as Code(IaC) like Terraform.
Proven experience utilizing features in DVCS for integrations with different systems
Experience in modern CI/CD technologies such as Jenkins and building seamless integrations
Domain expertise supporting services for engineering organizations
In-depth, hands-on experience with Linux, networking, server, and cloud architectures for high-availability environments
Experience with automation/configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Salt, etc.)
Experience with enterprise monitoring systems is highly desired (e.g. Nagios, Zabbix, Splunk)

Experience with Agile methodologies is desired but not required

To delight our customers in a Cloud First world, Microsoft Azure cloud business delivers highly available online services with cutting edge features and innovative functionality lighting up on a regular basis. Availability, reliability, and performance are all key differentiators that customers demand and expect in cloud services when choosing a provider.
A major factor in the quality, as experienced by our customers, is the quality of the infrastructure that is running the cloud. Cloud Hardware Infrastructure Engineering (CHIE) is a fast growing R&D organization that designs, engineers and qualifies the entire cloud-optimized infrastructure, including advanced Compute and Storage server technology that push the technological.
Our team, within CHIE, drives the hardware validation lifecycle and is accountable for the quality experience of our cloud customers. Our goal is to exceed customer expectations in every aspect related to infrastructure quality. Therefore, we invest heavily in automating the validation processes, from the inception and throughout the entire h/w lifecycle. We invest in systems that continuously monitor the hardware quality in production, predict hardware failures, detect behavioral anomalies and mitigate issues before they impact customers. Our mission is to ensure a consistent high quality of production hardware through automation and smart engineering that can scale as fast as the cloud business grows.
The ideal candidate for this position will have excellent development skills and collaboration and experience with distributed systems. Hardware experience is a plus. We offer a strong team, exciting challenges, and a fun place to work. The work environment is where you can make a real impact on millions of end users. This is also a unique opportunity to work with world-class engineers. Apply now for this unique green field opportunity!
Responsibilities
Obsession about customer experience
Design, develop and deliver software that measures and improves the quality of Azure Hardware that exceeds customer expectations
Identify and fix or drive fixes for systemic issue
Collaborate with hardware architects to determine end to end verifications
Solve problems relating to mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
BS degree in Computer Science or related field
Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written
1+ years development experience, outstanding coding and design skills
Preferrred Qualifications:
Firm sense of accountability and ownership for end-to-end project lifecycle
Knowledge and working experience in data mining, statistics, mathematics is a plus
Capable of technical deep dives into service design, operating systems, networking and storage

Job Title: Lead Data Architect - Work from Home
Description:
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role

As a Lead Enterprise Data Architect, you will be responsible for developing and communicating data architecture plans in support of transformational or business program-led initiatives, and then driving the plans to fruition in collaboration with business and IT owners, architecture colleagues, and the development teams.
You will define and enforce data architecture standards, procedures, and policies to ensure alignment with strategy, and consistency across different program and project implementations. You will also guide application development teams in the data design of complex solutions and ensure that teams are in alignment with the data architecture principles, standards, strategies, and target states.
The Main Responsibilities
Provide guidance and direction on the usage of emerging trends and technical capabilities.
Create, maintain, and govern architectural views and blueprints depicting the Business and IT landscape in its current, transitional, and future state.
Define and maintain standards for artifacts containing architectural content within the operating model.
Apply business domain expertise to assigned programs and areas of specialty.
What We Look For in a Candidate
4+ years working in data architecture
Ability to incorporate Enterprise data strategies in delivered Solutions
Ability to build and manage enterprise data and object models, leveraging both industry and application-specific service models.
Experience with large broadly scoped Data Architecture programs.
Responsible for creating design patterns and best practices for data engineering and the integration of data through the enterprise.
Experience with data catalogs, profiling tools and processes a plus.
Experience with modern event-based data architecture, Kafka, streaming analytics, etc.
Familiar with training and deployment of AI Machine Learning models and automation a plus
Experienced with API architectures; web services, ESB, managed API.
Ability to evaluate and assess existing legacy data assets. Create as-is and to-be architecture artifacts.
Well versed in the Data domains (Data Warehousing, Analytics, BI, Big Data, Operational Data Store, Metadata, Master Data, Unstructured Data, ETL, ESB)
Experience in architecture governance, controls, and peer reviews with regards to data, security, and cloud
At least 10 years of experience in information technology
What to Expect Next

Description:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.
5+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) including 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum).
Ability to drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation.
Current hands-on implementation experience required.

Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems.

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, HPC, Batch/Real-time Data processing, MPP systems, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and database migration capabilities. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy systems and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, EMR, Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), S3, Relational Database Service (RDS)/aurora, and Amazon Kinesis.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, generating consulting proposals, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.
