Job Summary:
Location: Virtual
Who are we?
Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment and eCommerce company, comprised of four market leaders: Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, Front Line Management Group and Live Nation Network. Ticketmaster.com is the global event ticketing leader and one of the world’s top five eCommerce sites, with over 26 million monthly unique visitors. Live Nation Concerts produces over 20,000 shows annually for more than 2,000 artists globally. Front Line is the world’s top artist management company, representing over 250 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions, enabling over 800 advertisers to tap into the 200 million consumers Live Nation delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenation.com/investors.
Who are you?
Business Intelligence, as data visualization and storytelling service, is an integral part of the Core Data Services team. We are looking for a seasoned manager to lead and improve BI as a service.
Have you done traditional BI well? Been there, done that - star schema, EDW, report design for ease of understanding the data? Ready to take Business Intelligence to the next level?
A successful candidate will be able to cover a wider range of responsibilities from managing existing BI infrastructure, reports, reporting systems, user demands and SLAs while participating in architecting a new robust offering of data visualization and data storytelling as an extension of an enterprise data platform. This includes developing a robust semantic model and a set of business metrics that can be used to unify data analysis between different departments and use cases, creating a predefined set of best practices for visualizing those metrics, default report layouts and functions that enable geographically diverse and intrinsically complex business to be expressed via easy to consume data analysis interfaces.
Successful candidate must be able to demonstrate ability to build and maintain scalable and robust systems, secure infrastructure, extensive standard operating procedures for ease of maintenance to ensure that data is available to BI users in a predictable, reliable and SLA-supported manner.
THE TEAM
Core Data Services team is at the center of Data and Analytics initiative. We are in the beginning of our journey to build and enterprise data platform capable to be a true underpinning of any data needs for the enterprise. Our mission is to make reliable data available and enable value creation by the data community of engineers, analysts and decision makers. Core Data Services team consists of Platform engineering team, Data Engineering, Data Enablement and Operations team. BI is part of Data Enablement and is a critical component of providing users visibility into the data and providing self-service for interacting with data first hand.
Core Data Services is currently in process of adopting Spark as our main ETL engine and realizing the value of highly functional, performant and transparent Data Lake, all this while maintaining and streamlining existing data infrastructure and doing careful migration. These activities will create new opportunities for business intelligence functionality and effective data value delivery
THE ROLE
This is a unique opportunity for a senior BI architect to own BI tech stack, BI data architecture and best practices at Live Nation Entertainment supporting new level of business demands and expectation for solid data definitions and semantic models to underpin effective data visualizations and support business and analytical decision makers.
The right candidate will utilize prior experience building effective BI environments to re-think and re-define modern functionality of reporting, analysis, dashboarding and aiding decision-making processes. Defining the service model for business intelligence is a new frontier and we are looking for an exceptional architect to conquer it.
Success in this role means satisfied business community with robust BI reporting, effective self-service, stable and secure BI environment based on a modern tech stack.
WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO
Stabilize, document and govern existing BI space
Continuously work with business community to ensure that suite of offered reports satisfy expectations for data latency, report performance and ease of use
Partner with data engineering and data operations teams to design and implement BI data store, effectively manage BI infrastructure and ensure data consistency for BI purposes
Support existing BI environment which includes multiple data sources, multiple BI technologies, large data volumes and large user community. Continuously drive toward simplicity, automation, user self-service
Design and implement effective practices for business intelligence team including SDLC, data integration, change control
Improve and evolve governance and data security practices in BI
Work with other BI teams and architects to share and evangelize best practices, unify tech stack, evangelize enterprise data definitions and consistent metric visualizations
WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING - TECHNICAL SKILLS/COMPETENCIES
Technical skillset to work with large data volumes, advanced data models, low latency, and high business complexity to oversee and create a large set of functional and effective business performance reports and visualization
Advanced SQL skills
Curiosity and drive to learn entertainment and ticketing space and be able to lead conversations about business metrics, dependencies, references and help your user community to understand and internalize the information in BI reports
Ability to visualize data and unlock its power while hiding complexity
Experience in data modeling and ability to understand data lineage, data dependencies and effectively use that to service BI users in a way that all of the complexity is hidden
Understanding of BI vendor space and differences in architecture of BI products, their features, fit for purpose, limitations and map that to the existing use cases and user needs. Prior exposure to Tableau, Domo, IBM Cognos, Looker and other BI solutions
Offer BI as a platform functionality to allow department and product focused BI engineers to build on to of it
Understand Data Cataloging in order to integrate reports with metadata
Experience in supporting a large set of BI reports in production for a variety of use cases ranging from high demand operational reports to highly analytical to strategic.
Solid base in mathematics in order to be able to explain advanced metrics, support users in choosing reports as well as ability to bridge between requirements and technical implementation of specific calculations
Experience building multinational solution for BI
Self-motivated, driven and eager to contribute – with no ego – for the betterment of the team
COVID-19 vaccination will be required for this position subject to legally valid exemptions
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance your work and home life. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It’s talent that matters to us and we encourage applications from people irrespective of their gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities.
Live Nation strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), family and medical care leave or the denial of family and medical care leave, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), marital status, domestic partner status, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, military and veteran status, political affiliation, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship, race, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, and gender expression, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law, rule, ordinance or regulation.
We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act and consistent with other similar and / or applicable laws in other areas.
We also afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability. For this reason, Live Nation will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant consistent with its legal obligations to do so, including reasonable accommodations related to pregnancy in accordance with applicable local, state and / or federal law. As part of its commitment to make reasonable accommodations, Live Nation also wishes to participate in a timely, good faith, interactive process with a disabled applicant to determine effective reasonable accommodations, if any, which can be made in response to a request for accommodations. Applicants are invited to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made to assist them to perform the essential functions of the position they seek. Any applicant who requires an accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of the job should contact a Human Resources Representative to request the opportunity to participate in a timely interactive process. Live Nation will also provide reasonable religious accommodations on a case by case basis.
HIRING PRACTICES
The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
Live Nation recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.

SBD is looking for a Database Architect to join our team supporting our federal client. The Database Architect is responsible for designing a secure, scalable, and redundant data layer for our client's records management system. The Database Architect will work closely with the rest of the team to design a solution that is compliant with our client's data standards, policies, and procedures.
This position is approved to be fully remote within the United States.
Responsibilities Include:
Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve company data.
Examine and identify database structural necessities by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming.
Assess database implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.
Install and organize information systems to guarantee company functionality.
Prepare accurate database design and architecture reports for management and executive teams.
Oversee the migration of data from legacy systems to new solutions.
Monitor the system performance by performing regular tests, troubleshooting, and integrating new features.
Recommend solutions to improve new and existing database systems.
Educate staff members through training and individual support.
Offer support by responding to system problems in a timely manner.
Participate in requirements gathering sessions, collecting data requirements, and designing solutions alongside other team members.
Required Experience and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or relevant field.
8+ years of related experience with a minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
3+ Years working experience building data solutions in AWS.
Must have an understanding of AWS RDS.
Must have database design expertise.
Experience with Oracle 13c, Microsoft SQL Server on AWS RDS, AWS Data lakes, and data warehouses.
Strong knowledge of database structure systems and data mining.
Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
Outstanding problem solver.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Experience supporting repository or records management systems is a plus.
This federal client requires US Citizenship with the ability to obtain a federal Public Trust clearance prior to starting. Due to the requirements of this federal client, dual citizenship will not be accepted.
Must be able to pass a comprehensive background check.
Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a medical exemption or religious accommodation is approved. Individuals are considered fully vaccinated two weeks after their last dose of their vaccine. Confirmation of vaccine is required.

Plan, design, manage & analyze data management solutions to meet strategic data management solutions and Informatica environments to meet strategic, usability, performance, reliability, scalability, control, and security requirements. Requires demonstrable knowledge in areas of data management such as data cataloging and classification technologies, data governance, test data management, ETL technologies and data lineage, as well as experience with Informatica platform solutions.
Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.
Create and maintain business continuity plans and lead execution of required annual business continuity tests.
Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.
QualificationsRequired
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or MCA or equivalent degree.
5 to 8 years of Enterprise Data Architecture, data platforms, data strategy consulting or equivalent data management experience.
3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.
Advanced knowledge of Informatica data management products is desirable.
Experience with Informatica platform management.
Certification on one or more Informatica platforms is a plus.
Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.
Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)


Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. Mission
YOUR FUNCTION:

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. To support our unit, we are looking for a data architect who can help our customers to build and execute a data strategy.

You are convinced that data is the new oil and are able to convince customers of the value of data. You are able to design a modern data architecture, but also to guide the customer in the way the organize themselves to become a data- driven company.

You are eager to support the data value proposition and providing pre-sales effort.

What we expect you to do:

Design and build E2E modern data platform architectures (Data engineering, visualizations, AI and MDM).
Guide the customer in his journey to become a data driven organization
Create and roll out data governance strategies and data management processes
Manage projects in an agile way to maximize the business value of the customer
Lead data consultants in executing various practice initiatives.
You actively participate in pre-sales proposals in which data, data engineering and data science is positioned or where related tools support the project. You work out (preferably together with the team) an approach, estimates and budgeting.
Support sales proactively and convince customers to invest in data solutions.

Profile
YOUR PROFILE:

• You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience• You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends• You have a hands-on background in different data domains (MDM, Data Engineering, Big Data, Data Science, etc.)• You have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.• You are able to implement a data governance policy and you can guide the customer through the necessary changes of becoming a data driven organization • You have excellent communication skills and report smoothly (both oral and written)• You have a commercial attitude and are able to convince customers to work with us.• You are used to giving presentations to clients at a management level, but you have sufficient insight into the technical matters to be able to talk along on that level as well.• You can handle stress and a multi-focus job.• You have a pro-active, can-do mindset• You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken)

OUR OFFER:

• The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference• The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities• Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need• Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working• 32 days of annual leave, because life isn’t all about working• Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card.• Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you• And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!


Convinced? APPLY NOW!

Interested? Questions? Recommendations? For more information, contact our recruiter Victoria Maximova directly: 02 801 58 36
Organization
Inetum Realdolmen, a member of the European Inetum Group with approximately 1,950 highly qualified employees, provides strategic, tactical and operational ICT solutions for over 1,000 customers throughout the Benelux. In every cooperation, Realdolmen realizes the potential of people and organizations and strives to keep ICT human. We are driven by technological innovation, but we advance at the speed of your ambition, results-focused and managing fundamental change.
Our company motto "New Challenges, New Ideas" reflects this.

An employer you really want to work for!
Not only is Realdolmen a no-nonsense, solid, stable and experienced company with great in-house knowledge and expertise, but we also put our employees first: every individual receives the attention they need. ‘Heart for People' is more than just words for us – it's one of our very core values.
Satellite offices, extensive training opportunities, work-life balance, competence reviews and career opportunities: these are no empty promises for us. Our organization attaches great importance to diversity. We guarantee an objective selection process, whereby candidates are tested and selected solely on the basis of their qualities and skills.

With us it's all about you!

Belgium
Location
Customers' offices, Inetum-Realdolmen offices or home office

We are seeking talented data scientists to join our team. As a data scientist, you will primarily work with the team to implement new or refine existing AI components to the toxicity system. You will collaborate closely with Engineering and Product teams to identify, test, and support implementation of discovered insights. You may be responsible for querying, exploring, manipulating, refining, linking, and curating data. You will discuss results with colleagues and iteratively refine models as needed. When you conclude that the analysis is ready, you will partner with members of the engineering team to simplify, architect, and implement a solution for scalable deployment. Additionally, you may be part of teams that work with and present analysis directly to game studios.*Your responsibilities as a data scientist will include:*Data exploration, analysis, and feature extractionUsing machine learning to extract information from our diverse set of featuresWriting, reviewing, checking-in and documenting code; Solutions Architect

Location: Appleton, WI or Milwaukee, WI


EDCi provides infrastructure, modern workplace and call center technology services and

solutions to clients throughout Wisconsin and the Midwest. Through our partnership and

certifications with leading technology providers including Cisco, Microsoft, Citrix, Genesys, IBM

and LogRhythm, our customers receive the highest quality of product and service the industry

has to offer.


EDCi has an immediate opening for a Solutions Architect in its Data Center/Modern Workplace

practice. The Solutions Architect is a key contributor in the pre-sale process, acting as the

technical lead to evaluate customer's needs and construct a solution to address those needs

through consulting or professional services. The Solutions Architect collaborates with sales,

professional services, and manufacturer technical support resources to ensure proposed deals

include technical solutions that are supported by key customer technical decision-makers. The

Solutions Architect is responsible for achieving a profit goal to achieve the business goals in the

practice.


Work breakdown—50% billable with customer workshops, consulting, project success; 30%-
customer-facing sales, 20%-blogging/marketing, practice development, administration.


When you join the EDCi team, you’ll receive many perks, such as:
Remote work from home
Paid holidays, vacation and sick time
Flexibility – work from home when applicable
Bring Your Own PC Policy
Cell phone reimbursement
On-site chiropractic care
Casual dress
Funded training and certifications
Health, dental & vision insurance
401K match
And much more!
Candidates must be willing to be a resident of Wisconsin or within 120 miles of one of EDCi's

offices-either Appleton, WI or Milwaukee, WI

Job Details
Location: Open to Fully Remote, Flex (1-3 days/week in the office), or Office-Based (4-5 days/week in office)
Salesforce has over 7,500 developers with offices throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Salesforce's development teams need to work smarter, faster and standards compliant. As part of Developer Productivity Experience, we provide secure, reliable, easy to use, and intelligent engineering tooling and services that are the foundation for all developers at Salesforce.
We leverage best-in-industry offerings to offer outstanding tools and services. We go above and beyond to delight our customers. We balance well across Trust and Run the Business, incremental and pioneering innovations in our tooling and services to power our Salesforce Chapter 3 journey.
You will be a principal technical leader driving the long term vision for Git and Perforce version control systems. You will be part of a team that is responsible for ensuring that systems are reliable, highly available and operating at its peak efficiency 24 x 7 x 365. In addition this team enables code searchability, discoverability & intelligence to improve internal developer efficiency.
This role will encompass systems design, programming, project & program management and reporting to ensure we deliver on compliance initiatives. A detailed understanding of centralized versus decentralized version control is vital.
Responsibilities
Lead various technical and compliance related initiatives with a highly collaborative background
Architect, design and implement tools and processes to continuously improve our use of SCM services
Configure, deploy, manage and maintain large cloud-hosted distributed version control systems; including auto-scaling, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting and disaster recovery in multiple geographical areas
Design and implement the access models to ensure compliance with operational and security requirements
Collaborate with Software Engineering and IT Global Infrastructure to maintain continuous availability of critically important systems
Strong scripting skills in any Python and/or UNIX with the ability to provide requirements for task automation, resource monitoring and performance monitoring
Experience with server hardware, networking, storage, and large scale infrastructure designs and troubleshooting
Ongoing administration of infrastructure and regular patches/maintenance as per compliance requirements
Demonstrate knowledge of design and architectural frameworks to improve scale and performance in constrained environments
Back-up and restore management; use back-up and recovery standard methodologies to ensure systems are protected from data loss in compliance with established business continuity and DR practices
Engage with users to become a trusted enthusiast to drive the evolution of SCM tools and processes
Support release, patch release process & on call rotation
Effective working with different teams and providing technical guidance
Experience/Skills Required
Expert knowledge of SCM tools both as an administrator and developer with tools like GitHub & Perforce
Solid understanding of configuring, deploying, managing and maintaining large cloud-hosted version control systems in cloud infrastructures such as AWS and/or Google Cloud
Solid understanding for Infrastructure as Code(IaC) like Terraform.
Proven experience utilizing features in DVCS for integrations with different systems
Experience in modern CI/CD technologies such as Jenkins and building seamless integrations
Domain expertise supporting services for engineering organizations
In-depth, hands-on experience with Linux, networking, server, and cloud architectures for high-availability environments
Experience with automation/configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Salt, etc.)
Experience with enterprise monitoring systems is highly desired (e.g. Nagios, Zabbix, Splunk)
Fluency in one or more scripting languages such as Python, UNIX shell
Fluency in object-oriented programming languages like Java
Knowledge of tools like static/dynamic code analysis (e.g. Sonar, Coverity), code review, etc. and integrations with code repositories desired
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Experience with Agile methodologies is desired but not required

Company Description
Become part of our growing community of bright, motivated people who are dedicated and inspired by what they do best. Principled, honest, and supremely attentive are qualities that set us apart and guide our decisions, every day. Our creative approach to technology continuously breaks new ground so that our customers can do more. Solving problems and revolutionizing healthcare is the reason Intelerad was founded. For over 20 years, Intelerad has grown into a leader of the medical imaging software industry. We take pride in being a world-class healthcare solutions company with over 400 employees and over 1000 customer sites. Today, our distributed solutions play a vital role in the delivery of healthcare across 11 time zones, 3 continents, and counting.
We provide a workplace that encourages teamwork, promotes well-being, autonomy, and creativity. We are Intelerad. Join us if you care to make a difference in healthcare.

Job Description
Purpose:
As a Data Architect and Migration Manager, you will be responsible for architecting data structures, validating business systems processes and uses and their impacts on core data and delivering rapid, accurate data migrations for acquired businesses.
As Data Architect, you will ensure that business processes, system configurations and uses, and integrations are designed to create and maintain accurate, clean, and complete enterprise data. This data includes products, customers and contacts, contracts and all other core data that drives transactions, business intelligence and decision-making within our business.
As Migration Manager, during an acquisition integration program, working cross-functionally with all business functions, you will identify key sources of data and ensure that the data is cleaned, mapped and migrated into Intelerad data structures and systems on a timely and accurate basis.
This position is expected to grow over time to incorporate additional responsibilities and opportunities as our business continues to expand.
Responsibilities:
Enterprise Data Architect:
Evaluate and document key enterprise business systems data structures across Order-to-Cash, Talent, Professional Services, Support and Accounting functions
Understand the business process and system implications of changes to data structures
Drive changes to businesses systems and processes to create and maintain accurate data
Own and maintain data flows across all Lead-to-Cash business systems
Acquisition Integration:
Drive data migration planning activities for acquired businesses
Identify key sources of enterprise data within acquired businesses
Drive process across operational teams to clean, de-duplicate, map & transform data
Ensure data from acquired businesses is loaded into core business systems on an accurate and timely basis
Drive technical innovation and efficiency in data migration planning and execution during acquisition integrations
Administration and Maintenance:
Create and maintain tools and processes to identify, clean and otherwise maintain clean and accurate data within core business systems
Participate in any project deemed necessary by the organization

Qualifications

A college or post-graduate degree in a technical field (MIS, Computer Science, etc.) or requisite education and experience
A minimum of 5 years of business systems implementation experience
Healthcare industry experience
Experience with common software industry business systems platforms (Salesforce, NetSuite, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Desired background:
Lean Six Sigma certification
Acquisition integration experience
Software company experience
Desired Competencies:
Business Process Expertise – have a deep understanding of and ability to clearly articulate best practices across core business processes.
Data Migration – multiple experiences migrating data across integrated business systems
Drive & Discipline – ability to focus and work hard to achieve the right results
Mental Agility – a keen intellect and comfort with complexity; enjoy tackling new challenges and solving problems; ability to 'think outside the box' and move concepts to implementation
Detail Orientation – be thorough and organized and consistently deliver high quality work
Communication - clearly communicate ideas and results to diverse business and technical audiences using the appropriate tool for the job: email, presentation, training, etc.
Hunger – Appetite for learning & improving systems and processes
Oriented on teamwork, collaboration, and knowledge sharing
Excellent problem-solving skills
Autonomy
Additional Information
All qualified candidates will be asked to complete a 30 minute pre-employment assessment.

Work you'll do
This is a unique opportunity to be a part of growing data operations and enterprise controls team that works on new and existing high-end data management platforms within Deloitte. You will be responsible for architecture and performance of DataOps, Master Data & Enterprise Controls solutions


Informatica solutions to support organizational maturing of data management and data governance capabilities in a complex hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Responsibilities include:

Technical ability and communication skills to understand and work directly with the Informatica vendor to influence overall vendor roadmap. Work with internal teams to build out and maintain internal platform roadmaps and to plan and lead platform upgrades.
Understand vendor cloud roadmap strategy and develop our cloud roadmap strategy for internal platforms.
Ability to clearly communicate and update leadership on on-going challenges and platform initiatives.
Highly collaborative and self-motivated, taking ownership of deliverables and responsibilities.
Support and coordinate the efforts of Subject Matter Experts, Server Teams, Development, Quality Assurance, Usability, Training, and other internal resources for the successful implementation of system enhancements and fixes.
Work closely with cross functional teams in an agile environment; align and influence stakeholders and resources to deliver data solutions to market.
Understand customer usage patterns and build relationships with key influencers in the internal platform user community. Monitor and measure customer usage.
Responsible for platform monitoring and notification of issues. Monitor and measure platform up-time.
Perform troubleshooting and problem resolution when needed.
Work with other team members to provide 24/7 support for Production issues/outages.
Alert appropriate colleagues of unplanned platform issues/outages.

Create and maintain platform architecture and technical documentation.

3+ years of experience in Informatica platforms.

Experience with Informatica platform management.

Experience with Global IDs platform is a plus.
Experience with Delphix platform is a plus.
Some experience with Informatica competitor products is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Cloud Infrastructure Platforms such as MSFT Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Strong analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills, as well as communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express complex business concepts in non-technical terms.
Experience in Technical Architecture and Technical delivery using Agile Methodologies.
Experience working with cross-functional teams in delivery of new products or services.
Strong people leadership skills, including developing others.
Strong systems and application delivery ability.

Ability to travel up to 5% is required (While 5% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice).

Job Title: Director of Architecture - Data and Analytics
Description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.
At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.
How you’ll make an impact...
The Director of Architecture - Data and Analytics is responsible for the overall architectural direction, feasibility, usability and coherence of analytical data usage, machine learning and artificial intelligence at Xero.
The savvy use of Data underpins every aspect of our product development at Xero and as such, you will work closely with technical leaders across the business to jointly lift company spanning capabilities such as integration, data exchange, product instrumentation, feedback loops and data capture.
In collaboration with the Executive General Manager for Data and the GMs within the Data team, you will define and lead the execution of technical roadmaps that support the development and evolution of the required capabilities, improves developer productivity, performance, security and data stewardship.
You will provide leadership, mentoring and direction to a small team of architects within the Data portfolio. You will also provide expert advice on M&A work as required to support Xero’s business strategy.
This role will drive massive change which spans many teams, and you will need to have a strong interest in doing the right thing for our internal delivery pods and our end users. You will also be able to think critically and strategically about Xero as a holistic business and direct your team and influence your peers and colleagues accordingly.
What you'll bring with you...
Demonstrable experience leading the architectural thinking on analytical data usage, machine learning and artificial intelligence within an organization of similar complexity
A comprehensive knowledge of relevant technology, changes and trends and the motivation and mindset to continually grow the knowledge of how they may benefit Xero
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a track record in articulating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience building and leading teams of technical experts who collaborate, communicate and get the right things done
Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously.
Familiar with multiple software development methodologies and styles
Has contributed to one or more open source projects.
Relevant qualifications, ideally in software engineering.


What you'll do...
Work with the rest of the Data leadership team to develop a clear, mutual understanding of priorities
Develop the technical strategy for your portfolio, working with other technical leaders to ensure proposed solutions are scalable and using best practices
Define, own and communicate the relevant roadmaps and prioritisation (including the development of business cases as required)
Collaborate proactively with the architectural leaders of adjacent portfolios to ensure a coherent Xero wide approach to the analytical usage of data
Proactively identify and resolve architectural issues that impact the speed at which the development teams can deliver features and mentor other architects to do the same within their sphere of influence
Provide technical leadership for your team, providing feedback and guidance on significant projects
Play an active role in the global architecture team, actively contributing to Xero-wide projects and strategies and providing the viewpoint of your portfolio
Attract, retain, develop and motivate exceptional talent
Lead by example, care for your team, and establish credibility with the quality of your own and your team's planning, documentation, communication and execution
Represent Xero at external events to raise awareness of the work we do and the career opportunities we offer
Cultivate a fun, rewarding, agile and results-driven culture that lives and breathes our Xero values


About Xero?

Diversity of people brings diversity of thought, and we like that. A collaborative and inclusive environment is important to us. Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge and support you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We are a place where personal development, innovation, and well-being are not just inspired but celebrated.

We value our people and offer a wide range of compelling benefits and perks, including Xero shares. Xero’s collaborative culture is underscored by our values - #Ownership, #Challenge, #Beautiful, #Human and #Team - which empower us to understand and serve customers, attract top talent and continuously innovate. From the moment you step through our doors, you’ll feel welcome and supported to do the best work of your life.

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects as well creating solution and tools.
This individual will serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers and partners leverage the search services on AWS (Amazon Elasticsearch) to solve their data management needs. Amazon Elasticsearch Service is a fully managed service that makes it easy to deploy, secure, and operate Elasticsearch at scale with zero down time. The candidate will also acquire expert level knowledge and deliver engagements using the rest of the AWS NoSQL Services (DynamoDB, Neptune, ElasticCache, Timestream and more). AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as DynamoDB, Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), ElasticCache, S3, ElasticSearch, Neptune, Timestream and more.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, generating consulting proposals, contributing to internal Area of Depth programs and Technical Field Community, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs and whitepapers as well as creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to architect, design and build customer’s Amazon NoSQL implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing relational database systems to NoSQL databases.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services, as needed

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with OLTP and OLAP systems design and performance optimization
Experience with RDBMS and SQL
Experience with NonRelational technologies such as Amazon DynamoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Redis
Experience with non-relational, NoSQL databases and other data analytics applications
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
Industry leadership in the fields of database, Analytics or data sciences
Implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments

At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.
We’re growing and we are looking to add a Data Architect to our fast-paced and customer-oriented Engineering team.
In the Data Engineering organization, we are building the next generation of infrastructure that will enable us to collect, manage, and transform data at a new level of scale. As a Data Architect, you will lead the design of our entire data infrastructure - collection, storage, compute, and management - in conjunction with our engineering teams. You will also partner closely with data science and experience teams to define patterns for producing high quality data that allow those teams to work more independently.
This is a unique opportunity to join Jungle Scout at a time where we are rapidly scaling our data collection capabilities and overall data infrastructure. You will have a direct impact on the future of data engineering at Jungle Scout, with the remit to define new practices, tools, and capabilities for the organization.
Location: We’re a remote-first company and looking to hire this person anywhere between the PST - EST timezone.
Interested in learning more? Let’s get into the details:
In the Data Architect role, you will:
Design systems to collect, store, and process 10s to 100s of TBs of data per day in collaboration with engineering teams.
Lead technical discussions and decision making with data engineering and data science teams at Jungle Scout. Hold a high bar for engineering excellence through design and code reviews. Set standards and best practices around how we manage data at Jungle Scout.
Evaluate new technologies, build prototypes, and provide recommendations on new tools, systems, and frameworks to improve how we use data at Jungle Scout.
Collaborate with data science and engineering teams to define patterns for serving data to data scientists, experience teams, and external partners. Contribute to Jungle Scout’s roadmap and data strategy.
Who you are:
Passionate about making an impact by working with engineering teams in addition to hands-on contribution. Excited to build data products that have a direct impact on customers and growth at Jungle Scout.
Experienced communicating ideas, architecture, and technical decisions through documents, diagrams, and presentations. Experienced architecting data platforms and infrastructure to handle Terabytes of data per day through multiple product cycles. Experience architecting data platforms and infrastructure to handle Terabytes of data per day through multiple product cycles.
Passionate and knowledgeable about modern data architectures (data lakes, stream processing, etc).
Experience with modern DevOps practices.
Experience with an object-oriented programming language (Python, Scala, Java, etc)
Bonus points if you have:
Experience collecting public web data at scale.
Experience evaluating and implementing tools for data management (data catalog, lineage, data quality monitoring, etc).
Experience designing data pipelines to improve observability.
Experience with deploying infrastructure as code with SDKs like CDK, Terraform, or Pulumi.
Working at Jungle Scout
The BEST team.
Remote-first culture.
International Meetups.
Access to Jungle Scout tools & experts.
Performance Bonus.
Flexible Vacation.
Comprehensive Health Benefits & Retirement Program.

For more than 160 years, The Hanover has been committed to delivering on our promises and being there when it matters the most. We live our values every day, demonstrating we CARE.

Our growing Enterprise Automation team is currently seeking a Technical Architect, in Worcester, MA or remote work location.

This is a full-time role.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
It is a great opportunity to join the growing Enterprise Automation Practice team at The Hanover. We are professionals with varied backgrounds that are focused on driving real business outcomes leveraging cutting edge AI and Robotic tools for execution of automation projects across the enterprise. Position allows you to partner with technical and business resources of the organization and enhance your personal brand and learnings in the process.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Author and own the technical approach and design document for Automation Projects across different technologies
Lead and drive architecture design reviews and change management board reviews
Perform design/code reviews and related development activities for automations of different complexities
Communicates effectively and provides leadership and guidance to technical team members throughout the course of the project
Assists the project manager or solution architect in recognizing and mitigating any risks to the solution's overall success
Analyzes industry, technology and market trends to determine their potential impacts on the enterprise infrastructure architecture.
Partner with supporting function such as security, sourcing, engineering, architecture for design review and completeness

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY:

2-3 years of related experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
Basic knowledge of the aspects of an Enterprise Technical Architecture
Ability to develop Technical Approach, Design Documents and Architecture Position Statements
Deep knowledge in a minimum of two of the following technical disciplines: network design, security design, middleware, distributed systems, storage, end points or database platforms
Natural curiosity, independent decision making, strong leadership, analytical and technical skills
Ability to articulate complex concepts
Ability to summarize complex business concepts into written & oral communications using PowerPoint and other data presentation tools.
Polished, well-spoken, and a collaborative person with a high level of written and verbal communication skills.

CAREER DEVELOPMENT:
It’s not just a job, it’s a career, and we are here to support you every step of the way. We want you to be successful and fulfilled. Through on-the-job experiences, personalized coaching and our robust learning and development programs, we encourage you – at every level – to grow and develop.

BENEFITS:
We offer comprehensive benefits to help you be healthy, build financial security, and balance work and home life. At The Hanover, you’ll enjoy what you do and have the support you need to succeed.

401K with a company match
Tuition reimbursement
PTO

Mission
YOUR FUNCTION:

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. To support our unit, we are looking for a data architect who can help our customers to build and execute a data strategy.

You are convinced that data is the new oil and are able to convince customers of the value of data. You are able to design a modern data architecture, but also to guide the customer in the way the organize themselves to become a data- driven company.

You are eager to support the data value proposition and providing pre-sales effort.

What we expect you to do:

Design and build E2E modern data platform architectures (Data engineering, visualizations, AI and MDM).
Guide the customer in his journey to become a data driven organization
Create and roll out data governance strategies and data management processes
Manage projects in an agile way to maximize the business value of the customer
Lead data consultants in executing various practice initiatives.
You actively participate in pre-sales proposals in which data, data engineering and data science is positioned or where related tools support the project. You work out (preferably together with the team) an approach, estimates and budgeting.
Support sales proactively and convince customers to invest in data solutions.

Profile
YOUR PROFILE:

• You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience• You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends• You have a hands-on background in different data domains (MDM, Data Engineering, Big Data, Data Science, etc.)• You have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.• You are able to implement a data governance policy and you can guide the customer through the necessary changes of becoming a data driven organization • You have excellent communication skills and report smoothly (both oral and written)• You have a commercial attitude and are able to convince customers to work with us.• You are used to giving presentations to clients at a management level, but you have sufficient insight into the technical matters to be able to talk along on that level as well.• You can handle stress and a multi-focus job.• You have a pro-active, can-do mindset• You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken)

OUR OFFER:

• The opportunity to have a meaningful job where you can make a difference• The chance to continuously evolve as a professional, coupled with a variety of training opportunities• Relevant career opportunities to get you where you want to be, with the IT knowledge you need• Inetum-Realdolmen wants you to find a balance between work and private life by offering flexible hours, satellite offices and home working• 32 days of annual leave, because life isn’t all about working• Forget about the miles: we provide you with a company car and a national fuel card.• Group insurance and hospitalization insurance, because we care about you• And of course, we also offer a gross salary. One which is optimized from a net perspective for our employees!

Are you a Windows guru, a SQL Server master or a C# superstar? Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and utilize your existing Microsoft technical skills to help customers move to the AWS cloud? Do you want to learn the latest cloud computing technologies and play a part in making history? Do you like finding innovate ways to solve technical problems and learning how some of the largest enterprises build their architectures?

As a Solutions Architect for the Microsoft technology stack you will help customers accelerate their adoption of AWS, and analyzing the technical aspects of building and migrating to AWS. You will also play a key role in working with the AWS Service Teams to help them build the best cloud services on Earth. You will create content and speak publicly about the amazing things that our customers are doing on AWS. Additionally, you will engage with other Solutions Architects and the wider field of technology experts to bring your experience and expertise so they can better support our customers.

Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects; defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform; and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.


Strong verbal and written communication skills
Any AWS certification, preferably associate or professional level, additionally certifications on Azure, MCSA, MCSD, and/or MCSE
Developing high quality, enterprise scale software products
Datacenter migration, especially involving Windows Servers and complex Windows workloads
Designing or managing a large SQL Server implementation
Designing or managing a large Active Directory implementation
Knowledge of .NET Programming (C#) and/or life cycle application management (knowledge of CI/CD including common technologies like Azure DevOps, Git and Jenkins)
Knowledge of cloud services, cloud native design and/or cloud implementation experience
Knowledge of microservices and application modernization techniques
Knowledge of Microsoft licensing and common licensing deployments
Knowledge of infrastructure management platforms like WSUS, SCCM, SCOM
Knowledge of networking design including DNS, routing, traffic management, firewalls and/or private networking
Managing highly available data center operations with responsibility for infrastructure robustness, including networking, server hardware and storage application, server, and network security
Knowledge of the AWS services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement AI, IOT, and data analytics projects that help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, batch/real-time data processing, Data and Business intelligence.
This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Athena, Glue, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB NoSQL, Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon EMR and Amazon Redshift.
Solutions - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, creating packaged Data & Analytics service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.
Insights - Work with AWS engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementations and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services.

Inclusive Team Culture

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

The Alliance Innovation Lab in Silicon Valley, a strategic outpost of the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi automotive group, is seeking qualified researchers to contribute to next-generation intelligent mobility concepts.

We are looking for an experienced ML AI Researcher II to research and develop algorithms for Mobility & Smart City using data from connected and autonomous vehicles, smart infrastructure & ecosystem (e.g. Energy).

The Alliance Innovation Lab in Silicon Valley, a strategic outpost of the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi automotive group, is seeking qualified researchers to contribute to next-generation intelligent mobility concepts. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and applying algorithms that utilize intelligent & autonomous vehicles to address key challenges such as road safety, traffic flow & congestion, fleet management, energy optimization. You will develop algorithms that leverage vehicle technologies inc. V2X, smart infrastructure, real and/or simulated data, etc. in order to provide value to the customer, businesses & future society. The Lab provides opportunities to validate the algorithms in simulation as well as in real world environments.

The organization will look to you to apply your expertise and research experience in more than one of the following areas:

Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence
Reinforcement Learning
Data Analysis & Simulation of Traffic Events
Transportation & Traffic Flow Management
Probabilistic Modeling & Decision Making – e.g. MDP

Job functions include:
Conduct Research in the areas of Autonomous Vehicles, Vehicle Grid Integration, Smart City Integration, Traffic Management, Energy Management.
Identify requirements of and opportunities for novel applications in the domain of intelligent Mobility (e.g. Smart Cities), and work in a team to realize advanced technology concepts
Given concrete application contexts and stakeholder objectives, frame research problems and propose methods for addressing them that demonstrate working knowledge of the state of the art and its limitations
Prototype ideas through software development, leveraging off-the-shelf models, libraries, and tools to your advantage and designing new algorithms as needed
Architect re-usable and re-configurable modules with sensible designs, clear interfaces, well-prescribed assumptions, and well-documented code
Collaborate across disciplines, with other researchers, engineers, designers, and social scientists, to account for aspects of the problem that might otherwise be overlooked
Communicate work effectively through presentations reports, and documentation
Maintain and expand knowledge about research advances and tools by reading papers, maintaining connections with academic and industry research networks, attending conferences, participating in professional organizations, and identifying educational opportunities.

Requirements:
Research expertise and in-depth knowledge in more than one of the technical areas listed above
PhD in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Civil & Transportation Engineering or a related field, or a MS with 3-5 years of industry experience.
Proficiency in at least one of the programming languages in Python, Java and C++
Track record of publications in top-tier Computer Science venues [e.g. AAAI, NeurIPS, ICML, IROS, ICRA], Industrial Conferences or experience filing patents
Experience with ML frameworks & utilities (e.g. AWS SageMaker, Tensorflow, PyTorch) and Simulation Tools (e.g. Sumo)
Ability to develop quality relationships with local partners and across cultural boundaries

Bonus Points:
Experience working on autonomous / connected vehicles, in simulation or in the real world
Experience working with ROS, ideally both in simulation using tools like rviz and running code on a real robot
Hands on experience with the common tools, cloud platforms and frameworks in ML (e.g. Flow, AWS, Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc.)
Authorship of relevant software/libraries available for download on, e.g., GitHub
Hands-on experience with state-of-the-art simulators
Experience in working in a collaborative research lab

Education:
PhD or Master’s Degree (with relevant experience) in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Civil & Transportation Engineering or a related field with a focus on Mobility, Traffic & Smart City areas.

What if your job description were: make tomorrow better? That is the essence of roles within our Microsoft Web Experiences Team (WebXT).
Every day, we bring an insatiable curiosity to the table, challenging ourselves to reimagine what is and what can be. We drive machine intelligence, help shape the future, and empower billions of people around the globe.
We attract new users and change how people think about Microsoft, News, Search, and Advertising. We have a long road ahead, and we need your help! Our products Bing, Content, and Advertising are the beating heart of Microsoft AI.
Join us to keep optimizing and growing our Online Advertising business, one of the fastest-growing businesses on the Internet today, while delighting users with useful ads. Or derive intelligence from MSN, Bing, Web data to delight sports fans and bring the best news to our users. Or make it easy for employees to discover their enterprise content from various data sources exposed through searches on the browser for improved productivity.
Our Data and Applied Scientist roles provide an opportunity to research and apply state of the art machine learning technology to various businesses involving Search, Content, and Advertising.
Interviews for the Data & Applied Scientist will be conducted in partnership with Microsoft’s HBCU Connect event. By applying to this role, you’ll be assessed for multiple, identical positions on several teams.
Responsibilities
Design, prototype, and build Machine Learning Models to derive actionable intelligence for our products: MSN, Bing, Advertising.
Analyze and take decisions based on complex and ambiguous (big) data points.
Work closely with our PM, design, and privacy teams to define feature specifications and build the next generation of products.

The Enterprise Data Architect works with various stakeholders within the business units, PMO and Technology Operations to ensure that the technology objectives and solutions of the enterprise are aligned to the business mission, strategy, goals, and processes.

Do you love games? Do you want to work with the some of the most innovative Game companies in the world? Do you have a passion for helping customers solve web-scale challenges and understand application architectures? Do you want to help build a new, customer-obsessed team and help establish AWS Game Tech as the leading platform in the Games Industry?

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Game Tech Solutions Architecture team is looking for an experienced and motivated technologist with a passion for creating strategies, best practices, and solving complex business challenges focusing on the Games industry.

As an AWS Game Tech Solutions Architect, you will work with some of the most interesting hyper-growth games companies on the planet. You’ll work with startups, indie studios, legendary blockbuster publishers, technology platforms, and middleware partners in the Games industry to help them build better games with the AWS cloud.

The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and should have a deep understanding of Game technologies including engines, platforms, and middleware providers alongside applicable technical use cases, architectures, and development workflow. She/he should also have the ability to connect technology with measurable business value. She/he should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.

Role & Responsibilities

Together with the broader Games teams, help develop the strategic plan for AWS, particularly the technical elements of the strategy and plan to engage customers and partners.
Establish technical credibility in sales cycles (personally or with the broader technical team), and can credibly drive discussions with CTOs, CIOs, Chief Architects, Senior Developers, etc. from both customers and partners across the Gaming industries.
Work with Engine, Platform, and Middleware Technology customers and partners to deploy – pilot and scale – Games industry focused programs in the field working with sales enablement, regional business development teams, and account teams.
Conduct customer briefings, present at customer events, further AWS Game Tech solutions-led thought leadership in the industry domains

Job responsibilities

A passion for Gaming! – Great understanding of how the Gaming industry operates and the unique characteristics and culture of the industry.
Experience in game production, game live operations, solutions development, product management.
Passion for cloud technologies – deep understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms.
Highly technical and analytical. Demonstrated ability to understand the complexities of Game development processes across multiple platforms including mobile, PC, and Console
Technical knowledge of Games industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystem, with ability to go deep on technical aspects to understand current and future customer needs and present AWS technical benefits.
5+ years experience in game production, game live operations, solutions development, product management

Deep knowledge of the AWS Services and their relevance to the Games industry
