Blue Shield of California’s mission is to ensure all Californians have access to high-quality health care at a sustainably affordable price. We are transforming health care in a way that truly serves our nonprofit mission by lowering costs, improving quality, and enhancing the member and physician experience.
To fulfill our mission, we must ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and fully contribute to meet the needs of the multifaceted communities we serve. Our comprehensive approach to diversity, equity, and inclusion combines a focus on our people, processes, and systems with a deep commitment to promoting social justice and health equity through our products, business practices, and presence as a corporate citizen.

Blue Shield has received awards and recognition for being a certified Great Place to Work, best place to work for LGBTQ equality, leading disability employer, one of the best companies for women to advance, Bay Area’s top companies in volunteering & giving, and one of the world’s most ethical companies. Here at Blue Shield of California, we are striving to make a positive change across our industry and the communities we live in – join us!

Your Role

Blue Shield of California is looking for a Principal Salesforce Solutions Architect to join our IT Application Services team. The candidate will be the subject matter expert for the Operations portfolio responsible for the definition & ownership of our real-time streaming claim event processing services & cloud integration platform. This individual will lead technical training, define & enforce standards, and serve as the expert developer & lead consultant responsible for assuring real-time solutions built within the portfolio are highly secure, performant, and robust. This includes effective communication & influence of IT, business, and vendor partners to provide solutions that optimizing for cost, quality, security, and fit for purpose.

Your Work

In this role, you will:
Be a technical champion and advocate for the optimization of Salesforce solutions needed to support Blue Shield’s growth and financial goals
Will serve as IT representative in cross-organizational initiatives that serve to drive scale (growth), cost optimization, quality, and end-user experience
Serve as technical owner for major initiatives impacting the Operations portfolio - establishing trusted relationship with business partners, internal IT organization, other IT portfolio leaders, and key suppliers’ technical teams
Lead solution design and development activities on concurrent complex projects with product, solution, and cross portfolio teams
Provide technical leadership in establishing a competency center that educates other IT professionals on service & cloud-based design & development practices
Effectively communicate approach, value, risk, alternatives, and status of goal progress with executive & senior management, business sponsors, and product managers
Be experienced with relevant software development tools, industry protocols, troubleshooting & support procedures, monitoring & quality controls, and communication/documentation software
Be self-directed, work with limited management direction and exercise considerable latitude in determining technical objectives of assignment
Apply significant knowledge of IT and healthcare industry trends

Your Knowledge and Experience

Requires 8+ years of hands-on design, coding, integration, and deployment experience in Salesforce, with minimum 3+ years of experience on Vlocity/Salesforce Industry-Cloud applications
Very strong technical acumen & deep working knowledge of Agile Methods, Service Architecture, and enterprise Cloud Integration
Experience in Salesforce OmniStudio application including OmniScripts, DataRaptors, Calculation Procedure, Rate matrices, Integration Procedure, Vlocity Templates, Vlocity Cards, Angular JS, JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and Lightning Web Components
End to end Vlocity project implementation experience is preferred
Requires Salesforce Custom application development with Integrations
Extensive experience in Salesforce configuration and development including Workflows, Process Builder, Apex (classes and triggers), Visual Force page, Lightning Components
Requires Salesforce Community implementation experience
Salesforce Domain Architect certification is preferred
Experience in Vlocity Health Insurance Dev, basic and advanced Rate Quote Apply; Health Insurance data model and services; understanding of product models and capabilities
Experience in Application Integration, design and applying to the Vlocity techniques such as Integration Procedures, Apex
Demonstrated ability to formulate strategies, communicate and build alignment on concepts from ideation to execution
Strong ability to influence, collaborate, and build relationships with key stakeholders, vendors, and cross-functional teams
Ability to assess potential opportunities, risks, and issues, and make recommendations to resolve or course-correct as necessary
Ability to effectively manage meetings and work regularly with a variety of stakeholders
Effective verbal and written communication skills including the ability to create, translate, and execute technical deliverables
Proven experience educating & influencing others and collaborating across all functions and levels in a highly matrixed organization
Healthcare experience in Membership, Enrollment, Provider claims processing & payments is preferred (Facets, FHIR)

We Are:
Accenture Interactive—a new breed of agency that’s all about the Experience. For us, customer experience is not an add-on; it’s foundational to who we are and how we empower our clients. As the world’s largest, most disruptive agency, we drive lasting growth for clients by helping them design, build, and run meaningful experiences that make people’s lives better, more productive, and more meaningful. We do this in three ways: by transforming organizations through standout products and services; by building and delivering award-winning campaigns so brands can engage and communicate creatively with customers at scale; and by using our top-notch skills to pilot, integrate, scale, and run the platforms that underpin the world’s greatest experiences. Visit us here to learn more about what makes us the Experience Agency.
As Accenture Interactive's marketing experts, we help businesses drive demand, build brands and change the way people live. From consulting and creative campaigns to insights and analytics, we’ve got the speed, scale and strategic thinking to help CMOs and brands make an impact at every stage of the customer journey. The net-net? Real results that lead to true transformation.
Job Description:
A customers’ experience with a brand spans a lot of people, processes, and of course technology. As a CxO Architect you get what makes customer interactions tick – how we can gather the data in the moment to deliver the right message, or inform the right decision, where it’s marketing progressing customers from awareness to prospects, or cross selling to existing customers, or even informing sales or service about what the customers trying to accomplish. You understand that the best-looking app or website in the world is useless if it can’t leverage the data it needs to have a meaningful customer experience. And clients have come to rely on you for your expertise in getting the right data to the right app at the right time, every time. If you are passionate about data and helping clients truly connect with their customers, we’d like to meet you.
The work:
Drive requirements and design to identify and recommend workable solutions to clients across data driven marketing, single view of the customer, and marketing technology, with a specialization in Customer Data Platforms
Drive platform selection to select the best technology platforms for the job
Create architecture and solution blueprints to meet client requirements
Work with the project management to develop the overall implementation solution plan
Work with data integration technologies to design and implement new solutions and processes for clients to support new customer experience strategies
Work with business and technology client representatives to gather functional and technical requirements
Keep informed of the latest technology trends and innovations especially in the areas of customer data platforms, marketing automation, data integration, master data management, marketing resource management, digital asset management, web content management, mobile, and social media

Here’s what you need:
5+ years of hands-on experience with marketing data
Minimum 1 year implementation experience for one or more Customer Data Platforms
Minimum 3 years hands on SQL experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
Experience with Customer Data Platforms and MDM such as Adobe Experience Platform, Salesforce C360 and Interaction Studio, Microsoft D365 Customer Insights, Oracle CX Unity, Reltio, Redpoint Global, Lytics, Segment, Amperity or ActionIQ
Experience with Technologies and Processes for Marketing, Personalization, and Data Orchestration such as Adobe Marketing Cloud, Oracle Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Experience with marketing campaign design and implementation
Experience in online ad serving or site serving platforms
Experience with technologies and processes for content management systems, digital asset management software, web content management
Experience with technologies and processes for mobile and social media technologies, solutions, and strategies
Full lifecycle implementation experience using various SDLC methodologies
Experience with marketing customer data models, marketing analytics
Experience in a consulting environment and/or digital agency with demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation

Join a team that puts its People First! As a member of First American’s family of companies, Data & Analytics is a national provider of property-centric information, analytics, risk management and valuation solutions. First American maintains and curates the industry’s largest property and ownership dataset with over 7 billion document images. Our major platforms and products include: DataTree®, FraudGuard®, RegsData™, TaxSource™ and ACI®. The First American Data & Analytics division boasts more than 20 patents and remains at the forefront of innovation - leveraging technology and data to deliver best-in-class decisioning solutions. Fueled by our industry-leading data and using our technology and proprietary process, our solutions provide lenders, real estate and title companies with actionable insights - enabling them to make better, increasingly automated, decisions. With offices in all major metropolitan areas, including California and New York, DNA teams work collaboratively from across the country. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for six consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.
Job Summary
Designs, develops, implements, installs, and maintains enterprise level database systems in a multi server environment. Must be able to troubleshoot and correct database problems and to proactively maintain the health of database systems. Create backup/recover utilities according to defined standards. Codes and implements stored procedures and triggers. At the higher levels, interface with the appropriate groups to ensure that database systems meet business requirements.
Essential Functions
Research new database methods and technologies to fully utilize platform features
May provide technical direction/mentoring for other DBAs
May perform project management duties for major database events, such as database upgrades and new product releases
Provides and recommends architecture and infrastructures, which may include security, database objects and backup/recovery
Install, upgrade and configure database management system software
Validate that all physical database designs satisfy business requirements, and meet standards to database objects, data integrity, security, performance and recoverability
Troubleshoot and resolve a wide variety of database problems
Monitor capacity and performance, and proactively resolve a wide variety of problems
Investigates and resolves all performance issue impacting the database
Create backup/recovery utilities according to defined standards
Implements security, providing input for defining standards
Required to perform duties outside of normal work hours based on business needs.
Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used
Project management skills
Expert knowledge of multiple database management systems of depth of skill in one to install, upgrade, configure, design, develop, implement, secure, tune, monitor and maintain required database objects
Advanced skills in enterprise system architecture design
Some groups may require data modeling skills
Typical Education
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Typical Range of Experience
8+ years of directly related experience
License or Certification
Microsoft, Oracle DBA or other related certifications preferred depending on position

Job Title: Sr. Data Architect, Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opport...
Description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical role
8+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS)
5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum)
Experience with prioritization of projects that mitigate trade-offs
Experience in analyzing Data Warehouses such as Teradata, Netezza, Oracle, etc. or Greenplum etc.
Experience designing database environments, analyzing production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and data warehouse modernization. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy data warehouses and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement data warehouse projects that help our customers help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, S3, and Schema Conversion Tool.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Direct Hire - TX
The Enterprise Data Architect is responsible for the overall technology strategy, implementation approach, the Enterprise Architecture framework, governance model and technology standards necessary to support all application portfolios. The role of the Enterprise Data Architect is accountable for providing the overall architectural guidance necessary to support execution of business unit strategies and alignment to enterprise-level initiatives. The Enterprise Data Architect works with various stakeholders within the business units, PMO and Technology Operations to ensure that the technology objectives and solutions of the enterprise are aligned to the business mission, strategy, goals, and processes.
The Enterprise Data Architect will establish, maintain, and communicate a technology vision within an Information Technology discipline. Participates in major technical decisions, develops technical proposals that consider alternatives and business cases, gains needed institution approvals, and works effectively across departmental organizations gaining consensus of stakeholders. Possess and maintains a strong working knowledge of multi-platform technical environments.
Responsibilities will include:
Understands technology trends and the practical application of existing, new and emerging technologies to enable new and evolving business and operating models.Establishes overall data architecture vision and ensures specific components are appropriately designed and leveraged; contributes to the holistic vision of Enterprise Architecture.Maintains components of architecture strategy and vision.Maintains enterprise level EA Principals and Patterns.
Provides consulting support to IT teams within projects to ensure the project is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
Coordinates all enterprise-level conceptual architecture components (e.g., data architecture, application architecture, technical architecture).Monitors usage of architectural components and assumes responsibility for reuse.Drives system migration based upon roadmaps defined in enterprise and domain blueprints.Leads architecture strategy and vision for enterprise.Provides continuous consulting services and direction in projects and architectures.Champions and be responsible for enterprise level technology and architectural standards, guidelines, principles, frameworks, and reference models.
Leads workshops, decision meetings, collaborative sessions, and executive briefings related to a wide range of Enterprise Architecture and IT enabling topics.
Serves as a leader, consultant, mentor, or tutor in many specific technical architecture areas of expertise.Provides key input to short and long-term department strategy and budget planning.
Builds a holistic view of the organization’s strategy, processes, information and technical assets to ensure business and IT alignment.
Job Requirements
Communicates persuasively and effectively to business and technical audiences
Is able to envision the business potential of emerging technologies and products.
Is current in understanding of both developer trends and emerging technologies
Demonstrates an understanding of strategic issues, and is an authority on the systems development life-cycle and typical problems associated with the implementation of information systems, from initial concept through development and implementation to operation and support.
Has sound knowledge of Agile/Lean development methodologies and Continuous Deployment Tools and Techniques. Can ensure that overall Enterprise Architecture Designs and Tool/Vendor selections facilitate and/or support these techniques
Strong technical experience of developing architectures that enable a digital transformation within a business.
Demonstrates understanding of key IT disciplines e.g., strategy, governance, software delivery, budgeting
Practical experience with Architecture service definition and governance including Innovation, IT Strategy, Portfolio Planning, Budget, Solution Architecture
Expertise in industry RDBMS products such as Oracle, MS SQL Server or MySQL database
Expertise in migration from traditional RDBMS solutions to cloud alternatives (RDS, Aurora, etc.)
Expertise in industry non-structured (no SQL) products such as Mongo or Hadoop
Experience with cloud data technology offerings from AWS or Azure.
Extensive logical and physical data modeling
Expertise in using domain driven design principles to lead architects in the creation of canonical models
Expertise in Operational Data Store and data integration processes/procedures
Experience with Data Warehouse and BI systems
Experience with Data integration/movement tools such as Informatica or Talend
equal opportunity employer

Enterprise Data Architect
Location: Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Utah
At Cambia, our members need us more than ever, and to continue serving them, we need to be vaccinated. Following federal mandate, all Cambia Health Solutions employees, including 100% remote workers, need to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 by 1/1/22 .
Be an Agent of Change in Healthcare
At Cambia, we serve as a catalyst to transform healthcare, creating a person-focused and economically sustainable system. We are changing the future of healthcare for the individual by investing in advances in data and technology and employing driven, innovative, and creative people, providing the support required in the relentless pursuit to redefine healthcare for our members.
The Enterprise Data Architect is a seasoned data professional who can formulate, consult, and govern Cambia’s overall data architectural roadmap. Reporting to Cambia’s Head of Data & Analytics, and in partnership with our CTO and the business, this individual provides key technical data leadership in support of Cambia’s data strategy and for the planning and direction of major data initiatives with enterprise-wide impact.
The incumbent has overall responsibility and accountability for the data architecture impacting systems and services across all company business functions in alignment with Cambia’s data strategy. This requires working closely with customers, colleagues, and other partners to identify and improve opportunities to apply appropriate technology and industry standards to converge enterprise architecture, improve data quality, optimize business processes, promote the strategic use of data technology, and enable the workforce to use technology. Success of this position requires innovation, flexibility, perseverance, the fortitude to make change happen, and the ability to communicate optimally with both technical and non-technical teams.
General Functions and Outcomes
Plan, coordinate and be responsible for the update/creation of the strategic data architectural pillars underpinning Cambia’s data strategy. This involves understanding business strategy and direction, collaboration with a wide variety of Technology Leaders, resolving philosophical differences on direction, and providing thought leadership on the best places to invest.
Plan, organize, lead, and communicate the Data Architectural Technology Standards in alignment with other senior technologists to include data modeling and architecture practice leadership.
Responsible for activities that contribute to planning, creating, and implementing a data architectural vision and strategy aligned with the company’s strategic business plan.
As part of the Data & Analytics organization, provide overall enterprise data architecture and system integration design guidance to the organization.
Sees opportunities to effectively use emerging technologies in support of current and future business functions. Supervises the development and adoption of global data & analytics technology standards and standard operating procedures to bring about cost efficiencies and streamline system interoperability.
Supports all architectural disciplines and champions critical initiatives that move Cambia’s data strategy forward by partnering with Cambia’s Enterprise Architecture organization.
Has frequent communication with other companies and outside vendors on data issues and standard methodologies.
Attends conferences and user groups; belongs to professional organizations.
Demonstrable experience in a role the provides thought leadership and management to evolve data strategy.
Ability to lead technical strategy serving to integrate existing platforms and databases, paving the way to simplicity.
Experience designing and producing metrics enable measurement of data strategy value and demonstrate progress toward enterprise strategic alignment to Cambia’s data strategy.
Define migration plans to address the gaps between current and future state, while in sync with budgeting, enterprise architects, and program leadership teams.
Experience with AWS or Snowflake platforms; experience with both is a plus.
Thrives in the development and communicates architectural policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures to guide enterprise architecture decision making focused on data. Ability to exercise independent judgment and creative problem-solving techniques in a highly sophisticated environment using innovative technology and/or integrating diverse user systems.
Leads and facilitates the creation of governing principles to guide enterprise architecture decision making.
Broad knowledge of information technology, with extensive knowledge of several related systems applications and/or technologies.
Dynamic leadership ability that can develop and energize multidiscipline, high-performance work teams to learn and apply new skills/techniques to business needs.
Excellent oral and written communications; an ability to communicate and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.
Previous experience in business process re-engineering or process improvement, involving broad based information systems, applying tools and techniques to effect business change; business systems analysis experience.
Demonstrated competency in critical thinking and leadership with strong abilities in relationship management.
Good interpersonal, negotiating, and marketing skills to work with users, senior management, and external personnel on significant matters, often requiring coordinated activity across organizational lines.
Normally to be proficient in the competencies listed above:
The Enterprise Architect would have a bachelor’s degree BS/BA, Computer Science, Product Management, or related field and 15+ years of experience in a variety of senior data architecture, engineering, or product roles.

A background check is required.

Job Title: PMTS/Software Engineering Architect or Principal Architect
Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Salesforce has various Software Architect/Principal Architect opportunities throughout the company. These positions require excellent technical skills and outstanding analytical and influencing skills paired with phenomenal business insight. It is a multi-functional role that requires alignment building and communication within a large engineering organization.

Open to Fully Remote, Flex (1-3 days/week in the office), or Office-Based (4-5 days/week in office)

Responsibilities/Duties
Oversees and drives the end-to-end architecture of the product
Determines overall architectural principles, frameworks, and standards
Designs solutions that are enterprise scalable and maintainable
Drive strategic technology initiatives, working with Product Managers, other Architects,, Engineers,, SME's and the broader Salesforce organization
Works in a consultative fashion to improve communication, collaboration and alignment among teams inside and outside of the organization.
Analyzes and provides feedback on product strategy
Provides input into long-range product requirements, best practices, and operational guidelines, with focus on continuous improvement of platform reliability and serviceability
Drives research, case studies, and prototypes on cutting edge technologies and how they can be leveraged
Ensures that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence
Participate in the team’s on-call rotation to address complex problems in real-time and keep services operational and highly available.
Skills and Experience:
Mastery in multiple programming languages and platforms
More than 15 years of software development experience
Ability to independently craft and deliver large complex projects
Ability to provide (informal) coaching to team members to support their understanding of the architecture and aid in their technical development
Experience with Agile development methodology (e.g., Scrum)
Ability to work with other architects, principal architects, and Chief Technology Officers to shape the architectural vision and roadmap for the organization.
Develops technical performance architecture that solves most complex performance issues.
Ability to drive long-term design strategies that span multiple complex projects, deliver technical reports and performance presentations to customers and at industry events
Ability to build an environment for transparent and open discussion of all issues. You involve the right people, from your team and others, to resolve critical issues.
Experience in short release cycles, the full software lifecycle. Some roles require experience on a product that was released for public consumption across multiple releases
BS in related field and at least 15 years experience in the Information Technology arena, at least 3 years management or leadership experience in this field
Preferred Skills:
Familiarity with Salesforce platform can be a plus

AVAILABLE OPPORTUNITIES:
Software Architect - Salesforce Data Cloud Integrations

Salesforce Data Cloud is seeking a Principal Engineer / Architect to help us deliver on our integration vision. This role will be focussed on two-way integrations between Data Cloud and other Salesforce clouds such as Sales, Service, Commerce and Communities. Data Cloud. This role is a mix of hands-on experimentation and testing, collaboration with architects within other clouds, and the design and execution of integration services. Eastern time zone is helpful, but all applicants are welcome.
Software Architect -Einstein Machine Learning Platform
Salesforce Einstein is seeking a Machine Learning Engineering Architect to help us deliver on our next generation AI/ML Platform for Salesforce. You will work on designing and bringing extraordinary ML to production on products used by millions of people every day. You will be working with a team of fellow data scientists, machine learning engineers, software developers, product managers and designers and will be part of an awesome team that will drive the future of next generation data-platform for AI applications.
Software Architect - Salesforce Change and Release

Salesforce Change and Release Cloud is seeking a Principal Architect/ Architect to help us deliver on our change management vision. This role will be focussed on integrations with existing systems, Change Traffic Control and other systems to implement controls, build monitoring and auditing capabilities. This role is a mix of hands-on development, architecture and vision collaborating with architects and developers across the technology and products teams. Pacific Standard time zone is preferred, but all applicants are welcome.
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $158,000. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you'll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that.

We've been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There's plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure.
Solutions Architect - Data Replication

Candidates please note: This role can be located anywhere on the East Coast of the United States.

About the role:

As an EDB Postgres Solutions Architect - Data Replication, you listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales engineers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to EDB BDR (Bi-Directional Replication) https://www.enterprisedb.com/docs/bdr/latest/

The role works hand-in-hand with the sales and partner teams to introduce EDB Postgres BDR to a set of customers who are powering the emerging technology economy - where the success of their business is directly tied to the EDB Postgres platform. You will help prospective customers understand the power of EDB Postgres BDR through high velocity and impactful technical business activities working closely with the EDB Postgres cloud operations team to run pilots, explain the technical aspects of the solution, and resolve any potential roadblocks.

EDB Postgres BDR Solutions are for very high availability and geographically distributed workloads on multi-master PostgreSQL clusters, including data movement to or from Postgres, Oracle, and SQL Server clusters

Responsibilities
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical roadblocks.
Manage the technical relationship with EDB customers, including overseeing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.
Work hands-on with customers to demonstrate and prototype EDB BDR product integrations in customer/partner environments.
Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, using best practices, on EDB Postgres Cloud.
Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events.


Preferred qualifications

Experience EDB (formerly 2nd Quadrant Bi-Directional Replication) or other replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate or Similar
Experience with infrastructure architecture including storage, compute, database, and networking.
Experience in, and understanding of, data and information management as it relates to OLTP and big data trends and issues within businesses.
Experience developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems for software centric businesses who reach users/businesses through an app/platforms (e.g., Marketing, Data/Analytics, DevOps, etc.).
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
An understanding of Postgres or other enterprise database platform
Experience with infrastructure architecture including storage, compute, database, and networking

We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We'd love to hear from you and we want you to apply!

EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. EDB was built on a commitment to trust and respect each other and to embrace an array of people and ideas. These values remain at the center of our culture and are key to our company's integrity.

The Enterprise Data Architect is responsible for aligning the future state enterprise information architecture with the corporate strategy. Plays a leadership role in the definition and execution of the Information Management roadmap.

Job Description:
Director, Data Solutions Architect
As a data solutions architect, you will develop the end-to-end data architecture to implement strategic solutions in the Wealth Management domain. You will work closely with the cross functional teams to modernize various products in the domain using external cloud services. As a core member of the data architecture group, you will also responsible to develop modern data processing and integration patterns and partner with engineering teams to implement scalable and resilient data platforms using those patterns.
This position will be based in Durham, NC. The alternate locations are Westlake, TX or Boston, MA.
The Expertise we’re looking for
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) required.
Demonstrated technology leadership experience in architecting, designing and building highly scalable data applications in cloud, preferably AWS.
Extensive knowledge and experience in architecting modern data integration patterns.
Proficient in various data modeling techniques including relational and NoSQL.
Proven experience in relational, NoSQL databases and in-memory databases, especially in Cloud.
Expert ability to evaluate, prototype and recommend open source and vendor technologies.
Experience with DevOps, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery technologies is desirable.
This role requires 7+ years of data solution architecture experience.
Solid experience in Agile methodologies (Kanban and SCRUM)
The Purpose of your role
Director, Data Solutions Architect in PI Customer Data Technologies will drive a holistic information management strategy across data analytics platforms, develop reference architecture and roadmaps to build highly available, scalable and distributed data platforms using open source/cloud frameworks to support digital experiences. This role is also responsible for driving innovation, prototyping and recommending solutions in transactional and operational space. Additionally, collaborate with key partners in the adoption of emerging technologies. This role will not have people management responsibilities.
The Skills you bring
Leadership skills to architect and design critical data analytics capabilities.
Ability to collaborate and partner with business domain leads, product owners, enterprise architects and engineering leads to deliver world class data solutions.
Experience in Event Driven Architecture, Microservices and ETL.
Strong experience in Object Oriented Programming (Java or Python).
Proven ability to inspire confidence, create executive presentations and guide strategic discussions with senior management.
Ability to understand and adapt to changing business priorities and technology advancements
The Value you deliver
Architecting and designing next generation data products.
Exploring new technology trends and leveraging them to modernize our data ecosystem.
Driving Innovation and guiding the teams to implement solutions with future thinking.
Collaborating with internal and external teams to deliver technology solutions for the business needs.
Resolving technical roadblocks to the team and mitigating potential risks.
Acting as a technical mentor to the engineering teams and bringing them up to speed on latest data technologies and promoting continuous learning.
How your work impacts the organization
Customer Data Technology in PI supports the platforms that enable business users to collect and analyze the customer data needed to provide the best customer experience.

Company Overview

At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us

At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning and growth so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. We welcome associates from different backgrounds and with different perspectives to help us innovate and make a difference for our customers and our communities.

We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Job Title: Data Architect - Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opportuni...
Description:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.
5+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) including 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum).
Ability to drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation.
Current hands-on implementation experience required.
Analyze on-premise OLTP database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL and/or Postgres, as well as MPP analytic databases (Teradata, Netezza, Vertica and Greenplum).
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance.
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems.

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, HPC, Batch/Real-time Data processing, MPP systems, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.

This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and database migration capabilities. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy systems and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, EMR, Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), S3, Relational Database Service (RDS)/aurora, and Amazon Kinesis.
Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, generating consulting proposals, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift.
One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner.
Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects.
Industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences.
Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development.
Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability.
Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments.
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, NoSQL storage, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development.
Knowledge of Cloud Computing, AWS services such as EC2, S3, VPC and Redshift.
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.

Job Category
Mulesoft - Customer Success Group
Job Details
MuleSoft’s Professional Services team works across every technology and system to deliver solutions to customers in every industry. As a Technical Architect on our Services team, you will work hands on with our customers and partners to solve critically important business challenges using MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform. You will provide onsite technical guidance on MuleSoft implementation projects, evaluate the customer’s technical and functional requirements, and develop efficient solutions to provide customers with validated returns.
As an Architecture and Development authority, you will help customers realize their business goals and guide them on the most effective solutions for on-premise, cloud, and hybrid integration, and API management.
What you’ll achieve:
3 months:
 Participate in MuleSoft Technical Product and Consulting Services training, methodology, and enablement
Begin participation in field activities with clients by shadowing Senior Architects and practicing enablement gained from training
Begin Mulesoft implementations for customers and start on your journey to internalize business outcomes and business context relevance to MuleSoft implementation methodologies and approaches
Complete MuleSoft technical certifications and fully ramp on technology and implementation methodologies; start to develop and contribute domain expertise and project deliverables to internal knowledge exchange
Begin mentorship and guidance of junior Services team members and help to build out our services organization
12 months:
Continue to lead technical teams through multi-phased delivery projects and provide hands-on delivery guidance to influence standards for development, governance, and operational life cycle
Promote frameworks, project deliverables, standard methodologies/policies and implementations to internal collaboration networks and IP sharing
Find opportunities to expand MuleSoft footprint and drive further services and customer service, lead multiple engagements simultaneously, and drive partnerships and cross collaboration with MuleSoft partners, SIs, and 3rd Parties
Identify ongoing risks and difficulties throughout project experiences in the field and contribute to designing and implementing internal mitigation measures to meet customer needs
Train, coach, and mentor Services team members on hard technical skills and soft skills
Discover opportunities and efficiencies in customers IT operating model, and support implementation of the SLDC pipeline to get greater value out of the Mulesoft platform.
Lead development of technical brown bag sessions and publish/facilitate reusable content to the field
Work with MuleSoft product leadership providing valuable product insight, guiding product direction and features.
Deliver compelling presentations, architectural blueprint documents, and requirements-gathering workshops to influence the strategic direction of our projects and lead customers through solution design
What you’ll need to be successful:
Six to ten years of proven track record leading integration teams and architecting solutions
Proven experiences architecting services integrations with at least two of the following:
MuleSoft or other solutions (e.g., IBM, BEA, Oracle Fusion, TIBCO, Dell Boomi, Progress Sonic, etc.)
API Management solutions (Apigee, Mashery, etc)
one or more on-premise/SaaS packaged COTS (Commercial Off-the-Shelf) solutions for ERP, CRM, e-Commerce, or mobile (e.g. Salesforce.com, NetSuite, Oracle, Siebel, SAP, WorkDay, etc.)
Demonstrable experience managing and architecting for multiple technical integration project SDLCs (Software Development Life Cycle) end-to-end, sometimes simultaneously
Solid understanding of on-premise/cloud-based infrastructures, SDLC pipelines, and deployments/configurations and definition/evangelism of best practices/standards
Demonstrated ability to effectively architect solutions within a diverse technical team of client, SIs, contractors, and internal teams
Experience leading technical teams and mentoring junior level resources, consultants, and clients while leading internal initiatives to grow Services organization practices
Demonstrated experience with High-Availability, Fault-Tolerance, Performance Testing and Tuning parameters on multiple engagements
Demonstrated expertise in architecting, implementing, and supporting enterprise-grade technical solutions meeting complex business requirements while promoting integration methodologies and supporting business case justification to C-level executives
Experience driving technical workshops with technical and business clients to acquire effective services and implementations
Ability to travel up to 75% of the time (varies depending on customer needs, focused within region

Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. We work tirelessly to build this culture, and we’re proud to have been named the #1 Top Workplace in the Bay Area and a best place to work 6 years in a row.

Job Purpose:
 This position is responsible for translating the business partner’s processes and requirements into specific systems, applications, integrations, and/or data designs for very large complex IT & Salesforce solutions; driving decisions, even when requirements are ambiguous. Identifies solution options with associated risks and issues, costs vs benefits, and impacts to the business processes; acting as an advocate for the business partner, ensuring that the architecture designed addresses the business problems; providing architectural direction for design activities. Provides technical guidance to project team areas as appropriate; may lead other architects in the development of solutions across a program or line of business; identifying technical debt and enterprise capability opportunities; providing Salesforce platform capabilities input in the prioritization and road mapping of initiatives for a line of business; facilitating the established standards and guidelines that guide the design of technology solutions; tracking industry trends and maintains knowledge of new technologies to better serve the enterprise’s architecture needs. Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of individual capabilities and business requirements.

Bachelor's Degree.12 years technical experience including:Developing solution architectures for large enterprises while partnering with Enterprise Architects, Business Architectures and Application Architects; driving decisions to Salesforce resolution even when requirements are ambiguousSalesforce Application design and development, particularly with high transaction volumesMiddleware and Integration technology design workMessage-based and Java oriented technologiesKnowledge managementDeveloping standards, reference architectures, and guidelines for enterprise useKnowledge in all areas of data, security, applications or integration architecture and associated technologiesBusiness and financial acumenSalesforce Architecture input in prioritization and road mapping of capability improvements for a line of business.Ability to lead a team of architects to deliver solution architectures that drive capability improvements to a line of business.Architecture trade-off analysesCommunications experience (presentations to ITG and business audiences)Experience leading multifunctional teams or initiativesThought leader within, and external to, the divisionExperience in implementing Salesforce for large applications

Salesforce CertificationsLeading a large team of developers and architects

Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing, Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop, deliver and implement AI, IOT, and data analytics projects that help our customers leverage their data to develop business insights. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, batch/real-time data processing, Data and Business intelligence.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Responsibilities include:

Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Athena, Glue, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB NoSQL, Relational Database Service (RDS), Amazon EMR and Amazon Redshift.
Solutions - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, creating packaged Data & Analytics service offerings.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.
Insights - Work with AWS engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementations and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services.
Innovate - Engaging with the customer’s business and technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math
Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Ability to collaborate effectively across organizations
Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development
Demonstrated industry efficiency in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences
Implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments
Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
Desire and ability to interact with different levels of the organization from development to C-Level executives

The Associate Solution Architect needs to evaluate the technical hardware and software infrastructure of the environment in which they are working and be able to design applications to work optimally within that environment. The Systems Analyst is responsible for understanding the business needs of a client as described in use cases, user stories and functional descriptions and be able to translate them into technical/system specifications that fit within the target technical architecture. The system specifications produced may include artifacts such as process diagrams, flowcharts, system models, data models, database designs, logic models and pseudocode. Duties may also include completing evaluations of hardware and software, giving advice to shareholders about their IT infrastructure and producing cost analysis of potential IT initiatives.Duties and responsibilities Some specific duties a Systems Analyst may be asked to perform include:· Driving technical design work based on functional design· Algining technical design with overall program & application architecture· Interpreting and validating functional specifications· Maintining familiarity with several systems architectures· Documenting how technology can support a business process· Developing detailed technical design specifications for software; identify, evaluate, and develop system/technical requirements that meet functional need, work with Business Analysts and Product Owners to address functional design gaps, recommend functional design adjustments to optimize development velocity, develop plans, rules, approach, formulas, and other design solutions for program and application, provide automated solutions consistent with the overall program and application architecture, ability to understand business process issues and communicate technical solutions to client, architect, and developers, create technical design documents, process guidelines, templates to guide development, develop technical design deliverables and work with QA to implement test plans to ensure developed solutions meet functional and technical designs.· Develop database designs in alignment with overall program and application database design standards; define technical requirements and design for data flows within the BES components, reconcile data across different functional components and harmonize database design and flows among program and application components· Facilitate technical design with Architect, business analysts and business owners; identify areas for reusable modular development, conduct data review, development demos, advise on process improvements and conduct reviews for technical designs with developers· Partner with development team to deliver technical documentationSystems Analyst skills and qualifications · 3-5+ years’ experience as a developer· 7+ years' progressive experience as a Developer, Business Analyst and Systems Analyst· 5+ years’ experience with agile and waterfall methodologies· 5+ years’ experience with cloud-based architecture with containerization, micro services, and API integrations· Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical staff and clients· Ability to present findings and produce reports that document project initiatives· An adaptable and flexible attitude, allowing them to approach and solve a problem by examining it from different angles· Strong interpersonal skills· Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)· Good analytical and problem-solving skills· Collaborative and team-oriented· Ability to learn quickly· Leadership and mentoring skills· Ability to work independently exhibiting strong multitasking and time management skills· Self-motivated· Detail-oriented· Trustworthy· Collaborative, team player· High degree of flexibility and creativity, ability to navigate ambiguity· Bachelors or Master’s degree in MIS or related field of studyDue to recent changes in state and federal guidelines, this position may require COVID-19 vaccination.Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $65.00 - $75.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question(s):Do you have experience with technical design and modern systems architecture? Job Summary:
Location: Virtual
Who are we?
Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment and eCommerce company, comprised of four market leaders: Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, Front Line Management Group and Live Nation Network. Ticketmaster.com is the global event ticketing leader and one of the world’s top five eCommerce sites, with over 26 million monthly unique visitors. Live Nation Concerts produces over 20,000 shows annually for more than 2,000 artists globally. Front Line is the world’s top artist management company, representing over 250 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions, enabling over 800 advertisers to tap into the 200 million consumers Live Nation delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenation.com/investors.
Who are you?
Business Intelligence, as data visualization and storytelling service, is an integral part of the Core Data Services team. We are looking for a seasoned manager to lead and improve BI as a service.
Have you done traditional BI well? Been there, done that - star schema, EDW, report design for ease of understanding the data? Ready to take Business Intelligence to the next level?
A successful candidate will be able to cover a wider range of responsibilities from managing existing BI infrastructure, reports, reporting systems, user demands and SLAs while participating in architecting a new robust offering of data visualization and data storytelling as an extension of an enterprise data platform. This includes developing a robust semantic model and a set of business metrics that can be used to unify data analysis between different departments and use cases, creating a predefined set of best practices for visualizing those metrics, default report layouts and functions that enable geographically diverse and intrinsically complex business to be expressed via easy to consume data analysis interfaces.
Successful candidate must be able to demonstrate ability to build and maintain scalable and robust systems, secure infrastructure, extensive standard operating procedures for ease of maintenance to ensure that data is available to BI users in a predictable, reliable and SLA-supported manner.
THE TEAM
Core Data Services team is at the center of Data and Analytics initiative. We are in the beginning of our journey to build and enterprise data platform capable to be a true underpinning of any data needs for the enterprise. Our mission is to make reliable data available and enable value creation by the data community of engineers, analysts and decision makers. Core Data Services team consists of Platform engineering team, Data Engineering, Data Enablement and Operations team. BI is part of Data Enablement and is a critical component of providing users visibility into the data and providing self-service for interacting with data first hand.
Core Data Services is currently in process of adopting Spark as our main ETL engine and realizing the value of highly functional, performant and transparent Data Lake, all this while maintaining and streamlining existing data infrastructure and doing careful migration. These activities will create new opportunities for business intelligence functionality and effective data value delivery
THE ROLE
This is a unique opportunity for a senior BI architect to own BI tech stack, BI data architecture and best practices at Live Nation Entertainment supporting new level of business demands and expectation for solid data definitions and semantic models to underpin effective data visualizations and support business and analytical decision makers.
The right candidate will utilize prior experience building effective BI environments to re-think and re-define modern functionality of reporting, analysis, dashboarding and aiding decision-making processes. Defining the service model for business intelligence is a new frontier and we are looking for an exceptional architect to conquer it.
Success in this role means satisfied business community with robust BI reporting, effective self-service, stable and secure BI environment based on a modern tech stack.
WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO
Stabilize, document and govern existing BI space
Continuously work with business community to ensure that suite of offered reports satisfy expectations for data latency, report performance and ease of use
Partner with data engineering and data operations teams to design and implement BI data store, effectively manage BI infrastructure and ensure data consistency for BI purposes
Support existing BI environment which includes multiple data sources, multiple BI technologies, large data volumes and large user community. Continuously drive toward simplicity, automation, user self-service
Design and implement effective practices for business intelligence team including SDLC, data integration, change control
Improve and evolve governance and data security practices in BI
Work with other BI teams and architects to share and evangelize best practices, unify tech stack, evangelize enterprise data definitions and consistent metric visualizations
WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING - TECHNICAL SKILLS/COMPETENCIES
Technical skillset to work with large data volumes, advanced data models, low latency, and high business complexity to oversee and create a large set of functional and effective business performance reports and visualization
Advanced SQL skills
Curiosity and drive to learn entertainment and ticketing space and be able to lead conversations about business metrics, dependencies, references and help your user community to understand and internalize the information in BI reports
Ability to visualize data and unlock its power while hiding complexity
Experience in data modeling and ability to understand data lineage, data dependencies and effectively use that to service BI users in a way that all of the complexity is hidden
Understanding of BI vendor space and differences in architecture of BI products, their features, fit for purpose, limitations and map that to the existing use cases and user needs. Prior exposure to Tableau, Domo, IBM Cognos, Looker and other BI solutions
Offer BI as a platform functionality to allow department and product focused BI engineers to build on to of it
Understand Data Cataloging in order to integrate reports with metadata
Experience in supporting a large set of BI reports in production for a variety of use cases ranging from high demand operational reports to highly analytical to strategic.
Solid base in mathematics in order to be able to explain advanced metrics, support users in choosing reports as well as ability to bridge between requirements and technical implementation of specific calculations
Experience building multinational solution for BI
Self-motivated, driven and eager to contribute – with no ego – for the betterment of the team
COVID-19 vaccination will be required for this position subject to legally valid exemptions

GDIT is looking for a Solutions Architect to support our Indian Health Service (IHS) customer. This is a leadership role on an Electronic Health Record (EHR) modernization program, this will include requirements determination, integration/interoperability (Healthcare Information Technology Standards Panel [HITSP]), health information management compliance, experience with roll out of training and adoption programs and providing mission critical support to our customer.As an Architect overseeing the architectural integrity of our solution for IHS, you will be trusted to provide technical leadership for the current and future state of the solution. In this role, your responsibilities will include:
Must have experience in architecting solutions for commercial EHR products.
Must have experience in Health Information Exchanges (HIE).
Must have experience in healthcare data and analytics (Data governance and management).
Must have experience working on large Federal healthcare projects.
Must have experience working with large complex integrated delivery network deployment of an EHR.
Must have the ability to work at the Enterprise level, working and coordinating efforts across numerous resources, sub-contractors and stakeholders.
Create solutions and conduct performance tests to improve availability, performance, reliability, capacity and scalability in the application, system or database layers.
Analyzes performance requirements, translate into detailed performance test plans and create test scripts.
Assess and develop testing, and integration use case scenarios.
Assists in establishing standard SLAs and ensures the system meets the defined SLAs.
Analyzes test results with engineers, product managers, other stakeholders and coordinates with the respective teams for performance tuning.
Understands systems technical architecture, and able to identify the performance implications for different layers of system based on design discussions or architecture documents.
Architect solutions on the cloud designing infrastructure and selecting viable technology stack(s).
Excellent communication, organization, and analytical skills.
Ability to multi-task and handle changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and simply.
Lead multiple teams driving solution architecture, security and performance.
Provide mentorship to juniors and build the full stack capability within the company.
Provide support to business development team through injection of technical solutions and architectural improvement.
Provide leadership to design, develop, integrate and sustain (break/fix) support for systems and associated interfaces in pre- and post-deployment phases. Leadership support to technical activities to stabilize system operation and ensure suitable system performance may also be required.Analyze and study complex system requirements. Manage system implementation and support using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, and other accepted design techniques. Estimate implementation costs and schedule. Review existing programs and assist in making refinements, reducing operating time, and improving current techniques. Supervise software configuration management. Review current status of system applications and prepare recommendations for systems improvements.Also, develop plans and requirements in the subject matter area for moderately complex to complex systems related to information systems architecture, networking; telecommunications, automation, communications protocols, risk management/electronic analysis, software, lifecycle management, software development methodologies, and modeling and simulation. Perform functional allocation to identify required tasks and their interrelationships. Identify resources required for each task. Demonstrate exceptional oral and written communication skills. Commensurate experience in IT and in new and related older technology that directly relates to the required area of expertise.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
20+ years of experience as an Architect for large-scale enterprise applications.
HITSP experience with an understanding of LOINC, HL7, HL7 FHIR, SNOMED, RxNorm as well as DICOM standards – Open standards in Healthcare Information Technology (HIT)
Experience with Ancillary systems, include: Pharmacy, Radiology & Laboratory Information Systems
Familiarity with acute and ambulatory settings
Understanding of Telehealth technology
This position is a remote role, but must be willing and able to travel up to 25% at times to customer and senior leadership meetings.
Strong experience with MS Office suite of products.
Experience in Application performance monitoring tools
Candidate MUST be able to obtain a Public Trust.
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.

The likely salary range for this position is $151,184 - $257,012, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.
